Name: Aujourd'hui Demain
Address: 42 Rue du Chemin Vert, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews: As far as vegan restaurants go in Paris, this is the BEST one! We went twice in a week because it was so good. There is a also really cute thrift shop in the back of the main seating area. Outdoor seating is available. Be aware that there can be a short wait for lunch unless you are a pair or small group. They have amazing lunch specials as well that you can take advantage of. | Visited during a trip to Paris and had a wonderful time eating here with my partner and our friend! The food is all vegan and tastes incredible!  All three of us got the same dish which had really tasty pancakes scrambled tofu "eggs" that were almost exactly like the real ones! A very delicious vegan sausage and a salad with potatoes. It was incredible!  (I also ordered their mac and cheese with vegan chicken and parmesan that was incredible. Just be warned I ordered the smallest bowl for 8‚Ç¨ and I ended up sharing it with my partner because it was so big!)  We were all stuffed after eating it all but still made room for dessert.  I had their take on the Snickers bar in cake form and it was better than the real thing. My partner loved hers and our friend had nothing but great words with theirs.  They also have a mini shop inside the restaurant that sells almost everything they serve which would allow you to try your hand at making it yourself at home. If I wasn't visiting the city I would definitely stop here not just to eat but also shop!  Would 100% recommend! | Make a reservation in advance! This place was so busy, but for good reason! Everything I ate here was delicious. I wasn‚Äôt expecting to be able to have most classic French dishes as a vegan, but I had a mouth-watering croque monsieur! I was so excited to get to have one in Paris! I also tried two of the desserts, one cheesecake and one white cake with strawberries, and both were good, but the sandwich was great. I would definitely come back here if I‚Äôm in Paris again. | This is the only restaurant in the world where I was willing to sit outside for an early dinner, even though it was cold üòÑ (Because everything inside was full, I can understand why!) Excellent food, I especially appreciate the Harisa Cauliflower and tiramisu, amazing! Thank you! | An absolute dream space for vegans! The menu has interesting options, fair prices, and everything is delicious. The cake selection is unreal - banoffee pie, fig cheesecake, pistachio pastries... And everything is totally vegan. They also have a beautiful shop with clothing, food, beauty products, all vegan and eco. I nearly spent all my money here on the 1st day of the trip üòÇ totally recommend!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Aujourd'hui Demain  Keywords: Vegan restaurant, Paris, lunch specials, outdoor seating, pancakes, scrambled tofu "eggs", vegan sausage, salad with potatoes, mac and cheese, Snickers bar cake, mini shop, reservation, croque monsieur, French dishes, cheesecake, white cake, Harisa Cauliflower, tiramisu, fair prices, banoffee pie, fig cheesecake, pistachio pastries, vegan and eco products.

Name: Green Farmer‚Äôs
Reviews: A great vegan friendly place to visit. We arrived at 6pm and got sat straight away, food didn‚Äôt take long to come and it was really tasty and lots of options. I had the hot dog and fries.  Only issue was the restaurant is very small, about 4 tables and it started to get busy when we were eating and people were standing right behind us waiting. So I suggest going at quieter times in the day | I had a couple Uber eats from here and it never disappoints. This time came by for lunch and ordered fish and chips, for 17 bucks I got served enough food for 2 people easily‚Ä¶ it was fast and tasty. Wish it was a bit closer to me so that I could come by more frequently ü•≤ | Amazing burgers, lots of options, great friendly service (we are English tourists and ordered in English). Really good music and chilled atmosphere. Open kitchen so you can see the chefs at work. Loved it! | Being a tourist trying to find something vegetarian and vegan we came across this lovely little place.  Our group came back a few times as the food was just incredible, the burgers are divine and the tofu bowl was also packed full and the veg was so fresh.  The staff were so friendly and tolerated our terrible attempts at speaking French, helped us work out the best meal deal for each of our group, highly recommended trying here if you are a vegan and looking for a good burger | Green Farmers is a small, petite gem that managed to comfortably accommodate our group of 15, with room for one more family inside and additional seating outside. Despite its size, the restaurant‚Äôs ambiance was cozy and inviting.  A special shoutout to Joslyn, one of the staff members, who was absolutely amazing. He went above and beyond to cater to our individual dietary requirements, including some off-menu allergy restrictions. His attentive service truly enhanced our dining experience.  Most of us opted for their signature burgers and sides. We sampled a combination of the ‚ÄúGreen Smash,‚Äù ‚ÄúGreen Bacon,‚Äù ‚ÄúGreen Chicken,‚Äù and ‚ÄúGreen Fish‚Äù burgers. Each burger was paired with different sauces that were all succulent and tasty as hell. The fries were particularly noteworthy, fried with the skin on, offering a unique and welcome option that added to the overall deliciousness of the meal.  The restaurant is located in the hub of an ‚Äúadult‚Äù area of Paris, so keep your children distracted when making your way there!  We were so hungry and eager to dig in that we forgot to take pictures of our meals. Trust us, they were demolished quickly because they were that good!  Overall, Green Farmers delivers on flavor and service, making it a must-visit spot for vegan food lovers.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Green Farmer‚Äôs  Keywords: - Cuisine: Vegan, Vegetarian - Unique Dishes: Hot dog, Fries, Fish and chips, Burgers (Green Smash, Green Bacon, Green Chicken, Green Fish) - Ambiance: Cozy, Inviting, Chilled atmosphere, Open kitchen - Special Features: Vegan-friendly, Small, Accommodating, Friendly service, Attentive staff, Signature sauces, Fresh ingredients - Positive Mentions: Tasty food, Lots of options, Fast service, Good music, Helpful staff, Good value for money, Unique fries with skin on, Comfortably accommodated large groups, Individual dietary requirements catered to, Highly recommended, Must-visit for vegan food lovers, Located

Name: B.Better
Reviews: Definitely our favorite meal in Paris! The owner was so kind and personable. We had the tasting menu and everything was amazing! The broccoli and fried green beans were to die for and I‚Äôm still thinking about them. We loved the mixed drinks as well. Such a stellar vegan restaurant!! | Simply wow! Delicious food and amazing staff! My husband and I shared the cauliflower skewers, candied eggplant, and mushroom fritters from the Tapas menu and the not-chicken tacos. We also had the chocolate cake with strawberries and Chantilly cream. I can‚Äôt pick a favorite because they were all really delicious, incredible balance of flavors, and just the right amount of everything! In addition to the amazing food is the kindness that comes from the staff, Lucas, and everyone was so welcoming, kind and show so much love with the food they serve! This will be our ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù spot every time we are in Paris from now on! | Be Better Restaurant in the 4th arrondissement of Paris is a delightful haven for anyone seeking fresh, soulful vegan cuisine. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a modern yet cozy vibe that makes you feel right at home from the moment you step in.  The menu is thoughtfully crafted, showcasing the best of plant-based ingredients with a creative twist. We started with the barbecue broccoli, which was a revelation‚Äîperfectly charred, tender, and bursting with smoky flavor. It was a wonderful introduction to the culinary journey that followed.  Next, we enjoyed the mushroom tacos, which were rich and earthy, with a satisfying blend of textures. The mushrooms were cooked to perfection, and the tacos had a depth of flavor that made them truly memorable. The potatoes were another highlight‚Äîcrispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and seasoned just right.  To finish, we indulged in the roasted plum dessert. It was a beautiful balance of sweetness and tartness, with the apricots offering a fresh, vibrant note that made the dish both refreshing and indulgent.  Overall, Be Better Restaurant is a must-visit for vegans and non-vegans alike. The food is not just a meal but an experience, with each dish prepared fresh and served with care. If you‚Äôre in Paris and looking for a place that offers both taste and heart, Be Better is the place to be. | One of the best vegan restaurants we've ever been to. I want to thank the staff for our amazing visit the other week whilst we were on a trip from the UK for the weekend. We spent some time at other vegan places on our trip, but this was the best one by a long way! The staff were so friendly and inviting, really helpful, and fun as well. They really care about making you feel welcome and cosy. We decided to both have the no chicken tacos which at first seem quite expensive, but when you try them, they are 100% worth the cost. I'm more than happy to pay for this quality of food. The flavours are amazing, the produce is so fresh and locally sourced, and you can tell they have taken time to create the perfect balance of ingredients. The desserts and hot chocolates were absolutely delicious also, with no complaints. I'd happily spend all day there eating their food ü§ó  Thank you again for the amazing service! | The best vegan place in Paris. The food was perfectly prepared. You could taste the work, thought and love that went into every dish and drink. The service was perfect, the ambiance very comfy. While we were eating another batch of fresh mushrooms and potatoes was delivered by bike in wooden crates - so you know everything's  fresh!
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: B.Better - Cuisine Type: Vegan - Unique Dishes: Broccoli and Fried Green Beans, Cauliflower Skewers, Candied Eggplant, Mushroom Fritters, Not-Chicken Tacos, Chocolate Cake with Strawberries and Chantilly Cream, Barbecue Broccoli, Mushroom Tacos, Roasted Plum Dessert, No Chicken Tacos - Ambiance: Warm, Modern, Cozy, Comfy - Special Features: Tasting Menu, Tapas Menu, Fresh Ingredients, Locally Sourced Produce, Thoughtfully Crafted Menu, Kind and Personable Owner and Staff, Welcoming Environment - Positive Mentions: Amazing Food, Stellar Vegan Restaurant, Delicious, Incredible Flavors,

Name: Le Petit Veg
Reviews: It is a small, humble place, but the taste is mind blowing.  I had visited this place a year ago and was so impressed that I was determined to try this again during another visit to Paris. And it happened today! | Best barotta in paris!! The portions are generous and the 5 different curries that include a kurma and an aubergine curry (my favorite) are delicious. We also tried and loved the idlies- they were really soft and the chutneys were so tasty. Will be a regular! | Awesome Indian food and great place for vegans.  The restaurant is a bit small though with very few seats. We enjoyed our meals nonetheless. | This restaurant is a little gem in city of Paris. Whenever I go to get some Indian groceries, I bring back some paranthas, curries and samosas with me. This restaurant serves very delicious South Indian food. It‚Äôs a like a home away from home. The food is always fresh, hot and served fast. Love their samosas which have a different flavour profile than North Indian samosas üòä Full marks to the team preparing the food !! | Heaven! Authentic Indian food, very flavourful and delicious. Everything is vegan, including the mango lassi. 10/10
Keywords: - Cuisine: Indian, South Indian - Dishes: Barotta, curries, aubergine curry, idlies, chutneys, paranthas, samosas, mango lassi - Ambiance: Small, humble, cozy - Features: Vegan-friendly, generous portions, authentic flavors - Positive mentions: Mind-blowing taste, gem in Paris, fresh and hot food, fast service, different flavor profile

Name: Sweet Rawmance
Reviews: I ordered a raw pizza and a pink raspberry raw cake. The pizza was very tasty and filling (the crust was thick with great consistency, and the toppings were a perfect combination). However, allow me to suggest using a bit less salt as I found it very salty. The cake was also tasty, although I would have preferred a thicker raspberry cream layer on top to better balance the cashew cream layer. Prices are fair considering the location and the raw materials needed to make the raw meals and cakes. The positive experience was enhanced by the friendly staff and their beautiful smiles, which made me feel warmly welcomed and led me to give 5 stars. Thank you. | Pretty good but I really wish this place offered a raw vegan salad main dish. They seem pretty into raw foods, they have raw desserts and even a raw pizza but not a raw salad on the menu (other than a tomato salad which is just sliced tomatoes so that's not a meal but more of a starter.) Since I was looking for a nice raw salad, I ordered the kale salad but removed the quinoa and sweet potato. Without those however the value at 16 euros was not there for the quantity given. So it would be great if there could create a nice raw salad, even using ingredients they already have in the kitchen for the correct price and quantity. I'm only giving it 3 stars because although I love the concept, the setting is beautiful, and the servers are kind, the food was also way too salty. I've had r salad two times in the last few months and both times were way over salted. I hope they can correct these things so I can update the score. Side note, the homemade mayo is fantastic though. | Wonderful location, montmarte is right on top of this street and there‚Äôs a beautiful view. The staff are super friendly and sweet, what a wonderful vibe. We had the cheeseburger, Porto burger, pink latte, delice raw cake and chocolate raw cake, everything was so delicious. Highly recommended. | Had some amazing fresh food here. Sat in the back outside area which was really peaceful. I got one of the salads which was an incredible combination.  To drink I had a beet latte which was just the right amount of sweetness. For dessert I tried the berry cake which was refreshing. Our servers were friendly and recommended some great dishes. | Loved it! A bit pricy but I guess that‚Äôs Paris üòÇ my husband had the burger and and soy meat was tasty aaaaaf!! I had the mushroom crepes with a yummy side salad. Def recommend to anyone wanting to have some healthy vegan food!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Sweet Rawmance   Cuisine Type: Raw vegan   Unique Dishes: Raw pizza, pink raspberry raw cake, kale salad, cheeseburger, Porto burger, pink latte, delice raw cake, chocolate raw cake, beet latte, berry cake, mushroom crepes   Ambiance: Beautiful location in Montmarte, peaceful back outside area   Special Features: Friendly staff, fair prices, homemade mayo, vegan options   Positive Aspects: Tasty food, friendly servers, great recommendations, healthy vegan options   Critiques: Salty dishes, limited raw salad options, value for quantity at times

Name: Wild & The Moon
Address: 19 Pl. du March√© Saint-Honor√©, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: Great and innovative cafe. The food is incredible, healthy and inspiring. The staff is so friendly and the vibes are comfortable with plenty of seating, indoor and outdoor.  I loved the jacks bowl and the Bahn mi. It was fresh and tasty. I do wish the portions were a bit bigger for the cost, or the entrees came with a side, but overall incredible food.  Dessert, definitely try the rice crispy treat with poppy seeds, so delicious ü§§ | If you like or need gluten free food then this is a must. Great location and ambience too. Especially outside - when there's no construction though. Was there when there was construction across the street and it was... LOUD. Not heard when inside the resto though but the weather was so nice so we just stuck it out. | I really enjoyed my meal here! The Jack‚Äôs Bowl was really great and combined so many flavors to form a really well-rounded dish. As a vegetarian, sometimes I feel like I‚Äôm missing out on food like this so this was a great experience. The bowl was ‚Ç¨12.5 which for the area seemed really fair. I loved how everything on the menu was both vegan and gluten free. The staff were really friendly and patient when I spoke to them in English. I would definitely come again! | Nice place to sit and do some work. Smoothies were delicious would buy many if they weren't so pricey... Cookies were delicious but very small for the price. The Bounty was lush. | Ever since I came to Paris I was looking something healthy vegetarian option and OMG found this cafe! Fresh, healthy, a lot to choose from and decently priced. The quantity was good and the food was delicious ü§§ Now this is my Go-to place for the rest of my trip! And the great part, since I don't even eat Vegan meat, the staff was very kind enough to remove it from my dishes and made them custom :)
Keywords: Keywords: - Restaurant: Wild & The Moon - Cuisine: Cafe, healthy, vegan, gluten-free - Dishes: Jack's Bowl, Bahn mi, rice crispy treat with poppy seeds, smoothies, cookies, Bounty - Ambiance: Comfortable vibes, indoor and outdoor seating, great location - Features: Vegan and gluten-free menu options, friendly staff, customer customization - Overall: Innovative, fresh, delicious, well-rounded dishes, decently priced, good quantity

Name: Jah Jah By Le Tricycle
Reviews: Great African and vegan restaurant in the center of Paris. Meals are absolutely delicious with all savoury new flavours, not too spicy. I loved it! Sides and desserts are great too. Try the different teas on the menu, really good. It's sometimes hard to find a savoury vegan restaurant but this place is a keeper! Gluten free options available on the menu. The service is great and the decor is original.  I'll come back anytime! You have to try it! | Everything here was really good. It‚Äôs a great vegan spot that for some reason when you googled the best vegan food in Paris doesn‚Äôt show up on a lot of list but I would definitely come here again. The area is mostly local Parisians compared to some of the other vegan spots in the city. | Great African and vegan restaurant in the center of Paris. Meals are absolutely delicious with all savoury new flavours, not too spicy. I loved it! Sides and desserts are great too. Try the different teas on the menu, really good. It's sometimes hard to find a savoury vegan restaurant but this place is a keeper! Gluten free options available on the menu. The service is great and the decor is original.  I'll come back anytime! You have to try it! | Ital is vital!  Good food. And good dining atmosphere inside, would be amazing if the young staff aren‚Äôt always super lethargic , it truly does not go with the irie vibe ‚Ä¶.  Other than that not much to complain about üòÖ  Gets super crowded as soon as it opens. Try being a few minutes early to catch a table. | The most delicious food. A must-visit for vegans in Paris! The service was quick and friendly, and we loved the atmosphere.
Keywords: Jah Jah By Le Tricycle, African cuisine, vegan restaurant, Paris, delicious meals, new flavors, not too spicy, sides, desserts, teas, gluten-free options, original decor, attentive service, local Parisians, good dining atmosphere, young staff, energetic vibe, crowded, quick service, must-visit for vegans.

Name: Restaurant VEGE
Reviews: Pure vegetarian Turkish restaurant! Food is great. Portions are moderate. Friendly and quick service. Not expensive for Paris standards. Lemon juice was too sir, need sugar. Toilet flush need to be fixed | Cozy vegetarian restaurant with vegan options, atmosphere and music is fantastic, personal is fast and speaks English, but not so communicative. The food was pretty good! The location is so convenient. | We absolutely loved the food here. The flavors were  amazing. Everything we had was scrumptious. We would love to come back again. | Great vegetarian restaurant. We ordered starters to share (yummy) and then veggie burger and moussaka. All very much appreciated and tasty. The 2 vegetarians in our group were very satisfied (as was the rest) | Such a cute spot for incredible vegetarian and vegan Middle Eastern food. The salad with hummus and falafel is an absolute MUST. It sounds simple but the meddly of ingredients and flavours is amazing. They also have a full selection of wines and alcohol which was a nice plus.
Keywords: Restaurant VEGE, Pure vegetarian, Turkish cuisine, moderate portions, friendly service, affordable, lemon juice, cozy ambiance, vegan options, fantastic atmosphere, English-speaking staff, convenient location, amazing flavors, scrumptious, starters, veggie burger, moussaka, Middle Eastern food, hummus, falafel, wine selection

Name: Le Potager du Marais
Reviews: I don‚Äôt usually seek out vegan places and will usually eat anything, an omnivore if you will. But I do love food and in the sea of mediocre French bistros catered to tourists looking for caricatures of French cuisine, food made creatively and with passion need planning and time to seek out.  Le Potager du Marais deserves to be one such establishment though it was a place I just chanced upon. I already had lunch so I had only the French onion soup, and it was truly delicious and might be one of the best specimens I‚Äôve had.  Looking at what my neighbours at the next table are eating. It looks like a return to visit needs to be planned. | Cozy and down to earth restaurant offering all traditional French dishes. The buckwheat crepe with mushrooms, leeks and veggies was delicious. The mains came with a decent amount of salad as well. The french onion soup was good just a bit salty. | This restaurant is absolutely excellent. To enjoy French vegan food is such a unique experience (as an overseas traveller) and I'm grateful for this restaurant providing the opportunity to enjoy some very fine French cuisine! Our waiter was wonderful, attentive and made our night fun. The French onion soup is a must if you're visiting! I feel like I'd travel to Paris again just for the soup! Merci beaucoup üôè | Fantastic restaurant that I recommend everyone to visit. Every vegetarian or vegan should definitely visit it. The dishes are delicate, beautiful, tuned to perfection. Thank you for a wonderful gourmet experience. | We loved it so much. Every time we are in Paris this is the first restaurant we book. The owner is amazing and its always a pleasure to see him! Best Vegan restaurant with traditional French cuisine!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Le Potager du Marais   Cuisine Type: French, Vegan   Unique Dishes: French onion soup, buckwheat crepe with mushrooms and veggies   Ambiance: Cozy, down-to-earth   Special Features: Traditional French dishes, attentive service, gourmet experience   Positive Mentions: Creative, passionate, delicious dishes, must-try French onion soup, returning customers, best vegan restaurant, amazing owner, popular among vegetarians and vegans

Name: Wild & The Moon
Reviews: If I lived in Paris, ‚ÄúWild & the Moon‚Äù would have been my daily place to eat. We were visiting the city just for a few days, so I haven‚Äôt tried many options, but what I did - was surprisingly tasty. The ‚ÄúGlow Bowl‚Äù was divine! Also I tried cinnamon roll - was fresh and tasty, not too sweet. The waiters were helpful. Pleasant interior. Also very convenient that they have several locations. I highly recommend ‚ÄúWild & the Moon‚Äù to those who appreciate tasty and healthy (and ethical!) food. | What I liked  What I did not like - waitress/batista brought us the cups touching the top (NO GO) - as shown on the pic - very dry orange cake - coffee was OK, not super  Cannot recommend. Do not understand the hype | Had a beautiful salad bowl whilst visiting a show and a pistachio muffin. Both tasted great and was so amazing to see a vegan eatery in Paris like this. There was once a time when it was difficult to find something vegetarian in France let alone vegan. The menu was fab with lots of choice and I‚Äôll definitely eat here again when in Paris. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è. | Protein shake was so good, coffee and cake as well. It did take some time to get my order despite the place being quite empty. Really great vibes and space for working from a cafe! | Had a great lunch at this lovely vegan eatery. Only thing I would change the next time I‚Äôm back is perhaps to ask for less sauce for my Jack‚Äôs Bowl. It was a little too much and overwhelming.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Wild & The Moon - Cuisine: Vegan/Plant-based - Unique Dishes: Glow Bowl, Cinnamon Roll, Pistachio Muffin, Protein Shake - Ambiance: Pleasant, Great vibes, Space for working - Special Features: Ethical food, Multiple locations, Vegan eatery - Positive Mentions: Tasty, Healthy, Fab menu, Helpful staff, Convenient locations, Great lunch, Variety of choices, Easy to find vegetarian/vegan options, Coffee and cake, Beautiful salad bowl - Criticisms: Cups handled improperly, Dry orange cake, Long wait time, Overwhelming sauce in Jack's Bowl.

Name: Sol Semilla
Reviews: Salads need to be so complicated that you aren't able to easily remember everything that you tasted. They should also have a startling ingredient that makes you think "I wasn't expecting that!". This place achieved that and, having gone two nights in a row, I realised, to paraphrase Heraclitus, you can never have the same salad twice. The delicious dessert was presented in a little pot that made you have to run your finger round the inside to get every last morsel; something my mum told me was terribly bad manners ... which is probably why I enjoyed it so much. Excellent and surprising. | The food is perfection! Great flavoura and nice portions! It is a small place but is worth it. The service is great too. | Best restaurant ever!!! And we are not vegan!!! We are not vegetarian!!! But we love great food! You can tell how much passion the chef puts on his dishes once I‚Äôm you taste them! The service is amazing, the atmosphere is laid back and inviting! You leave the place wanting to come back the next day! Food that is good for the soul! If in Paris, you should come to Canal St. Martin to taste this! You will be well surprised and won‚Äôt be disappointed! | Amazing, delicious, fresh and locally sourced and inspired food. Highly recommend the dish of the day. The turmeric hummus is incredible! White wine recommendations paired perfectly. 10/10  The place is super cute, and has some great seating. The padded chairs are nice in the hot weather. Our server was kind enough to translate the entire menu from French to English as well. | This is a lovely cozy lunch spot serving fresh, healthy, clean and flavorful food. The plates are large. The  service comes with a smile; it has good energy and a positive vibe.  I had the soup Which I really loved. I added salt and pepper. I preferred that they To the customer. It was wonderful as is, but I really like my salt.  My daughter had the plate of the variety of vegetables and salad. It was so good. We were so full we had no room for dessert sadly.  This area has a few plant-based options. I‚Äôd like that we could sit inside and there are a couple spots at the bar.
Keywords: Cuisine type: Vegan, Vegetarian, Plant-based Unique dishes: Complicated salads, Dessert in a little pot, Turmeric hummus Ambiance: Cute, Cozy, Laid back, Inviting Special Features: Locally sourced ingredients, Large portions, Menu translation, Good service, Positive vibe

Name: Maslow - Restaurant Paris 1
Address: 14 Quai de la M√©gisserie, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: I guarantee you, whatever you order here will be flavourful and keep you wanting more. Super superb find. Servers are friendly. Portion sizes could be better but its tapas bar , so cant complain too much , but otherwise we loved it! Each dish was very well curated with new flavours and played well too!  The energetic atmosphere and tasty foods will bring you back to this restaurant often :) | Everything was fabulous! The food was so delicious, the vibes and stuff also great. Fast service too. Very happy we came here. One thing I would love is to see more vegan options on the menu ‚ò∫Ô∏è | Kinda obsessed with this spot- super fun worldly vegetarian cuisine that proves an important point, especially to the frenchies- avoiding meat and seafood doesn‚Äôt have to bland and boring. Tapas like small plates that are flavorful with creative fusions and fun creative plating. Staff are nice and drinks are fun and the decor is cool. Reserve ahead! | Impressive place with a refreshingly international food menu that takes inspiration from cultures worldwide to create plant based dishes that aren't boring or bland. I would give it a 4 though and not a 5 because of the portion sizes - while I'm generally fine with small portions, the restaurant did advertise these plates to be shared and I felt the portions could've been slightly bigger given that. | The terrace view. The servers. The food ‚Äî wonderful. Had a super long lunch sharing 5 plates between two of us. Squeezed dessert in too :)‚Ä¶ Cedric was our server, but the whole team was friendly and efficient. Prices were definitely fair for Paris. High quality, creative, and damn good. Especially the tamago egg - but the menu changes with the season, so enjoy whatever is their new creation. Woot!
Keywords: - Maslow - Paris - Tapas bar - Flavourful dishes - Friendly servers - Energetic atmosphere - Tasty foods - Fabulous vibes - Fast service - Vegan options - Worldly vegetarian cuisine - Small plates - Creative fusions - International food menu - Plant-based dishes - Refreshing - Terrace view - Fair prices - Tamago egg - Seasonal menu changes

Name: Le Potager de Charlotte
Address: 12 Rue Louise-√âmilie de la Tour d'Auvergne, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: This vegan restaurant in Paris offers well-crafted and beautifully presented dishes, though the ingredients and recipes lack originality. The service is attentive and helpful, enhancing the dining experience. However, the tables are bare and napkins are thin paper (and only one is offered). Worse is the restroom, located in the courtyard, which is in dire need of maintenance, which detracts from the overall experience. Additionally, the ‚Ç¨4.5 charge for carbonated tap water, labeled as "micro filtered," feels excessive. While the food and service are commendable, these inconveniences could affect repeat visits. Ultimately, at these prices, there are better alternatives. | Nice atmosphere, good service and food. The flavours and textures of the food were interesting and delicious. One dish we didn't enjoy as much was the rigatoni - a bit heavy/gluggy - so would avoid that but otherwise would recommend as a tasty, relaxed dining experience. | Excellent. Great blend of noticeable flavours. Mixture of hearty and light options. Simple, affordable, well designed menu. Wine was perfect also, and the different soft drinks options (not having the standard Coke and Fanta) shows effort, innovation, and thought about customer experience. I would return without hesitation. A must visit for vegetarians (and I'm not a vegetarian!) | One of my favourite restaurants in Paris. I come here every time I visit Paris. Everything is delicious and the service is great. I wish they had more non-alcoholic beverages though, such as mocktails. | Recommended by my AirBnB hosts this place was intimate and cozy. Delicious food at reasonable prices. One of the better vegan/vegetarian places I have eaten at in Paris. The food was fresh and the dining experience delightful. Would recommend this place‚Ä¶
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Le Potager de Charlotte Keywords: - Vegan restaurant - Paris - Well-crafted dishes - Beautiful presentation - Attentive service - Bare tables - Thin paper napkins - Restroom maintenance issues - Carbonated tap water charge - Interesting flavors - Delicious textures - Rigatoni dish feedback - Tasty, relaxed dining experience - Noticeable flavor blend - Hearty and light menu options - Simple and affordable menu - Well-designed menu - Perfect wine - Innovative soft drinks - Vegetarian-friendly - Favorite restaurant in Paris - Delicious food - Great service - Limited non-alcoholic beverages - Intimate and cozy atmosphere - Reasonable

Name: Le Potager de Charlotte
Reviews: Beautiful and delicious food! The restaurant has a great atmosphere as well. We had the sesame tofu, the wild rice, the aubergine, and the "strawberry" dessert. Everything was beautifully presented and well cooked. We would absolutely come back here on future trips and highly recommend it. | Phenomenal experience. The staff was courteous, attentive and efficient. We were there for the first seating but never felt rushed. The food was sumptuous. The avocado ‚Äúegg‚Äù so delicious. Try everything and get the pancakes for dessert. Unbeknownst to me I dropped my wallet while dining and the staff called me twice to make certain I retrieved it the next day. 10/10. | Your search for the best plant-based restaurant in Paris has just ended - this is the place.  Le Potager de Charlotte is in a league of its own and I am here to confirm that the eagle has landed - mission accomplished folks.  Of course there are plenty of vegan burger and sandwich joints around Paris, and nothing against them - there's a time and place for every desire, but if you want something fresh, delicious, and better than what you will find in your own hometown, then here it is.  The sauces were so good that we kept ordering more baguettes to sop them up and clean our plates.  The room is cozy and spacious. The seating is very comfortable. And the staff could not be nicer or more helpful. So in terms of ambiance, you can have a very enjoyable and memorable experience. I would say Le Potager de Charlotte is perfect for special occasions, but the prices are not high, so it's also the kind of local spot you'd come to on a regular basis.  If you're lucky, you will even see Charlotte herself, checking in to make sure everything is just right.  And the neighborhood is lovely to walk around before or after the meal.  We can't wait to come back! | An amazing, healthy, vegan meal! For the starter, the hummus with dried tomatoes, pine nuts and olives was one of the best I‚Äôve ever tasted! I‚Äôll admit, the einkorn main dish was a little too chewy and dry for me, but it was nice nevertheless. My husband also enjoyed himself and he loves to eat meat! We were both very appreciative of the organic wine list and the vegan chocolate mousse dessert. And the servers were amazingly kind and attentive. I would highly recommend this to vegans and omnivores alike. | One of the best vegan dinners in Paris! The grilled asparagus with cashew cream was my favourite! The hazelnut mashed potato is comforting and creamy. I was stuffed to the brim after the mains but the strawberry dessert with vanilla cashew cream was worth the indulgence and very refreshing! Definitely a must for any vegan visiting Paris!
Keywords: - Le Potager de Charlotte - Plant-based restaurant - Vegan cuisine - Sesame tofu - Wild rice - Aubergine - Strawberry dessert - Avocado "egg" - Pancakes - Cozy ambiance - Courteous staff - Comfortable seating - Sauces - Baguettes - Special occasions - Organic wine list - Vegan chocolate mousse - Grilled asparagus - Cashew cream - Hazelnut mashed potato - Vanilla cashew cream - Attentive service

Name: Hank Burger
Reviews: "best gluten free burger ever" sums up our visit at Hanks perfectly. The burgers were delicious and the staff very friendly and helpful. The only reason we didn't stay longer was, that it gets pretty warm when staying with a couple of people. The area itself we enjoyed a lot tho it had a lot of character and we enjoyed the loads of stickers. The only thing I didn't understand was the single use cutlery. For a restaurant that is taking pride in being resourceful to offer plastic knifes was a little odd to me. Nevertheless was our experience 10/10 and a big recommendation especially for gluten free people craving a delicious burger! | The staff was super friendly and patient to explain everything to us in English. The place is lovely upstair. The ceiling is low and quite tiny made me felt like we were in an old appartment in Paris. But as its very small the ventilation seems not working well. We were given the coin to take drink. But don‚Äôt take coke there, it tasted like sugar water without gas. The burger was not really appealing to me. I realized them as vegan meat but it was for a tried I think I wouldn‚Äôt come back. | Fast and friendly service. The burgers are filling and satisfying. Good place to get a vegan and vegetarian burguer. There are lots of different options. | Best vegan burger I‚Äôve ever had! It was the Sergent pepper and the Champ√™tre was very tasty as well! I‚Äôll definitely come back | DISCLAIMER: Wear stretch pants.  Wao, I'm impressed by the presentation and deliciousness level of the double smack burger. It was AMAZING! I'm just glad that I wore comfy pants BECAUSE the meal was super filling. Atmosphere is chill and there's a cool interaction with the drink machine. The stairs help with the calorie consumption. 10/10 recommend. The only downside is that it's quite WARM in the dining area, but otherwise a wonderful gem to come across.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Hank Burger - Cuisine Type: Burgers, Vegan, Vegetarian - Unique Dishes: Best gluten-free burger, Double Smack Burger, Sergent pepper, Champ√™tre - Ambiance: Chill, low ceiling like an old apartment in Paris, lots of stickers - Special Features: Friendly staff, explain menu in English, drink coin, cool interaction with drink machine, ventilation issues, single-use cutlery concern - Positive Aspects: Super friendly staff, delicious vegan and vegetarian options, filling burgers, impressive presentation, comfortable pants recommended, high recommendation for gluten-free burger, positive customer experiences, 10/10 ratings

Name: Wild & The Moon
Reviews: This place is super cute and has a fantastic vibe. BUT the food was so bad. When my burger came I already knew that this will bad. Bread was like gummy and not like bread. Burger was super small and without sides. It is too expensive for this taste and size. The cashier ignored me first, until I said something. So service also wasn‚Äôt nice. It‚Äôs nice to have a vegan place next to this big fast food restaurants, but i‚Äòd rather go somewhere else next time. | I am in love with the Wild & The Moon group.  They have managed to open cafes that enchant every visitor with their vegan dishes and farmers friendly like decor.  The staff is always very kind and the food is simply delicious.  Usually a great location for brunch and for coworking. | we had breakfast there once but went there every single day for coffee and little vegan bites. was so amazing and after 4 days they already knew my order - so attentive!!! food is good (get the spirulina bowl and the cinnamon buns are amazing)! | super cute place and very friendly service.  had the Plat du Jour, which listed loads of veggies with lentils, turned out to be a type of wheat/ebly grains (not red lentils as advertised) with a little curry-ish sauce that didn‚Äôt even have all the vegetables listed (there was no eggplant, which was one of the main reasons I ordered the dish). very disappointed to have paid 12eur for tiny amount of veg :( - blueberry almond ‚Äúscone‚Äù was a super tasty pastry and the bowls looked great also | Great food! We had the bun and a bowl and both very super good. The food came in like 5 minutes after we ordered,which was great! Super helpful staff! The desserts are also highly recommended!!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Wild & The Moon Cuisine Type: Vegan Unique Dishes: Spirulina bowl, cinnamon buns, blueberry almond scone Ambiance: Super cute, fantastic vibe, farmers-friendly decor Special Features: Attentive service, fast food service, highly recommended desserts Positive Mentions: Delicious food, kind staff, good coffee, great brunch location, personalized service, quick order fulfillment

Name: Wild & The Moon
Reviews: Great restaurant! Everything is GF, vegan and delicious. A really good option for a lunch, dinner or a snack! Haven‚Äôt tried the lattes yet but they seem really good! Only downside of this venue is that they don‚Äôt have bathrooms. | Ridiculously small portion size.  The ‚Äûplate of the day‚Äú was a few spoon fulls of rice with a sprinkle of lentils. For 12,50‚Ç¨.  Incredibly disappointing - as we were really hungry and looking forward to a nourishing meal.  Definitelycsnnotvrecommend getting any food here. The drinks were fine. | What a great place for tasty and healthy food. I tried the ‚ÄúGlow Bowl‚Äù and it was divine! Next day wanted to try something else, but the ‚ÄúGlow Bowl‚Äù experience was so good - ordered the same. Also tried cinnamon roll - was fresh and tasty, not too sweet. The waiters were pleasant and helpful. I also enjoyed the interior. If I lived in Paris, ‚ÄúWild & the Moon‚Äù would have been my daily place to eat. Highly recommend this food for gods place. | Wild & the Moon is an incredibly cozy and comfortable spot (with multiple locations). With fantastic vegan food, it is absolutely wonderful. I have been to nearly every location in Paris, and I have yet to be disappointed or even slightly let down. It is delightful. I LOVE it so much. The Bahn Mi is probably the best thing on the menu, though the a√ßa√≠ bowls and other items are absolutely worth trying. :) | Me and my wife came to this spot 3 times on our 1week trip. The Bahn Mi was our favorite. Hoping they come out with another cook book with that recipe. I‚Äôd buy it just for that. Everything else we had was great as well. Got some take away for our Versailles day trip. It was nice to eat something tasty on the lawn and not feel worried about if anything there could accommodate us. We will be recommending this spot to all our friends for their future Paris trips‚ù§Ô∏è
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Wild & The Moon   Cuisine Type: Vegan, Gluten-Free   Unique Dishes: Glow Bowl, Bahn Mi, Cinnamon Roll   Ambiance: Cozy, Comfortable   Special Features: Multiple locations, no bathrooms   Positive Mentions: Tasty, Healthy, Recommend, Great service, Pleasant waitstaff, Fresh, Multiple visits, Cookbook, Takeaway option, Versailles day trip, Accommodating, Highly recommended

Name: Le Grenier de Notre-Dame
Address: 18 Rue de la B√ªcherie, 75005 Paris, France
Reviews: It's a very cozy place to find good vegan food. I was looking for food while I strolled on the streets of Paris around Norte Dame, and found it. The girl working there was Indian too, but was friendly and knew French too! Great experience! | One of the best meals of our recent trip to Paris. Really unique menu blending veg/vegan options with a French twist.  Reasonably priced, amazing vibe and great location. Even my non-vegan family members really enjoyed it. | Awesome find for vegetarians or vegans that omnivores in the group enjoyed, too!  I ordered the veggie burger. It was a housemade patty topped with vegan cheese. If I lived nearby, I would be a regular customer just for that burger!  My husband chose the blue cheese veggie burger and really liked it.  We tried the tart apple pie & waffle with ice cream for dessert. If the waffle was a little crisper, it would have been perfect.  We did not have a reservation, but we were able to get seated right away at a small table for 4 outside. | For vegans in Paris, this restaurant is a must. The unique dishes are fabulous. Had the daily special of Gratin de champignons and Le gratin de Dauphinois. Delicieux!! Finished with the Cr√®me de br√ªl√©e. Service was wonderful. | we had a delicious meal of faux gras, dauphinois and a gal√®tte, all the food was flavourful and satisfying. the dauphinois was the best dish we tried. the wine was also good. everything was well priced for the quality and the server was really lovely. one of the best vegan places in paris. | Delicious food and excellent service! We asked for the seitan escalope, the assiette zen, the assiette berbere, etc. We also asked for several desserts, like the browny. Weliked everything. Yorman was very kind. | I dont understand the 3.9 rating. This restaurant had amazing food and service. After a tiring 2nd day, we stopped by here since it was relatively close to our hotel and had veg options. My husband and I ordered their gratin dish and a tofu and seitan platter. The serving size was huge for Paris but we finished it all. Also got some cold crisp beer. Our server was an Imdian lady who was efficient and friendly. Its a small place and tables can get cramped but that just adds to the charm that is Paris. I was glad to try some French veganized dishes here. Coming from California, I thought it was very reasonable priced. | This was a great little place. First it is small and quaint. It has a real comfy feel to it. The service was perfection. The right number of check-ins, the pacing of serving the food was on point. The food itself was delicious. The plating was not fancy but who cares when it's so good!!! The dessert and the coffee were the perfect finish | What a lovely little spot. Great value weekday lunch menu and a real treat to eat at France's oldest veggie restaurant. The staff were really attentive and the food was delicious! | An absolutely outstanding vegetarian restaurant in the Latin Quarter.  it is one of the oldest vegetarian restaurants in Paris ...  Dating back to the era when people wondered how vegetarians get enough protein.  The generation of vegetarian pioneers who founded the place have all grown old and moved on.  The new generation of managers are incorporating exciting elements of North African, Sub-Saharan African and Caribbean cooking into the menu - while keeping some of the classic French recipes from Le Grenier's youth.  There is nothing but good in any of this.  Our table had dishes from many of the generations.  A coconut soup was one of the richest and most indulgent bowls of soup I have had in my life. Manioc gave the soup some solid mass - but mostly this was just pure over-the-top coconut milk goodness.  An Aveyron salad was an orthodox French salad with a generous mix in of strong very high quality Aveyron blue cheese.  Very fresh walnuts were a fine taste contrast.  Oh yes - and plenty of healthy greens for the salad.  The rest of the table all had Berber plates.  They  a) Loved them and  b) Couldn't finish them.  Having so much food you can't finish it is a good thing in a vegetarian restaurant.  All of us having had a super rich coconut soup first may have had something to do with this.  * * *  Overall, a first rate vegetarian restaurant.  Having something this good in the epicenter of the tourist zone in the Latin Quarter?  Seems implausible ... but it is here and it is good.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Le Grenier de Notre-Dame - Cuisine: Vegan, Vegetarian, French - Unique Dishes: Veggie Burger, Blue Cheese Veggie Burger, Tart Apple Pie, Waffle with Ice Cream, Gratin de Champignons, Gratin de Dauphinois, Faux Gras, Gal√®tte, Seitan Escalope, Assiette Zen, Assiette Berbere, Browny, Coconut Soup, Aveyron Salad, Berber Plates - Ambiance: Cozy, Comfy, Small and Quaint - Special Features: Reasonably Priced, Amazing Vibe, Great Location, Excellent Service, Veganized French Dishes, Incorporating Elements of North African

Name: Faubourg Daimant
Address: 20 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: Faubourg Daimant in Paris is a delightful vegan restaurant that offers clean and fresh food, making it a great choice for health-conscious diners. We visited during the Olympics, and despite the city‚Äôs hustle and bustle, the restaurant provided a calm and inviting atmosphere.  The menu features a variety of creative dishes, but the spicy avocado dip appetizer was a standout‚Äîbursting with flavor and perfectly seasoned. The potato croquettes were another highlight, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, making for a satisfying and comforting dish. To complement our meal, we enjoyed an Old Fashioned, which was expertly crafted and had just the right balance of flavors.  While the service was slightly slow, it was understandable given how busy the restaurant was during our visit. The staff remained friendly and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. | Excellent fine dining vegan restaurant with punchy flavours and impressive presentation.  All the dishes here were well thought out and looks as good as they taste. The seaweed caviar (especially the fluffy potatoes tots) eggplant carpaccio and the pudding were highlights. No cocktails at lunch but they also sounded great. | Absolute delight!  From the moment we walked in to when we left.  The staff, the atmosphere and let‚Äôs not forget all the incredible delicious dishes we had! If you are undecided on which dessert to have, definitely try the popcorn french toast!  Uniquely delicious! | Such a great experience! Will definitely return next time I‚Äôm in Paris. From the minute we walked in the service was brilliant, our waitress was so lovely and helpful and her enthusiasm really added to the experience. The atmosphere was exactly what I‚Äôd hoped for with beautiful interiors and lots of effort to the details. Lastly the food was excellent, with a few real stand out dishes. Highly recommend!!! | Wonderful atmosphere, service, and food. The staff were very welcoming and helpful explaining the dishes to us. The portions are big for sharing/ tapas style dining. The broccoli guacamole and smoked whipped butter were especially delicious. The menu doesn‚Äôt specify gluten free options but around half of the dishes were naturally gluten free, and gluten free bread was available. Excited to try more next time.
Keywords: - Faubourg Daimant - Paris - Vegan restaurant - Clean, fresh food - Health-conscious - Calm atmosphere - Spicy avocado dip - Potato croquettes - Old Fashioned cocktails - Fine dining - Punchy flavors - Seaweed caviar - Eggplant carpaccio - Pudding - Popcorn French toast - Excellent service - Beautiful interiors - Sharing/tapas style dining - Broccoli guacamole - Smoked whipped butter - Gluten-free options

Name: Copper Branch Paris
Address: 151 bis Rue de Rennes, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: The woman behind the counter helped me get a different dressing on the side (in English). The food was good, though way too much rice (filler) in the bowl. Next time I would ask for more veggies and less rice. | Delicious food, everything is vegan. They have burgers, salads and bowls, all which are extremely delicious. I have no complaints. I accidentally ordered the wrong thing, and when the man working there realised, he gave me what I meant to order without any extra payment. The food was great, the workers were fantastically kind and the atmosphere was very nice and comforting. I highly recommend this to anyone living in or visiting Paris, especially my fellow vegans. | This is perhaps the best vegan food I have had in YEARS. I am so happy this place is right around the corner from my hotel‚Ä¶I will be back. | Fully vegan amazing place, the food was so delicious. Lots of options, burgers salads sides and smoothies. | This place does a decent selection of vegan wraps, burgers, and bowls. We got a burger and wrap and they were decidedly average. However, a guy next to us ordered a bowl which looked way more appetising.  The one guy serving was friendly, helpful, and spoke English (if that matters to you). Ordering is done through touchscreen which also has an English language option.  Toilets were pretty gross.
Keywords: - Cuisine: Vegan - Menu items: Burgers, salads, bowls, wraps - Special features: English-speaking staff, touchscreen ordering system - Ambiance: Comforting atmosphere - Positive aspects: Kind workers, delicious food, diverse options - Location: Paris, near hotels - Notes: Excessive rice in bowls, generous portion sizes, varied reviews on food quality, mixed feedback on hygiene of toilets.

Name: Soya
Address: 20 Rue de la Pierre Lev√©e, 75011 Paris, France
Reviews: Delicious vegan food.  Super healthy & tasty at the same time. Staff was very warm, atmosphere is homely. Nice for a date or spend time with friends or even to grab a quick meal.  Must try: the platter for mains & the artichokes for entree.  Soyafels, mezze, tempeh cannot be missed | We had lunch at this place.. excellent food, great service and had a good time üòäüíê thank you for the dish of the day.. was very tasty and so was the dessertüòäüíê | Really nice and tasty. However it‚Äôs overpriced!!! Look at my photo, I‚Äôve paid 18‚Ç¨ for 2 little dishes, I‚Äôm not a big eater, but I was still hungry! Come on! | Another great vegan experience in Paris!  I'd recommend making a reservation.  It wasn't busy when I arrived at 7:30 but it was packed when I left an hour or so later.  I had the fried tempeh appetizer and the lasagna. The appetizer was good but not what I was expecting.  The tempeh was more of a paste that was formed into triangles and fried.  I didn't really see any individual soybeans.  Perhaps that's typical in Europe so I can't ding them for that.  Besides, it still tasted good.üòÅ  Now on to the star of the show, the lasagna.   Most of the reviews said it was good and they were correct.  It's the best vegan lasagna I've had in the 8 years I've been vegan.  The portion was large, with many layers.  2 people could probably share it if they also had appetizers.  This place is definitely deserving of its high rating.  I'll be back! | It was my first time in this restaurant and I have to admit that I found it difficult to communicate with the waitress, who could obviously speak English but wasn't willing to make an effort. That's not really welcoming.  In the end she told me they could make a hummus without garlic and the salads without onions, and I said great. She went back to the kitchen, called the two chefs and the manager and had a discussion for 5 minutes laughing. Then both the waitress and the manager came to me and said they couldn't make anything with those allergies. Obviously they were too tired or bored to cook something fresh for me, even though their colleague had told me earlier that they could. Their menu consists of simple ingredients, if their kitchen is supposed to offer fresh food then they could just cook a plate of fresh stuff, but I guess that's not the case. Extremely disappointing. Poor attitude and service.  The tables are small, barely fit three plates, the music is too loud and if you're not French you should bring a dictionary.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Soya  Keywords: - Vegan - Healthy - Tasty - Homely ambiance - Suitable for dates and friends - Platter mains - Artichokes entree - Soyafels - Mezze - Tempeh dishes - Dish of the day - Overpriced - Vegan experience - Reservation recommended - Fried tempeh appetizer - Lasagna highlight - Vegan lasagna - High rating - Communication issue with waitress - Hummus without garlic - Salads without onions - Poor attitude - Small tables - Loud music - Cultural diversity - Language barrier

Name: V√©g√©t'Halles
Reviews: I am totally loving the fact there are so many vegetarian choices these days in Paris - maybe I never looked in the right places or maybe new places continue to open but whatever the case, Saveurs V√©g√©t'Halles was a delicious choice for our first evening's meal  We'd asked a Conceirge to help us identify somewhere walkable & veggie & he directed us here & even called ahead to secure reservations - you'll want to do the same as they were fully booked for the evening!!  Ordered the mushroom pate to start & it was extremely flavorful & savory - paired with onion jam & baguette - this was so delish!  Main dishes included the Spinach & Chevre Tart for the Mr - there was an abundance of spinach & I am not a fan so I didn't even taste it but the Mr said it was hearty & the chevre offered that extra flavor layer to make it even better  I chose the Mushroom Loaf with a fruit reduction sauce ( I think it was blackberry? ) and assorted veggie sides like wild rice, warmed lettuce & carrots, and lentils. This was SO GOOD! Just like a meatloaf and thoroughly delish! The Mr said while he liked his dish, the mushroom loaf was better  We also noticed lots & lots of people ordering their Veggie Burger - made us want to come back & indulge - and we have plans to do just that on our next visit!  Desserts included the Apple Crumble & their Sesame Tiramisu & we split these - the tiramisu was very light & whipped like a mousse & had that slight peanut buttery taste - incredible! The apple crumble was hearty & loved the thick & crumbly crust - both winners!  Paired it all with a delish Brouilly & we enjoyed a wonderful welcome to the City of Lights. | The food was really average to mediocre, nothing amazing or too good. We ordered a hummus which was a really small portion for the money you pay and pretty badly served. The burger was ok, nothing special, the fries tasted like the frozen ones and the lasagna didn't taste like a lasagna at all. Just had some cheese on top and that was all. | Great vegan restaurant, plenty of tables available on a Wednesday during the Olympics. We really enjoyed the food - we had the seitan with mushroom sauce, the brochettes, tiramisu and caf√© gourmand. The brochettes needed a sauce but everything tasted delicious and it was great to have options that are not burgers (although the table next to us had the burgers and they looked good too!). We would definitely return. | Before heading into the Louvre, we had a tasty lunch at a vegetarian restaurant called V√©g√©t'Halles. We shared the Beignet de tofu avec sa Vegannaise (Tofu fritters with vegan mayonnaise) and a Burger V√©g√©t'halles with frites! We also spent a fair amount of time fighting over the water and whether we were going to be charged for it. The short answer was yes, so maybe we shouldn't have asked for any. | Cozy restaurant with large selection of vegan and vegetarian dishes. Everything on the menu sounded delicious and it was very difficult to only choose one main dish. The server recommended the Aubergine with ‚Äúshrimp‚Äù and she was right, it was scrumptious! Had the chia pudding for dessert and it did not disappoint.  Highly recommend this place. I‚Äôm sure even the non-vegans will find something to enjoy. | Great vegetarian restaurant. Fast. Not too expensive. Super convenient if visiting Louvre or Notre Dame. | As a vegan I was looking for something, anything, besides avocado toast, a salad or pasta with plain tomato sauce in Paris! My daughter found Veget Halles, which was a ten minute walk from our hotel near the Louvre. The narrow street is sits on felt a bit sketchy but it was perfectly safe. Aside from a terribly long wait for our entrees to arrive after our appetizers (everyone around us was served before us, which made us wonder if our order was forgotten- seriously it took almost a hour!) the food was very good. We had two orders of curry rolls for an appetizer. Yum! My omnivore daughter had the pesto pasta (she gave me the two pieces of seitan chicken on top), my pescatarian daughter has the curry (she loved it), and I had the burger. It was such a nice mixture of flavors and textures. Only two people were working to cover the busy restaurant, and I think one was the chef herself. Because of the slow service I'm giving them 4 stars. The vegan oasis in Paris was five stars. | More like 3.5 stars. Im glad that I got to try veganized version of a pate here. They had a mushroom pate which I thought I would not like but surprisingly it was palatable. Would I order it again? No, but worth trying once. We got the burger and broccoli pie for our mains. The burger was decent but the pie was tastelessand quite mush. Portions are a bit smaller and lighter here. Service wasn't that great. It seemed like they were in a rush to get people out. English also seemed to be a bit of a barrier and ofcourse they could not understand my broken French tho the folks working there were Asian. | Ok. I like what they're doing here, I love the variety of options on the menu, the incredible pricing for a 3-course lunch, the service and the ambience. Overall, I'd give it 3.5 stars. That being said, all of the flavors were just a bit off, a bit lacking. The butternut squash tart was very mild, not savory, not sweet. It needed salt and some aromatics, maybe some green onion to liven it up. The brown rice was just rice. The lentils were the best part and had subtle depth of flavor. The dessert was similar.. chocolat creme...not sweet enough to the point it almost didn't taste like dessert. Otherwise creamy with nice texture. | Great place to eat. Second time i have been there with the family. Also during Olympics: - fast service, friendly staff, great taste, good value (very reasonable prices). - Fresh food, smart use of ingredients, good portions.  Good choice!
Keywords: Restaurant: V√©g√©t'Halles - Vegetarian restaurant - Paris - Mushroom pate - Spinach & Chevre Tart - Mushroom Loaf - Veggie Burger - Apple Crumble - Sesame Tiramisu - Vegan options - Seitan with mushroom sauce - Brochettes - Tofu fritters - Vegan mayonnaise - Chia pudding - Louvre - Cozy ambiance - Large selection - Fast service - Reasonable prices - Slow service - Variety of options - 3.5 stars

Name: Wild & The Moon
Reviews: I hope I never take vegan places like these for granted. It‚Äôs such a blessing that someone has a vision big enough to create an all vegan brand thats successful like this! I had a coffee and almond blueberry scone. I cant WAIT to try and recreate this in my home country. I look forward to trying more things and thank you for creating this place ! | I got the oatmeal for ‚Ç¨13 and there was basically no food in the bowl, filled with lukewarm water. Absolutely gross. Every time I come here I regret it. This place is a rip off and the food is disgusting. | I took a chai latte which is often a classic BUT for some reason mine tasted like there was apple cider in it making soo far from what I would consider to be a chai latte. Literally leaves a bad taste in my mouth from wanting to return back to any wild and the moon.  I‚Äôm not sure how someone could mess up a chai latte ü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è but for 7‚Ç¨, it‚Äôs best to avoid it in the future. | Green jungle in Paris, and one of the few full vegan spots. The salads are great, but the smoothie bowls - particularly the mango bowl and a√ßai bowl - are absolutely mind blowing. It‚Äôs my go-to spot, you can order basically everything on the menu and it will be good. | There was Italian brunch, tiramisu and filter coffee, interesting taste and calm atmosphere, I liked it.
Keywords: Wild & The Moon, vegan, coffee, almond blueberry scone, oatmeal, chai latte, rip off, disgusting, salads, smoothie bowls, mango bowl, a√ßai bowl, Italian brunch, tiramisu, filter coffee, calm atmosphere.

Name: Les Tontons Veg
Reviews: We expend a really good night there. The waiter is so kind and friendly. He would help you with recommendation. The burgers are so delicious. I‚Äôll recommend the Katsu Burger. They are no too big but you have many extras too add in the menu. The idea is too share. Highly recommend the place even if you are not vegan. | 3.5 stars review ---------------- We're not vegan people, but we do enjoy vegan burgers from time to time. This was a very good choice! You have to wait though as it's usually crowded but it's worth the wait. The place isn't very spacious, but the staff are so friendly and welcoming. We tried a vegan chicken-like burger and kimchi Burger and both were really mouthwatering. The fries were good too. Prices are acceptable for being an all vegan place, but it's better to go there if you're vegan to make it worth everything | Had one of their beyond meat burgers- juicy and flavorful. If you're not a big eater, it would be wise to share so that you can get their herbed fries; shoestring fries with skin on and generously sprinkled with herbs. Crispy and so, so good. Service is nice too! | This is a must go place if you‚Äôre visiting Paris. Aaamazing burgers with the innovative approach to give that extra kick. By far one of the best burgers I‚Äôve had in my life | A 10/10. The best vegan burger I have tried in Paris so far it‚Äôs here. And it‚Äôs called Cebolla dream, and it is a dream. The herbs provences fries and the brussel sprouts were incredibly tasty and crunchy. The service is really good, always with a smile. The food came very fast. Nice music. I have nothing negative to say, because it was a perfect experience. I would recommend to everyone, and I‚Äôll come back for sure! Added to my favorites vegan in Paris.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Les Tontons Veg - Cuisine Type: Vegan - Unique Dishes: Katsu Burger, Vegan chicken-like burger, Kimchi Burger, Beyond Meat burgers, Cebolla dream burger - Ambiance: Cozy, crowded, not very spacious - Special Features: Friendly staff, innovative approach to burgers, herb provence fries, herbed fries, Brussels sprouts - Positive Mentions: Delicious burgers, mouthwatering food, must-visit in Paris, fast service, great music, highly recommended

Name: Chez Funda
Reviews: I instantly fell in love with this cute restaurant. The service, ambiente and food were all super nice. They have a lot vegan stuff, only one meal with meat. I love that you directly see what is vegan and what‚Äôs not and the prices are very fair. It was super delicious and I would recommend it to everyone who is in Paris ‚ô•Ô∏è | We ordered dinner about half an hour before closing. Lovely indoor and outdoor seating, very friendly waiter. The beef and spinach moussaka were fresh and good. Received complimentary freshly baked bread and turkish delights. Recommended if you want to try new dishes. | Great little discovery, loved the food, lentil soup was rich in flavor, and you can taste the bread with sesame seeds is freshly baked and served plenty. Will definitely come back here. | Highly recommend it to vegan people. Many vegan options and you can ask the staff to change some meals to vegan. Super friendly staff and really delicious. | This was my 2nd Vegan place in Paris and it was very welcoming. Their menu has a wide variety of choices and I loved their food. For Dinner back on March 22nd, I had their Moussaka vegetarian with rice and salad followed by Baklava for Dessert. I highly recommend for a relaxing Evening Dinner.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Chez Funda Cuisine Type: Vegan, Turkish Unique Dishes: Beef and spinach moussaka, baklava Ambiance: Cozy, welcoming Special Features: Many vegan options, staff willing to customize meals, complimentary bread and turkish delights Positive Aspects: Fair prices, delicious food, friendly staff, variety in menu, rich lentil soup

Name: Furahaa | Vegan
Reviews: The service my partner and I received here on the 3 visits we made to the shop during our time in Paris were wonderful. The staff were so kind and accommodating to us, they always went the extra mile to make sure we had a great experience. A special shout-out to Naweed and Walid- they served us on multiple occasions and really made our days! We hope that the store can acknowledge how wonderful they are and we will definitely be back next time we are in Paris and will recommend to all of our friends! | I stopped by this restaurant to order some fast food - I had a vegan cheeseburger (single patty) and French fries. I liked them! The fries weren‚Äôt too oily. Just thin and crispy, so they reminded me of McDonald‚Äôs fries but better. The cheeseburger was nicely done - it was simple but good. I‚Äôm not a vegan but I think anyone would enjoy this! I enjoyed it myself, and I will go back there again to try a burrito (they recommended it)  The owner and the employees were friendly and I didn‚Äôt have any trouble communicating with them, even there was a language barrier  It was a unique experience, and I‚Äôd recommend it | Lovely staff. Nice view in the seating area on the second floor. Clean. Burgers a bit small but very tasty. Great vegan fast food, one of the best I had. | I hate to leave a poor review for a place that's vegan & inclusive, especially because the burger wasn't bad, but I waited an hour for my burger & fries, because they cooked all other 4 groups' burgers at the same time (I'm not sure they know how a kitchen should work...) which meant the fries came out cold & awful. Despite everyone receiving buzzers to indicate when their food was ready, not a single one went off in the time I was there, & every group had to go back downstairs to check when their food would be ready. By the time I finished my meal, it was not longer filling & I was still hungry. No explanation or compensation was offered. | We came here two years ago when it was out of a little van and we have looked forward to coming back ever since!!! We‚Äôre happy to see it has grown as a business. Such a great deal and affordable! So nice to see what this business supports!  Lots of vegan options!!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Furahaa | Vegan Cuisine Type: Vegan, Fast Food Unique Dishes: Vegan cheeseburger, burrito Ambiance: Clean, nice view on second floor seating area Special Features: Friendly staff, accommodating service, affordable Positive aspects: Wonderful service, delicious and crispy fries, great vegan fast food, lots of vegan options, growth of the business, inclusive environment

Name: 42 Degr√©s
Address: 109 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: Really amazing! Delicious raw vegan cuisine and now they even have a really affordable wrap available for take out orders (it was either 9 or 10 euros). I thought the wrap was going to be small and basic but it was huge and really tasty. And the zuchinni flowers were wonderful too. | The service was excellent and the food was stunning in both taste and presentation! We were pleasantly surprised. I wish we had found this place before our last night in Paris. A wonderful experience overall and I really recommend! | Probably the best meal I have eaten in a very long time. We arrived a little early, before opening time. But we were still welcomed in, and offered a seat and a drink. We felt truly valued as a customer before we had even ordered. Then we get to the food. Quite simply it was outstanding, the food was super fresh, and the taste and texture of every meal was out of this world. The presentation was a work of art. If you're a vegan or like to eat plant based, then you must eat here. | I have been in Paris for three years, so far, this is THE worst food that I've ever had. I never know that the food can be such bad. Everthing tasted so bitter and cold! Carrots, eggplants, salad... I never know that vegetables can tast such bitter and bad! The dishes killed my appetite. With this price, I am really speechless. I would not recommend it to anyone at all... | I had such a wonderful experience here. Fabian was so welcoming and informative, and the food was beautiful. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back when I‚Äôm in Paris again ‚ù§Ô∏è
Keywords: Restaurant Name: 42 Degr√©s   - Cuisine: raw vegan   - Unique Dishes: zucchini flowers, wrap   - Service: excellent   - Ambiance: welcoming   - Special Features: affordable take-out option   - Positive: delicious, stunning food, beautiful presentation   - Overall Experience: wonderful, must-visit   - Negative: bitter, cold, unappetizing   - Personalized Service: welcoming, informative   - Location: Paris   - Price: concerns about pricing

Name: ap√©ti
Reviews: Love this place! Hugo the owner is the best ‚Äî so friendly, welcoming, and helpful. The vibe is chill and casual, just like the neighborhood. As for the food, it‚Äôs top-notch. Fresh, organic, gluten-free, vegan, and all homemade. Also fabulous organic wines! We‚Äôve been here several times already and look forward to coming back. | If you want fill your stomach with healthy vegan food, this is the place for you. Portions are really abundant, the place ia nicely located, staff is friendly and atmosphere is relaxed and natural. Personally but is my own personal opinion, I found the food taste just ok, good yes, but not something special to reccomend. | We went in with good confidence due to high ratings but learned that this one is a bit more tricky.  1. Started with a soup, which was very forgettable unfortunately. All good ingredients, but in the end severely lacked salt and spices, it was very bland. After steadily adding more and more salt finally it became a bit better, but then it had already turned cold ü§¶üèª  2. We had ordered Apeti bowl, very colorful and nicely presented, turned out to be quite tasty as well. Buy I really wish if it were a warm bowl and if I had known in advance that it was a cold bowl.  3. Then the lasagna. It was hot and nice, rich with flavors. That sort of made up for the other two.  4. With a few mixed results and because of slightly higher price tags, we didn‚Äôt feel like trying out the desserts during that visit.  Hope the restaurant continues to take the feedbacks constructively and keep improving further, reaching higher degrees of consistency in terms of taste, thus justifying the premium price tag. I will be happy to see a vegan restaurant succeed. | Very nice place to eat vegetarian food near Invalides. Calm, peaceful and French style. We had lasagna and no cheese cake both were very nice. This place can also be accessed from Champs de Mars on the back side of Eiffel Tower. The waitress was very customer friendly and place was not crowded. | If you feel like a delicious plant-based meal at a lovely caf√© in a charming Parisian neighborhood away from the tourists, then this is your place.  Meeting the owner Hugues was a real highlight.  The food is fresh, artisanal, and priced very reasonably. A lot of effort is made to source the ingredients, and you can taste the difference.  We could eat here every day.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: ap√©ti Cuisine: Vegan, Vegetarian Ambiance: Chill, Casual, Relaxed, Natural, French style Special Features: Organic, Gluten-free, Homemade, Artisanal Unique Dishes: Apeti bowl, Lasagna Positive Mentions: Friendly staff, Fresh food, Organic wines, Peaceful, Customer-friendly, Locally sourced ingredients

Name: the friendly kitchen
Reviews: Super nice vegan restaurant, very delicate dishes and uncommon flavor associations. Every dish was very very good. Loved the pistachio tartlet!  Only downside was the service being a bit slow which you may want to take into consideration if you come on your lunch break. Would be nice to add a starter/main/dessert menu as well. | My husband booked a table here for us as part of a day trip we took to Paris. Lovely restaurant with a welcoming young lady who looked after us. The menu isn't huge, which was good as I struggle with too much choice. I was pleasantly surprised with how the food tasted, really well though out ingredients, flavours and textures. Would definitely recommend. | Definitely the best meal I ate while in Paris-- and one of the finest vegan meals I have ever eaten. We had the tasting menu with wine pairing and every course was excellent! The staff was helpful, kind and very attentive as well. I highly recommend this restaurant and hope to return. | Astoundingly beautiful food! Peace, love and creativity live at the Friendly Kitchen. What an incredible experience we had. | Super nice place! The food is very creative and I love how it is healthy also. The desserts also don‚Äôt feel super sugary which is a nice touch. Love how most of the menu is gluten free also!  Staff was very friendly and helpful too. They have a tasting menu which would be interesting to look into.  Overall, I place I would return to! ü•∞
Keywords: Restaurants, Vegan, Delicate dishes, Uncommon flavor associations, Pistachio tartlet, Slow service, Starters, Mains, Desserts, Welcoming, Young lady, Well-thought-out ingredients, Tasting menu, Wine pairing, Staff, Creative food, Healthy, Gluten-free, Desserts not sugary, Friendly staff, Tasting menu, Peaceful ambiance, Creative, Astoundingly beautiful food.

Name: cantine de lotus
Address: 7 Rue de la Michodi√®re, 75002 Paris, France
Reviews: This place serves incredibly flavorful food! As a vegetarian, I was thrilled to find such authentic Asian options. It's a must-visit for anyone in Paris seeking an asian delicious meal. | so nice !! they don‚Äôt take reservations so when they open there is sometimes a line. the place is very tiny but fits a lot of people and is very cute ! the staff is incredibly nice and the service was quick !! the food was very very good :) | We had an incredible time at cantine de lotus!  My brother and I are both vegetarian, and we found this awesome place. The food was incredible, we had the mapo tofu and the kung po vegan chicken dish, and both dishes were super flavourful! The service was also great. The staff were super nice and friendly, and we were chatting to them for a while. Overall, it was a super pleasant experience! I recommend eating here | On a Saturday in November at 13.30 it was about a 25 minute wait to get in. Photo menu with allergens outside so we could use that time to decide what to order. Once in, we could order quickly and food arrived quickly as well. Delicious vegan meals, friendly staff that speaks French and some English. Affordable too. Worth the wait! | Very nice little restaurant for vegan Asian food. I went for takeaway on a weekday evening and found that the place was quite busy, so I recommend booking a table before eating here. The service was very nice. They also gave me a jasmine tea while I was waiting for my order. The food was delicious.
Keywords: Cuisine: Asian, Vegetarian/Vegan Unique Dishes: Mapo Tofu, Kung Po Vegan Chicken Ambiance: Tiny, Cute, Busy Special Features: No reservations, Quick service, Affordable Positive Mentions: Incredibly flavorful food, Authentic Asian options, Super pleasant experience, Delicious vegan meals, Friendly staff, Jasmine tea

Name: Cloud Cakes
Reviews: Exquisite! The best ever vegan cakes. Coffee was wonderful. Cute little place, with lots of options. We had the carrot cake, and cheesecake. Also ordered 1 large Americano and 1 Flat white. Must visit. | Loved the Victoria sponge cake, the fluffiest and not too sweet. The croissant was flaky and buttery as well! Central location so you can enjoy vegan pastries in Paris with utmost convenience. | Had coffee, matcha latte, tofu scramble pancakes, a ham&cheese croissant, and a macaron and oh my gosh - everything was incredible. Croissant melted in my mouth and felt so crispy & fresh, the tofu pancakes was the perfect combo of sweet & savory. The space was cozy and comfortable and the staff were all super friendly despite my terrible French. 10/10 recommend. | Such a cool little place with plenty to choose from. Unfortunately, we did not have any savoury food but as I walked in and saw someone having it, I completely regretted having a very disappointing and overpriced lunch across the street. It is a very chilled place, the guy behind the counter was very nice, attentive and friendly. I ordered some macaroons, mini cupcake and a slice of carrot cake to share with my friend. He ended up having the whole slice by himself and I ordered another one for myself.
