I highly recommend this place and I can‚Äôt wait to go back and try different cakes and sweets. | I picked up a few cakes from here because I have been recommended the place. Staff were helpful and friendly and there were some really nice things on offer. Macaroons, very delicious soft cupcakes, croissants and other things. Fully vegan and didn‚Äôt disappoint.
Keywords: Restaurant name: Cloud Cakes Cuisine: Vegan, pastries, cakes, croissants Special dishes: Carrot cake, cheesecake, Victoria sponge cake, tofu scramble pancakes, ham & cheese croissant, macarons Beverages: Coffee, Americano, Flat white, matcha latte Ambiance: Cute, cozy, comfortable, chilled Special features: Fully vegan, friendly staff, central location Positive mentions: Exquisite, wonderful coffee, flaky and buttery croissants, best cakes, wide range of options, crispy and fresh croissants, perfect combo of sweet & savory, helpful and friendly staff, must visit, 10/10 recommend

Name: Vegebowl Paris
Address: 24 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Martin, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: One of the best Asian meals I've had! The food was delicious and the service was great - definitely a must visit in Paris! | Great vegan food. Friendly, English speaking staff. English menu. Fair prices. I am going to make this a regular dinner place on my trips to Paris. Five stars! | The summer roll was filling and stuffed with goodies. The main dish was big and very tasty. Fair prices. Quick service. Nothing negative to say | Great little space serving Asian vegetarian food near Strasbourg Saint-Denis/Chateau D‚ÄôEau metro. Friendly Chinese owner who speaks Chinese, English and French. They can also customise food without allium (no onions, no garlic). We ate there multiple times during our stay in Paris because the restaurant is clean, service is prompt, the food is delicious and of good value. Some of the dishes we tried were - fried rice, curry soup with vermicelli, basil tofu and curry claypot. Their coconut drink is also recommended - light and refreshing. | Very tasty food! Loved the spicy options! Easy to order for gluten free and vegan. Staff didn‚Äôt speak much English but it worked out. They were helpful. Favorite dish was stir fry noodles
Keywords: Vegebowl Paris, Asian cuisine, vegan, vegetarian, summer rolls, friendly staff, multilingual owner, customizable menu, gluten-free options, quick service, fair prices, delicious food, fried rice, curry soup, basil tofu, curry claypot, coconut drink, stir fry noodles

Name: Sangeetha Restaurant V√©g√©tarien
Address: 178 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: Food is just OK. The dosas are thick and ordinary. They are relatively small, eg a paper dosa anywhere else would be good 2 ft long and paper thin, here it is around a foot and no different than a standard dosa. Vada sambhar was soggy. Sambhar wasn't up to the mark, neither were the chutneys. Filter coffee is meh. Service is very slow. Will not go back. | Utterly fabulous vegetarian restaurant using stainless dishes ! Price fix menu ‚Ç¨12 for the Southern Indian meal is highly recommended. English spoken here, very friendly attitudes, and absolutely delicious vegetarian food! Very near the best money exchange rates in Paris, which is Tempo on Magenta. This is the one you gotta try folks! | Was just in at Sangeetha's for lunch, with family. We ordered south indian thali, garlic naan,,paneer butter masala, veggie masala dosa and poori. Some of the food were a hit and some were a miss. Chutney for dosa were below average, poori masala was tasting bland and potato curry in the thali was under cooked. All food was served a bit colder compared what I'd find back home.  The appearance was okay, but there was only one person attending to all tables 10 or 11, which were 90% occupied. This guy probably tops my list in multi-tasking but things kept getting delayed. The indian filter coffee was at its worst....it wasn't strong, not piping hot and remains of boiled milk (paal aadai). Overall food was average+ but service and ambience weren't up to anything. | Visiting Paris from the US I decided to give Sangeetha a try. It wasn't anything spectacular, and it wasn't terrible. It was above average. I had the Dahi Poori, Gobi Manchurian, Rava Masala Dosa.  The Dahi Poori is a lot smaller in portion size than the poster on the wall leads one to believe and you only get 8. They're pretty bite size and half the size of a typical Poori you'd find in India, or most other restaurants. The Gobi Manchurian was tasty, and not that spicy compared to other restaurants we've been to. The sauce was a bit oily/watery but the flavor was still there. The Rava Masala Dosa was also average but the disappointing part was the small portion size of the sambhar. They only give 3 spoonfuls before you're wanting more because it's that good. I believe you can order a large bowl for two people to share but it's an extra cost.  The service is great, the tables and restaurant are clean, and there is free tap water which is always appreciated as someone traveling around. Since it's on a street with many other Indian restaurants I'm sure you can find one better, but you can't go wrong if you decide to eat here. | This is my go-to Indian restaurant in Paris. Authentic and fresh. I'm always pleasantly surprised at how delicious it is. My favourite dishes are the North Indian thali, palak paneer and aloo gobi.  Don't leave without having the delicious dessert, rava kesari! Amazing, soft, sweet and rich!  Next time will take photos! | Ok so let's talk about Sangeetha and why I'm giving it such a high rating.  Sangeetha is located down the street from a couple of other Indian restaurants. We tried a couple of the other places down the street, but hands down Sangeetha was the best and most accommodating to our dietary restrictions. Certain members of my family eat a semi-Jain diet and do not eat any food items with onion or garlic in it. Because of this, traveling can be quite difficult and it's often very hard for them to find food items that they can eat, especially while abroad.  This restaurant was very understanding about their dietary restrictions and was able to modify dishes for them so they could actually have a full meal. Service was great and the interior was clean. Chaat service does end at a certain time so you can't get it later in the day, but their menu is still pretty appealing. Honestly, one of the better Indian restaurants in Paris esp if you have dietary issues. | Whenever I travelled to Paris i visited many vegetarian restaurant but I never get the happy experience like this restaurant. The food is really delicious and the staffs are very nice with me. Especially the patron of the restaurant, he is a great man in politeness with good heart. God bless him more and more. I'm waiting for the next trip to Paris. üôÇüëè | I had an incredibly tasty South Indian Thali at this restaurant, and as a South Indian myself, I can confirm its authenticity. This is the best South Indian restaurant I've tried in Paris. The service was quick and friendly. | First experience, and I am highly disappointed. The food was completely out of expectations. Saw so many good reviews, so decided to visit for the dinner. May be the day of our visit, the food was bad. Sambhar was smelling, there was no taste in the things from South Indian Thali. The service was good. People are friendly, but the food was definitely not what I expected. | Best Idli I tasted. Nice chutney and not to spicy. I ate it so fast I didn't have time to photo it. Masala dosa was not fully cooked but they made another which was.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Sangeetha Restaurant V√©g√©tarien Keywords: - Cuisine: South Indian - Unique Dishes: Dahi Poori, Gobi Manchurian, Rava Masala Dosa, Thali, Palak Paneer, Aloo Gobi, Rava Kesari, Idli - Ambiance: Clean, Friendly, Stainless Dishes, English Spoken - Special Features: ‚Ç¨12 Price Fix Menu, Accommodating Dietary Restrictions, Chaat Service, Free Tap Water - Positive Mentions: Delicious Food, Authentic, Great Service, Polite Staff, Best South Indian Restaurant in Paris, Best Idli, Quick Service

Name: V√©g√©'Saveurs
Reviews: As a vegetarian it's such a great find (especially as I'm just on vacation in Paris) - I can eat anything off the menu! Great food great vibes great service! 100/10 recommend! | We ordered for takeaway right before opening and arrived 10 minutes later with everything hot, fresh, and ready for us to bring on our train trip. The flavours were delicious, the vegan "meat" was cooked to perfection (great texture and flavour). The lemongrass chicken was our favourite, the pork was also excellent and the Peking duck was nicely done (not our favourite flavour wise but still visibly high quality). We really enjoyed it and would love to explore more of their menu! We highly recommend! | Prices are very reasonable and it‚Äôs fully vegetarian. In terms of taste it was not that good, most of the food tasted the same because of that sweet sauce. The thing covered in lotus leaf was like plain rice. From entrees that we tried, the best one was gyozas. I think you can enjoy the food without high expectations. | We enjoyed two lunch menus. The cabbage salad was especially tasty. The main dishes were good, although I would've preferred a spicy option (the Sriracha was put to good use though). Great price for the portion and quality of the food. Would definitely recommend! | Very close to where we were staying. All vegan food cooked to high quality, very tasty. Mixed platter of starters sorry no photo also excellent. Difficult to find vegan in Paris. Great selection on the menu some items I have not seen before. Staff very attentive and helpful in several languages. One of the best Chinese Vegan Restaurants we have been to.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: V√©g√©'Saveurs - Cuisine type: Vegetarian, Vegan, Chinese - Unique Dishes: Lemongrass chicken, Vegan "meat", Peking duck, Gyozas - Ambiance: Great vibes - Special Features: Fully vegetarian, High quality vegan food, Great service, Multilingual staff - Positive Aspects: Great find for vegetarians, Convenient for takeout, Affordable prices, Tasty food, Unique menu selection, Attentive staff

Name: Urban Greener
Reviews: Tiny little hole in the wall! Lovely staff and servers, great vegan food with an authentic French taste (think creams and sauces) and homey atmosphere. Not a white linen service but rewarding in its own way, we were alone at the end of our dinner and chatted with the chef about the neighborhood and where we could go for a drink after.  Just down the steps from Sacr√© Coeur, couldn‚Äôt be better placed.  Overall lovely time, please give it a visit! | The food is unique. You can choose from 2 options. The first meal was an Asian breakfast with summer rolls, mushroom soup, teriyaki tofu, and some other mushrooms which was very interesting with a unique taste. For dessert, we had pancakes with miso sauce which was okay. The chairs are uncomfortable and door handle from the bathroom flies off. I recommend the place for the food, but the restaurant needs some improvements. | I went here for dinner and also for brunch. I cannot recommend this place enough. The food is a perfect blend of traditional with inventive, and the flavors are decadently delicious. | Had brunch there and really enjoyed the food. Service could be better and more attentive but I am guessing that they are really overwhelmed during weekends. The food is great though- creative and tasty. | Cozy place with amazing food! We had both varieties of brunch menu with savoury pancake and toast with cashew cream cheese with side salad, sweet pancake and cookie with whipped cream and granola - these were perfectly portioned, the flavour profile was well balanced and the combination of different textures was very well thought out. In addition, we had a tasty coffee latte and the most delicious chai latte we‚Äôve ever tried! The server was very friendly and patient with us, too. This place is a true gem!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Urban Greener Keywords: Vegan, French cuisine, cozy atmosphere, hole in the wall, unique dishes, Asian breakfast, teriyaki tofu, miso sauce pancakes, creative flavors, inventive, decadent, cozy, savory pancake, sweet pancake, cashew cream cheese, chai latte, friendly service, gem

Name: Kitchen
Reviews: Quirky, cool and authentic veggie place with gluten free options. The owner knew what was in everything (including the milk!). Really good food and homemade cakes and cookies. Much needed in Paris ‚ù§Ô∏è | Good/fast service, great price, and delicious breakfast.  Ambiance was chill and quiet.  Small location but a good experience | Felicia our servers 10/10 Her play list supplying the tunes 10/10. The food 10/10 The Matcha vegan protein shake 10/10 The hot ginger and lemon 10/10 The breakfast (Matt‚Äôs toast) 10/10 | Hearty vegetarian meal :) Exactly what I needed after a week of croissants üòÖ The coffee was very good too.  I got their veggie stew bowl with egg and tahini. I think it could have used a bit more sauce and flavor, but still quite satisfied with my meal. | ÈùûÂ∏∏Â•ΩÂêÉÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂÆ∂ÔºåÊÉ≥ËØ¥ÂêäÊâì‰∏äÊµ∑‰∏Ä‰ºóbruch„ÄÇÂ∫ó‰∏ª‰∫∫ËõÆÂ•ΩÁöÑÔºåÂÅöÁöÑ‰∏úË•ø‰πüÂ•ΩÂêÉÔºåÂ∞§ÂÖ∂ÊòØpancakeÔºåÊ≤æ‰∏äÁ≥ñÊµÜÁÆÄÁõ¥Â•ΩÂêÉÂà∞ÁàÜÁÇ∏ÔºåÁé∞ÂÅöÁöÑÂ∞±ÊòØÂ•ΩÂêÉÂïäÔºÅËøòÁÇπ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰ªΩÊúâtoppingÁöÑtoastÔºàÂ•ΩÂÉèÊòØËøô‰∏™ÔºâÔºåËòëËèáÂíåË±ÜËÖêÂπ≤ÁöÑtoppingÁúüÁöÑÂ§™Â•ΩÂêÉ‰∫Ü...Á•ùÂ∫óÈïøÊó©ÁÇπÊääÂ∫óÂºÄÂà∞‰∏äÊµ∑ÔºÅÔºÅ Really nice food, hope your guys open this restaurant in Shanghai lol! It really worth. | I ordered the Avocado with gluten free pancakes which came with a hummus paste and feta cheese. All of this was accompanied by a fried egg and green salad. Quite a delightful surprise, as the cafe is cozy and unassuming. I also started with a chia pudding stuffed with berries. I would certainly eat here again and it's a great change from baguettes and croissants which I still love. | Unfortunately very disappointing. The waitress is completely unsympathetic, not a welcome face or a brief smile. Although I was the only customer in the store with my little daughter, the waitress didn't have the heart to hold the door open for me and my Little Child. I was with a full bag and the buggy. Nevertheless the food looked amazing on the internet but unfortunately disappointing at the Restaurant. It wasn't bad but not particularly good. I also think That it's great that you have free water on the tables, but they should be cleaned every now and then. | During a recent visit to Paris my partner and I were super thankful to have Kitchen close by to our hotel in Marais. The space was cute and the food tasted healthy and delicious.  First, yes the space is small but not abnormally smaller than many of the cafes in Paris. We didn't encounter any issues getting seated, but it was quiet in Paris at that time, so plan ahead!  We both got the veggie stew, which was a large bowl full of fresh and roasted veggies, avocado, and tofu. We also had a chai tea, pumpkin spice latte, and banana bread. It was an extremely satisfying and delicious lunch.  Finally, the staff was really friendly and accommodated our poor French skills with their much better fluency in English. Much appreciated! | Have had breakfast here every day while visiting Paris for the week. I keep ordering the pancakes with gorgeous, red fruit compote & sliced bananas. The fried egg adds some yummy protein to the meal. The staff has been extremely friendly. After hearing them speak to each other and other customers, I'm impressed with their ability to switch from French, English, and Swedish so effortlessly. The ambience is friendly, lively, and comforting. Love it here! | What a charming cozy eatery in the 3rd arrondissement of Paris! First of all, they got the best cappuccino I‚Äôve ever had in Paris: rich, balanced and smooth! Robert the owner told me they put in much effort into this, everything has to be right! They check the machine every day to make sure everything works right. I had pimped toast veggie sandwich and it was divine! My friend had classic pancake and he was in heaven! So glad we walked into this place. I followed its smell and found it in the alley.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Kitchen - Cuisine Type: Vegetarian, gluten-free options - Unique Dishes: homemade cakes, cookies, Matcha vegan protein shake, hot ginger and lemon, Avocado with gluten-free pancakes, veggie stew bowl with egg and tahini, chia pudding stuffed with berries, pancakes with red fruit compote & sliced bananas, pimped toast veggie sandwich, classic pancake - Ambiance: chill, cozy, friendly, lively - Special Features: small location, fast service, great price, accommodating staff, multilingual staff - Positive Reviews: good food quality, hearty vegetarian meal, delicious breakfast, cool and authentic vibe, friendly staff, satisfying and delicious meals, great coffee, various language fluency
Category: Petit d√©jeuner & brunch, V√©g√©tarien, Bars √† jus de fruits & smoothies

Name: Maisie Caf√©.
Address: 32 Rue du Mont Thabor, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: Well‚Ä¶ the food was nice and I like the fact that it was really homemade. Good coffee. Nice staff member.  They are proud to be vegan and gluten free (thank you) but I spotted a ‚Äúmarine collagen‚Äù on sale in the shop. I checked it and it was collagen from ‚Äúfish‚Äù, but those collagen with ‚Äúfish‚Äù are a disaster for so many ecological reasons. I told the owner of the place and‚Ä¶ he absolutely did not care and right after I left told his staff ‚Äúso what?‚Äù. It kind of drives me crazy that a vegan place would sell those harmful products for the ocean. | Amazing food and great coffee I had the leek quiche and my sister had the mushroom soup. It was so delicious seriously some of the best mushroom soup either of us have had in our lives. The waitress was very kind and patient with my French. The lattes were very good too! Would definitely recommend | Small cozy and cute place, they speak English. I had the Thai salad, which was quite bland. A better dressing would make wonders to that salad. The hummus with crackers was really good. I also tried the soup of the day, which was spinach and chickpeas, was quite nice and a generous portion. The focaccia bread was served warm and it was delicious. Good prices, bearing in mind this is central Paris. | Delicious and healthy, 100% vegan and gluten free! So happy to find this plant based-ayurvedic cozy restaurant in the city center. The food was delicious and so were the drinks and desserts. The service was wonderful too. It's a bit expensive, but healthy and tasty, and not touristy at all. | Vegan and gluten free cafe, as advertised!  Great service, friendly staff. Single bathroom.  Delicious food, amazing latt√©, seating for 50.  Overall a great experience.  We left happy and full.
Keywords: - Maisie Caf√© - Cuisine: Vegan, gluten-free, plant-based, ayurvedic - Specialties: Leek quiche, mushroom soup, hummus with crackers, Thai salad, spinach and chickpeas soup, focaccia bread - Ambiance: Small, cozy, cute, seating for 50 - Features: Homemade food, good coffee, single bathroom - Positive mentions: Delicious, healthy, amazing latt√©, great service, friendly staff, wonderful service, generous portions, good prices, non-touristy

Name: Comptoir Veggie
Reviews: Cute little place. A bit noisy with the market outside on the specific dsy we were there, but it was a bit cozy at the same time.  I had a buddha bowl with kale and sweet potato. It was tasty, but could have had some more ingredients. The granola was good, and the cheese cake was alright. Kind staff. | This is a solidly great coffee shop. I had the croissant, which was heavenly in its flavor, texture and peak flakiness, the V60 pour over, which had a balanced sweetness with no discernible bitterness, perfectly extracted, and the oat milk cappuccino which had milk that was steamed well.  They have a ton of other food options that I haven't tried yet. Everything here is vegan. The barista was very friendly, spoke perfect English so I could ask her a ton of questions and learn a lot.  The place is quaint with a cozy decor. The only thing I'd recommend is to get the barista an electric grinder for the pour over. It was painful watching her hand grind the coffee for the V60 even though she did without complaining. I felt bad ordering a second cup!  I highly recommend this coffee shop! | Absolutely fabulous veggie/vegan food and juice bar. The a√ßai bowls are delicious with a great variety of fruit the waffles are very tasty, my personal favourite is the mango passion fruit. Well worth the trek to this tiny place to get yourself something healthy, fresh, delicious and filling. Highly recommended in Paris! | Lovely vegan cafe with amazing lattes! I always get the soup (4.5‚Ç¨) as well as a pastry. | TOTALLY IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE üòçüòç The baguette was sooooooo tasty, the combination of the flavors is AMAZING. Love it, definitely coming back soon. We also took banana bread and citron cake, best cakes ever for real. Full 5 stars and more!!! üíöüå±üíö
Keywords: Comptoir Veggie, vegan, vegetarian, caf√©, cozy, quaint, vegan food, juice bar, buddha bowl, croissant, V60 pour over, oat milk cappuccino, a√ßa√≠ bowls, waffles, lattes, healthy, fresh, delicious, baguette, banana bread, citron cake, friendly staff, great variety, cozy decor, Paris, highly recommended.

Name: Hank Restaurant
Address: 8 Rue Marguerite de Rochechouart, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: Probably the best vegan burgers in Paris! We always come here first food stop on our trips to the city. Service is always excellent, people super friendly! And sometimes they surprise you by speaking not only French and English but also German :) | Note this is a self service space.  The burgers themselves were delicious and they had loads of different options to choose from. One thing that was a bit annoying was the buns were bigger than the burgers which meant there was a lot of bread left over.  Also the tartiflette cheese wasn‚Äôt particularly melty and both the chips and nuggets were a little undercooked.  Also the seating is quite high so if you have thiccer thighs it‚Äôs uncomfortable with very little space under the table‚Ä¶  However the burgers were super juicy and the staff were nice and I‚Äôm glad we went | Gorgeous and glorious! Very grateful the chef made a plain burger just with ketchup for 10 year old. She loved it. I loved the massive stacked burger with fig jam! | Excellent casual vegan fast food with a good burger variety!  The proprietors were very kind and patient with the language barrier.  We were alone in the restaurant and my son took a nap on the bench ‚Äî it has comfortable cushions. | ‚ÄúHank‚Äù joins the ever-so-fastly growing family of vegan places, which is a good thing - long gone are times where vegetarians and vegans could only find one or two places to eat. The burgers are nice, especially if you‚Äôre looking for the authentic, meaty taste, the service is nice and quick. The atmosphere needs to catch up, however - it‚Äôs nice to be laid back, but it almost seems like a student kitchen with adjacent dining room. A touch of love would greatly improve the place - and most importantly, match the quality of food.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Hank Restaurant - Cuisine: Vegan, Burgers - Unique Dishes: Vegan burger varieties, plain burger with ketchup, massive stacked burger with fig jam - Ambiance: Casual, self-service, comfortable cushions on benches - Special Features: Multilingual staff (French, English, German), accommodating to children, fast service - Positive Attributes: Delicious burgers, juicy burgers, excellent service, friendly staff, diverse menu options, good for families, accommodating with language barrier, quick service, growing vegan food scene in Paris

Name: Toutofu, Atelier de soja
Reviews: The food was spectacular. So delicious and comforting‚Äî definitely recommend the Dan Dan noodles. The restaurant looked like it was under construction but it was open for business! It was 16 euro for a meal but it was worth it! | The galette is not good but the Dan Dan noodles were excellent and great flavor. The ambience gives a home-like feeling. Disorganized behind the front desk like the others mention, but it seems to be part of the charm. I would recommend | Absolutely loved this place! Do not be fooled by its modest size and decor. I was served with so much care and was even given recommendations on other great vegan restaurants in Paris. Highly recommend it if you like tofu + great homemade noodles. The DAN DAN Noodles are absolutely delicious!! Will be back when in town for sure üíöüå± | The food was excellent, flavourful and one of a kind. I‚Äôve never had anything like the ‚Äúboulettes de tofu‚Äù. Great service too! | Small restaurant run by a family. The tofu is self-made and amazing. The server was super friendly. The inside is minimalist and a little bit messy, but clean.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Toutofu, Atelier de soja  Keywords: - Cuisine: Tofu, vegan, homemade noodles - Special Dishes: Dan Dan Noodles, boulettes de tofu - Ambiance: Home-like, minimalist, under construction charm - Special Features: Self-made tofu, family-run, friendly service - Positive Attributes: Spectacular, delicious, comforting, excellent flavor, great service, one of a kind

Name: Guenma√Ø
Reviews: For the vegan traveller looking to take a walking break - what a gem!! This place has such heart, I absolutely adore it!! Flavours and quality of ingredients, with a fresh squeezed juice.. fantastic!! Definitely enjoying the light grocery shopping after. Probably taking home some granola :) Thank you, thank you, thank you for this beautiful healthy place!! Home! | This was the first meal we had in Paris and it was okay. We started out with the miso soup which was more like a Korean miso soup rather than the traditional Japanese version, more flavorful and with vegetables added instead of just tofu. I can't remember the name of what we had for our main dishes, but it was a plate of dips and steamed vegetables with a salad. The white bean dip and the olive paste were the only outstanding items. The service was a bit slow, but it was the kitchen, not the server's. You pay at the register at the front where you deal with the non-English speaking lady which was fine since I got by on enough high school French. | We went there to eat in our way to Notre Damme. Althought it was a bit late for lunch in Paris (about 15 h) it was no problem. It's true that the kitchen is a bit slow, but the service was express (but not much english speaking). We went directly for the main course that was fine, a macrobiotic plate that I cannot recall its name. For dessert we took different sorts of apple cake (with nuts). As beverage we took an excellent carriot juice. At about 45 ‚Ç¨ for 2 persons it was I bit pricey in my opinion. | Macrobiotic health food store and tea shop with a little cafe in the back. I am not sure if it was really vegan, as something tasted very like tempura fish. I know zero French, but they were still nice to me and I pointed at something I wanted on the pictureless menu. Got a macrobiotic plate with lentils, carrots and cabbage, couscous-like grain, and a bowl of what seemed like pumpkin tom kha - that was the best part. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I knew more about macrobiotic food; I was going in search of vegan fare since I have a dairy allergy. I also thought ‚Ç¨17.50 was a little pricey. | They are only open for lunch yet their Google listing claims they're open until 8:30pm. Very misleading. We traveled all the way to them based on their vegetarian menu but were disappointed when they told us no dinner was available at 7pm. Please update your Google maps listing to stop misleading first time visitors. | A rip-off. I ordered a friut juice and a cereal vegetable item the size of a ping- pong ball (2.75 euros). The lady asked if I wanted some crudites with it. What she did not say was that a few strips of carrot cucumber abd red beets would increase the price of my ping- pong ball by 500 percent! I ended up having to pay 16 euros! Her comment? Oh , I forgot to show you the menu! I have seldom felt so cheated. | Such little gem! Food was delicious, location cannot be beat and this place is run by people who genuinely care about their customers. They also have a shop with amazing products. Will return for sure!!! | Excellent yummy healthy food. After a few days of indulging in all the Parisian food and wine, this felt like a great cleanse for my body. Mmmm! | One of my new favorite spots in Paris - a gem!Feels like eating at home - delicious and nutritious food - would eat lunch there everyday! | Our family lunch at this restaurant was a delight from start to finish. The delicious macrobiotic food, impeccable service, and very charming ambiance made for a memorable parisian experience. My experience at this restaurant was nothing short of exceptional.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Guenma√Ø Cuisine Type: Vegan, Macrobiotic Unique Dishes: Miso soup, Macrobiotic plate, White bean dip, Olive paste, Apple cake, Carrot juice Ambiance: Charming, Homely Special Features: Health food store, Fresh squeezed juice, Light grocery shopping Positive Aspects: Delicious food, Impeccable service, Caring staff, Nutritious, Cleanse, Gem, Memorable experience

Name: Adam et Eve Caf√© - Restaurant V√©g√©tarien
Reviews: In Paris on holiday, we wanted to have a healthy but tasteful dinner and found this place. High quality, great taste and very well balanced. Service was very kind and polite! | We need more of this kind of vegetarian restaurants. An amazing assortment of appetizers. Very creative with the dishes. They were all so good. The main course salads seemed like bigger portions of the appetizer salad but tasted good nevertheless. The spicy carrots, eggplant in Japanese sauce and sweet potato appetizer were the highlights. Highly recommended! | Amazing food and atmosphere we really enjoyed it. Stumbled in after a long day and Adam et eve cafe was exactly what we needed. We had the spicy carrots as a starte (was absolutely scrumptious) and are still waiting in the incredible recipe. I had the crispy tofu balls with lentils and roasted cauliflower it was delicious and the textures were great. My friend had the garahamasala curry which was also very nice if a touch sweet for my taste overall we had a wonderful time and  the food was amazing and the service was top notch! | A borderline religious experience here at Adam et Eve Cafe. This is what a vegetarian restaurant should be. A deliciously modern combination of Western and Eastern flavors. Try it out! | Finding a Vegetarian Cafe in the heart of Paris was really a stroke of luck. We enjoyed our meal here. Keep up the good work.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Adam et Eve Caf√© - Restaurant V√©g√©tarien - Cuisine: Vegetarian - Unique Dishes: Spicy carrots, eggplant in Japanese sauce, sweet potato appetizer, crispy tofu balls with lentils, roasted cauliflower, garahamasala curry - Ambiance: Modern, pleasant - Special Features: High quality, creative dishes, delicious flavors, top-notch service - Positive mentions: Healthy, tasteful, amazing assortment of appetizers, delicious, modern combination of Western and Eastern flavors, enjoyable meal

Name: Season Square
Reviews: NEW FAVORITE SPOT ALERT üì£  I LOVE this place! I found it by mistake, close to where I work, and I am blown away by how good, healthy and cheap the food is  !! I ordered the Aioli burger, with fries and Aioli sauce (because... Aioli is life üòÅ). I couldn't believe it was vegan! the texture, the presentation, the taste, everything was just perfect.  Recommended üíØ | Visited this restaurant with my meat eating sister and even she enjoyed it.  The little restaurant is super cute, free water as well. The table and chairs are comfy. There's a lot of different food choices. I got the BBQ burger and it was insanely tastey. My sister also loved her burger and said it even tasted the same as a "normal burger".  I also had a chocolate cookie and it was really good. The food prices are completely reasonable and it's only a 15 minute walk away from the arena.  If I was ever back in Paris I'd go here in a heartbeat. | The BBQ veggie burger was so good! And I loved whatever the seasoning was on the grilled corn on the side. The freshly juiced drink that I picked was perfect. The staff was friendly and spoke English, and the place was clean with lots of space. Not far from the metro. It might be off the beaten path, but definitely worth going to. I'll go again for sure. | Probably the best vegetarian burgers in Paris. They have unique steaks, much better than the beyond burger one. I tried all the burgers on the menu, and all of them are amazing. I find the ones with the non fried steak better. My only complaint is that this place is rarely open. | Reasonable prices. Good quality & quantity. I had gluten free burger, steakhouse fries, cold rooisbos, pannacotta, and almond latte. All for 20‚Ç¨ ¬´¬†100% vegan plus gluten free¬†¬ª They are all Delicious!!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Season Square  Keywords: - Vegan/Vegetarian cuisine - Aioli burger - BBQ burger - Chocolate cookie - Unique steaks - Grilled corn - Freshly juiced drink - Friendly staff - Reasonable prices - Gluten-free options - Rooibos tea - Panna cotta - Almond latte - Clean ambiance - Comfortable seating - Free water - English-speaking staff - Convenient location - Good quality & quantity

Name: Veggie lovers
Reviews: Amazing flavors, relaxing atmosphere and friendly service - we had a fantastic vegan dinner. We read great reviews before going and I was wondering if I am setting my expectations too high, but in the end I would say the place did live up to the reputation and my expectations.  Note: If I have to pick one flaw, I would say - it would have been nice if the pita bread they served on the side was warm. Probably that‚Äôs not usually served along with the dishes and they just gave us because we specifically inquired about it, not sure. Anyway, even without that the dishes themselves were mind blowing! And because of that I would still give this 5 stars. | Service was quick. But my friends and I were the only customers at 6.45 on a Thursday evening.. my local friend brought his dog along but we were asked to sit outside.. he found this surprising as majority of restaurants allow his dog inside..  food was good , tasty and good value for money. Would recommend | Highly recommend this restaurant if you are a vegetarian or a vegan visiting Paris. Perfect after a visit to centre Pompidou. Big portions, fresh and tasty food, for a reasonable price! Staff is very friendly as well! | Tucked on a narrow little street we found this place. We were craving for something a bit different (no actual association with any kind of articular fare), so we went for Vegetarian. It happened to be so good, super tasty, great portions and pure Middle Eastern flavors! They happened to be Syrian and it shows! Next door they own the Shawarma Lovers restaurant‚Ä¶. Did not try it but since we are into any good kind of food, we will try it next time! | Had a great mezze platter. The two ladies managing the spot were so hospital and took time to understand what I needed (a break from rich local fare. Read: no cream, no butter, no meat) and got me what I needed.  For all of you who need break from French food, come here!!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Veggie Lovers Cuisine Type: Vegan, Vegetarian, Middle Eastern Unique Dishes: Mezze platter, pita bread Ambiance: Relaxing, Friendly, Cozy Special Features: Quick service, Big portions, Fresh ingredients Positive Mention: Amazing flavors, Mind-blowing dishes, Tasty food, Good value for money, Friendly staff, Middle Eastern flavors, Large portions

Name: Riz Riz Marais
Reviews: The staff were very friendly, and the restaurant is bright and clean. But sad to say that we were both disappointed with the taste of the food. I will said that it‚Äôs quite overpriced. I had the dragon curry, and while the sauce was not bad, no very special, there wasn't enough of it to make all the rice flavorful.  Doe the dessert, the cheesecake was not like expected at all, but the mango sticky rice was quite good, not very sweet which I like it.  We were very looking forward as the review were good, but sadly its an average restaurant. | I had a wonderful experience at Riz Riz! The gluten free options are amazing and delicious! I wished I was spending more time in Paris so I could come back a second time. The staff were very friendly and accommodating and the service was great! | Food was pretty good and service was pleasant. It's very casual and lacks ambiance. It's fine if you are looking for a quick basic plant based meal but it is not a dining experience. It's more of a cafeteria. | You can't really go wrong with a vegan restaurant called rice rice. The food, setting, and service all contributed to a fantastic dinner.  Riz Riz is conveniently located in Marais and has a fairly large space--a number of tables, many of which could accommodate larger groups. After checking for our reservation, my partner and I were quickly seated and offered the choice of an English menu (thank you!)  For food, we settled on the "rice table" which was a bit of a smorgasbord of several dishes on their menu. It came in 8 decent size bowls, with another bowl of rice for each of us. There were a few stew/soup style bowls (which were all delicious), some that focused on chickpeas or edamame, another with sweet potato waffles, and one with an incredible beet hummus.  If it sounds like a lot of food, it was, even for two people. We both walked away very filled up, though stomach's happy. Pricing was reasonable too, keeping the wallet happy as well. And if you want to keep the night going, there's plenty of places nearby to grab a drink. Cheers! | We came here two times in the same week. Me and my family (which has vegan and gluten free restrictions) really appreciated the good food and service as well. Quality is really good and portions abundant. The second time we came it was approaching closing time, but we were still welcomed, served and given the time to eat. Absolutely recommended :) | The shared table of all the options was AMAZING!!! My favorite meal in Paris so far! Such a variety of flavors with each dish. | Absolutely outstanding and super-fun vegan restaurant.  Massively original dishes with an African touch and a mad original genius touch.  Someone insane is in that kitchen -and we should be very happy that maniac is there.  If you are a normal reasonable rational person, you would order one of the dishes on the menu and be very very happy.  But they offer a rice table option where they will bring you a bowl of rice and bowls of EVERYTHING they got in the kitchen.  OMG.  Decadence on a stick!  Among dishes you will never forget:  1) Waffles with sweet potato and vegetables. Chicken and waffles has met its vegan version - and the vegan version is better.  2) The best spinach dal you will have in your life. Tastes more like spinach than anything spinachy you have ever had.  3) Beet Hummus. Beets make everything good. Even dipping food.  4) Mango Masala. Because sweet is good.  5) Dragon Curry. Time to have the top of your head blown off. But this is so so savory! You need a little mega-fire to keep everything balanced, right? This is a vegan establishment, so there is no actual dragon meat in the dish.  6) A tabouli that will make tabouli haters love tabouli.  7) Black Panther. Edamame and vegetables. A bland counter to the other crazy stuff. But don't miss the black rice at the bottom!  * * *  If you get the full rice table, you also get dessert.  Their chocolate peanut butter mousse is the peanut-iest dessert you will ever eat in your life.  They make everything from scratch in their own kitchen.  So peanut butter here just means ground up peanuts.  The chocolate is a binder and a "straight man" to play off the peanuts.  The chocolate is almost like the chocolate in a mole.  How is chocolate peanut butter mousse as a dessert?  Just as insane as everything else in this amazing establishment!  * * *  I am sure Paris has haute haute haute fancy vegan restaurants for people who just have to have fine crystal and expensive silverware and lots of ou-la-la.  I don't care how tootie-pa-snootie the room is so long as the food is good.  This was a vegan meal we are going to remember for the rest of our life.  Add to it the fun factor of eating all these different things on top of the same bowl of rice ...  And this is Vegan Party Time - Only Totally Gourmet! | Tasty and cozy. Friendly staff + Fair prices but they have to do something about their toilet‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a disaster‚Ä¶ as a lot of places in Paris unfortunately. | I went with some friends just for a dessert. We ordered the cheesecake matcha and the chocolate mousse. I think the restaurant must hire more waiters to serve the customers so we could have a better time at the restaurant. | Riz Riz was an unexpected gem!  Food was delicious: highly recommend the sweet potato waffle and the mango curry.  Service is friendly and food came out fast.  Prices are reasonable.  The restaurant is nice and very clean.  We'll definitely return!
Keywords: Cuisine: Vegan, plant-based Dishes: Dragon curry, mango sticky rice, rice table, sweet potato waffles, beet hummus, spinach dal, tabouli, black Panther, chocolate peanut butter mousse, cheesecake matcha, chocolate mousse Ambiance: Bright, clean, casual, lacks ambiance, cozy Special Features: Gluten-free options, large space, shared table options, dessert included with rice table, homemade dishes Positive Aspects: Friendly staff, accommodating service, great food quality, reasonable pricing, variety of flavors, original and creative dishes, fast service, very clean restaurant, gem, recommended dishes, returning customers

Name: Love Juice Bar Tour Eiffel
Reviews: 09.12.2024  A hidden gem!  This place has fresh, wonderfully made juice and smoothies.  Additionally they have freshly made sandwiches.  This is one of the few places that have vegan options.  My sister has came a few times during our stay.  This is a pleasant atmosphere; however the physical seating area could use some work to make it more inviting. The service is excellent; they took the time to explain the menu.  I highly recommend this place. | Best avocado toast in Paris. There is lots of options for the bowls & protein drinks as well. | Very calm space to enjoy a vegan snack. The portions are quite small so our meal felt a little expensive compared to others we have had. It was very delicious though - keeping the menu small, I imagine this is consistent. | This is a brilliant little free-from cafe for people with allergies or intolerances. There's a really good food and drinks menu with a load of different juices and smoothies on offer. All the food items are gluten-free and vegan, and are absolutely delicious! As well as gluten and dairy, I also have a soya intolerance and there was only one thing on the menu I couldn't have - I'm not used to having so much choice! I went for the avo toast and a juice (both excellent) and then bought a cookie and a slice of cake as we left (also excellent!). The staff were incredibly friendly and very helpful navigating my dietary questions.  I couldn't recommend this cafe enough! | Great service and a√ßa√≠ bowl! The people working there were very nice and offered recommendations. It‚Äôs kind of hilarious that they try to charge an extra 2‚Ç¨ for peanut butter or almond butter, but the bowl was good without it. Plenty of seating inside and some tables outside as well.  I‚Äôm adding to the review after my second visit. Highly recommend the mango bowl. These are so good! The consistency is perfect; it‚Äôs like eating ice cream.
Keywords: Love Juice Bar Tour Eiffel, hidden gem, fresh juice, smoothies, sandwiches, vegan options, pleasant atmosphere, excellent service, avocado toast, bowls, protein drinks, calm space, small portions, gluten-free, vegan, allergen-friendly, friendly staff, a√ßa√≠ bowl, mango bowl.

Name: GangNam Falafel
Reviews: Maybe we came on a bad day. Staff is super nice it‚Äôs clean. But the food is too much, so to much that it‚Äôs not pleasant to eat. I will not recommend this one sadly, i found the idea brilliant tho . | Staff was nice and friendly. It's a small very place.  +1 Star for letting me try the mushroom bowl wich was quite tasty.  I ordered the classic sandwich. Unfortunately I can't agree with anyone here, it was super oily and if I wouldn't be that hungry I would have needed to throw it away. It was like drinking from a oil bottle while eating it. On top Falafel was super dry.  Next day I had some stomach problems. | Friendly staff. Food was great and very large portions. Bring a friend. The falafel bowl was smashing. Mushroom bowl = üî•  Their lemon ginger drink was perfect. | Greeted by the lovely owner who offered us a sample of to try and explained the entire menu to us. The other staff member was welcoming and cheery. The food and hibiscus tea was amazing, rich in flavour and tasty !!!!! We will definitely be returning sometime soon :) | Amazing owner Nicky, super serious about her cooking. Great concept and delicious food. All her sauces are homemade with love. The portion is huge and super affordable for the price. You can eat healthy without comprising the taste and quality. I took a mushroom bowl and my friend took the burger, we were so full we could barely walk.
Keywords: - GangNam Falafel - Falafel - Mushroom bowl - Classic sandwich - Lemon ginger drink - Hibiscus tea - Healthy eating - Homemade sauces - Large portions - Friendly staff - Welcoming atmosphere - Owner Nicky - Delicious food - Affordable prices - Small cozy place

Name: Itadakizen Paris
Reviews: Lovely hidden gem! It‚Äôs a very cozy little restaurant with nice staff and really nice vegan food. We tried the spicy ramen (could have it everyday!) and the sushi. Will definitely become a regular client! | I loved my experience here from start to finish! First of all, I love the vegan menu here! Quite varied and everything I tried was tasty üå±üòä I am so happy to finally taste a vegan panacotta! And also their vegan sushi üç£ was my fav out of everything I tasted!  I am so amazed that it is all made by one person - there is only the lady owner working and serving. She is wow!  The place is quite tiny but it adds to the charm. It has Studio Ghibli vibes ! | Amazing, tiny Japanese vegan restaurant. Spicy ramen is great! Be prepared to wait a bit if you go during lunch hour because there are only 6 spots inside but it‚Äôs worth it. | Well located near the Buttes Chaumont, this small & authentic Japanese restaurant serves vegan dishes like ramens, bento boxes and sushi/makis. The food is fresh, home made and pretty good overall! The atmosphere is warm & friendly and you feel transported to a local joint in Japan! | Here in Paris and we went looking for some vegan maki or vegan sushi.  This place DOES NOT DISAPPOINT! Very good presentation and taste. Portions were to be expected. Price was decent for Paris.  The only minor issue we had was seating. This is a micro restaurant that squeezes 6 people in only.  Customers visiting or bringing a party should know this ahead of time and ask for takeout.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Itadakizen Paris  Keywords: - Vegan - Japanese cuisine - Spicy ramen - Sushi - Homemade - Studio Ghibli vibes - Cozy ambiance - Small establishment - Warm and friendly atmosphere - Authentic - Fresh ingredients - Owner-operated - Limited seating - Decent pricing - Buttes Chaumont location

Name: Charli's Crew
Reviews: Of all the places we tried, this was by far our favorite spot for vegan & vegetarian food in Paris. Very refreshing to find a place that isn't super heavy/only faux meats. Our favorite for  both the food and the customer service! We are traveling to London next and our sweet waitress made us a little handwritten list of the best vegan options as well as areas/places to visit. Amazing all around. üòä | highly recommend , a delightful gem in central Paris. This restaurant offers a refreshing twist on dining with its focus on fresh, organic, and healthy cuisine. The vibrant and innovative dishes are bursting with natural flavors, making every bite a delight. The staff are incredibly warm and friendly, adding to the overall charm. The inviting ambiance, filled with natural light and greenery, creates a perfect setting for a memorable meal. For a wholesome and unique dining experience in Paris, Charlie‚Äôs crew is an absolute must-visit | This place is absolutely fabulous. Everyone can find something to eat here. It‚Äôs especially fabulous for anyone looking for gluten-free and vegan options. They do offer some dishes that are vegetarian. They make gluten-free bread in house, but they also offer regular bread but not in house made  I had my favorite, which is the tofu scramble with the beautiful salad and warm small tomatoes. Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly. My daughter had the chunacado sandwich With her homemade focaccia bread, which is gluten-free as well as vegan.   A new favorite dish of ours  Most of their bake goods are gluten-free and vegan. Their chocolate chocolate cookie is so good and they have a in house made snickers bar and bounty bar in the cold case. This is the way to eat, especially if you‚Äôre gonna go in for something sweet -  they use unrefined sugars too  We had hot chocolate with spices which included ginger and cinnamon. It was not spicy like spicy hot just perfectly balanced.  We also had golden hot shots. They serve them with a side of  apple slice  Some of my favorite hot shots ever.  I usually come to this place a couple of times every time I‚Äôm in Paris. I miss it when I am away.  Charlie, the owner with the beautiful smile and great energy is always helpful with me as I struggle with my French;  her first language is English as she hails from London  The staff is fantastic. Congratulate Charlie on creating such a fabulous addition to the Parisian food scene. Make a reservation for the weekend and enjoy their vegan eggs Benedict or get it with chicken eggs if you prefer. Benedict sauce is vegan, which is fantastic.  During the week you can just pop in.  The street is cute and not busy; enjoy their  tables outside.  They just celebrated three years. Congratulations and thank you again.  Back again. September 2024.  Check out that avocado rose with my tofu scramble so good.     This place is consistently excellent!!   (Open bright interior  with kind  friendly team - clearly Charlie set the tone and brings in great people.).  This place is welcoming to locals, and tourist. The street is so sweet. Don‚Äôt miss this place especially if you appreciate organic healthy delicious food | This restaurant is a cute small restaurant in one of the streets of France. This street is packed with vegetarian and vegan restaurants.. you must try this place because they serve good food and it‚Äôs worth a try. Definitely recommendable. | I really enjoyed in this place,it was great experience they have Gluten free option,and it stuff was very polite and friendly ,thats the reason I visited it twice in November and ,when I was back in December. Definitely my favorite brunch place in Paris!!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Charli's Crew - Vegan & Vegetarian Cuisine - Fresh, Organic, Healthy - Gluten-Free Options - Tofu Scramble - Chuna(cado) Sandwich - Homemade Bread - Unique Dishes - In-House Made Treats - Unrefined Sugars - Spiced Hot Chocolate - Golden Hot Shots - Owner Charlie - English-speaking - Vegan Eggs Benedict - Local & Tourist-Friendly - Bright Interior - Friendly Team - Outdoor Seating - Welcoming Ambiance

Name: SO NAT - Notre Dame de Lorette
Reviews: my favourite place to get lunch! it gets quite busy but it‚Äôs so worth it, the tofu bowl is absolutely exquisite i literally can‚Äôt get enough of it. also all girls are very very lovely and the place just radiates cheerfulness (i‚Äôm not even vegan but come here all the time) | After a long flight with No sleep I found this place a 10minute walk from my hotel and YUMMY!! Vegan and good amount of food. No English menu but nice helping customers and workers and that translated for me. Got the first bowl with butternut squash I couldn't help but eat a little before the photo | I had a nice bowl and sat outside. I enjoyed looking at the people walking by! Paris is such a lively city! I miss it already;-)  Btw do you know the ingredients for this bowl? I will try to recreate it around home! | Incredible food ! Wow ! What an amazing team and incredible food ! Thanks So nat !! We will come back ! | Had high hopes for this place, especially because it's so hard to find vegetarian food in Paris, but unfortunately we were extremely disappointed.  We got one of the Buddha bowls with tofu, beet, lemon sauce, roasted carrots, spinach, and quinoa. The tofu was completely bland and basically just boiled, while the beets and lemon sauce were incredibly strong - to the point that they were inedible to me.  We also got a pita sandwich with seitan and vegetables. It was one of the blandest sandwiches I've ever tasted in my life - there were no spices, seasonings, or sauces.  Finally, we got a chia pudding and a rice pudding. They were both extremely bland and unenjoyable.  While it was at first exciting to find a veg restaurant in Paris, I would most definitely not be back. | Came here shortly before they closed, but was able to order a small bowl and eat comfortably outside. The Tofu Tout Flamme was one of their Buddha Bowls that caught my attention pretty quickly - I was intrigued by the fact that it is served over sticky rice, which is one favorite kinds of rice. It also had shiitake mushrooms in a sat√© sauce, marinated tofu, kobacha squash, plantains, and fresh greens. I definitely enjoyed every single bite.  The small bowl was perfect for a light lunch. I like when places give you the option of small and large portions, so that you don't end up spending money on food that you're not going to eat and will end up going to waste.  Many other items on the menu looked fantastic, too, so this will definitely be a place I come back to next time I'm in Paris. | Plant based cafe serving variety of bowls fittingly named Buddha and nirvana. Bowls come with grains/legumes/veggies and the array of gorgeous colors make it so IG worthy! Super tasty and filling, a large bowl with juice is 14euros. Everything is fresh and delicious and there was quite the lunch crowd. The ambiance of the cafe is cozy, adorable and filled with natural light and plants that makes it enjoyable to dine in. Food was prepared quickly, the only downside is that the cashier had limited English. Not a problem since everything looked amazing and I'm sure we could do no wrong ordering anything on the menu. Plant based dining exists and hope to see more of these cafes!! | I can't stop coming back to So Nat--it's just so delicious! It's a great cafe for filling, well priced, and well flavored healthy food. There are a few set bowls to choose from or you can create your own. So many options to choose from. The decor is cute and so nat is always packed full during lunch hours. Despite being a small cafe, I can usually always find a place to sit down.  I often order a bowl (‚Ç¨10) with bulgar , white bean msabbaha, sweet potato, kale, shaved cauliflower with figs, spinach, and tahini. Menu slightly changes frequently. | As vegetarians, it's often a challenge to find good dining options when we travel. However, we had such an incredible experience here, with a wide variety of delicious options to choose from. We absolutely love this place - we ordered quite a number of dishes on multiple occasions and every single dish was packed with flavour, plenty of choices to choose from. The service is both super friendly and quick. Highly recommended! | Outstanding address for vegan food - a historical rarity in Paris. Fresh and healthy bowls and pitas easy for healthy on the go eating. It's hearty, well priced and the menu rotates. The staff are an absolute gem. I can only suggest sitting on the small terrace in the sun. 10/10 recommend.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: SO NAT - Notre Dame de Lorette - Cuisine: Vegan, plant-based - Unique Dishes: Tofu bowl, Buddha bowls, Tofu Tout Flamme, chia pudding, rice pudding - Ambiance: Cozy, adorable, natural light, plants, small terrace - Special Features: A variety of bowls, IG-worthy, fresh and delicious food, healthy options, well-priced, menu rotates - Positive Mentions: Exquisite food, lovely staff, cheerful ambiance, quick service, packed with flavor, friendly and quick service, highly recommended, outstanding vegan food, healthy on-the-go options, hearty, gem staff, 10/10 recommend.

Name: Polichinelle
Address: 51/53 Quai de Grenelle RDC de l'Hotel Yooma, 75015 Paris, France
Reviews: Good place for vegetarian food. I was hungry from an entire day of sightseeing and went for dinner, a buffet for ‚Ç¨59. There were several small plates for appetizers, entree and dessert. I liked the cauliflower entree dish the most. The place had ample seating and was relatively empty on a Tuesday night. | Really enjoyed our meal here. It‚Äôs hard to get an upscale dining experience without meat but Polichinelle has got you covered. Amazing all vegetarian buffet which was so beautifully presented. Definitely worth going if you, like us, are visiting Paris and want to have one more memorable meal from your trip! There are many options in the starters, main course and the desserts. We weren‚Äôt able to taste them all but whatever we tasted was top notch. Nothing disappointed and while pictures can‚Äôt do justice to the experience itself adding some to this review to give you a sense of what your meal might look like.  Ohh and a not so bad view of the Eiffel Tower from just outside the restaurant is a bonus for tourists :) | The best best vegetarian restaurant I‚Äôve ever tried. They offer and open buffet of entr√©es, main dish and dessert, and they offer 5 diversities for each. Food is just amazing and very well presented. Staff is super nice and environment is so elegant and music is not high so you can enjoy it in the background will having talking and eating. Totally recommend really worth it. | Best choice for vegetarian lovers... The brunch there will really make any vegetarian person happy, we did it many times. But my review and shots were from a special night dinner. Excellent food, excellent presentation of dishes, excellent service behind the bars/buffet.  The service in the restaurant is average and depending on the waiteress so we feel it's not a Management standard to have high Customer Satisfaction (once we be well served with a smile, the other time we feel it's Parisian style service, just eat, don't talk to me and leave)  My 2nd remark concerns the pastries, when we go to Polichinelle (best pastry chef in the World Christophe Michalak) we expect more special/original pastries than the simple ones served in the buffet.  It's very expensive but consider it a fine vegetarian dining/brunch experience.  I add a lot of shots of almost all dishes and even the menu to help you get your own idea. Thank me later üòÅ | A must visit - incredible all vegetarian restaurant, every dish was very tasty! The staff were extremely helpful, one of the best restaurants we‚Äôve been to, definitely worth the price
Keywords: - Polichinelle - Vegetarian food - Buffet - Cauliflower entree - Upscale dining - Paris - Eiffel Tower view - 5 varieties for each course - Elegant ambiance - Background music - Brunch - Excellent food presentation - Expensive - Patisserie expectations - Customer service variability - Helpful staff - Tasty dishes

Name: Chez Eating
Reviews: The two girls are so kind! The food was amazing, fried tofu 100% recommended | First of all I am taiwanese so I am biased but I would highly recommend this place! The food was delicious and the hostess/ chef was super warm and lovely.  We thoroughly had a great time here!  I only took photos of the mains half way through my meal so they were not included in this post but the food was presented beautifully, only to augment their full aromatic flavour! | Food that brings a smile on your face the moment it hits your taste buds. Friendly service in a very small restaurant. Really enjoyed the Champignon Eryngii menu. It left a tasty memory of our weekend in Paris. | Everything is so delicious and made of good ingredients: Tantan noodles , tofu, Mushroom tempera , home made cookies. Every time when I get a chance to be Paris , I will come to this cute and authentic place . Their food make me happy . It‚Äôs a hidden gem in the Marais . | The owner and the staff are super kind. It is a lovely place with delicious vegan and vegetarian Taiwanese/Japanese food!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Chez Eating Cuisine: Taiwanese, Japanese Ambiance: Small, cozy, authentic Special Features: Vegan, vegetarian, fried tofu, Champignon Eryngii menu Dishes: Tantan noodles, Mushroom tempura, homemade cookies, smiling food Positive Mentions: Delicious food, kind staff, warm host/chef, beautiful food presentation, hidden gem, aromatic flavors

Name: Le daily syrien veggie
Address: 72 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: Such a wonderful experience tasty food and great environment. The soup was amazing highly recommend it get the soup and everything else was a blast. Baklava was sooo good and not too sweet either. The staff are super friendly and so lovely. ü•∞ | So tasty! It was hard to choose from the appetizing vegetarian menu, but I was so pleased with my delicious and filling feta salad. Very generous with the feta, including cubed feta and phyllo-wrapped feta. We also ordered the Veggie Plate with a scrumptious assortment of dips, dishes, and hand pies. Friendly service, great prices, and excellent people-watching from the street seating. It‚Äôs not far to walk from Gare du Nord (15 mins), and well worth a visit for travellers or anyone else in the area. | We never tried Syrien food before and this is definitely a unique dining experience for us. We are Asian vegetarian and this is quite different from western veggie people. We explained to the restaurant owner (we assumed he is the owner) and he was so patient enthusiastic.  For us these foreign dishes were so special and delicious!  Happy to recommend this restaurant. | The food is really fresh and will wake up your taste buds. The staff is super friendly and take the lemonade, it's a blast! | tasty generous food and friendly service, you can‚Äôt go wrong
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Le daily syrien veggie - Cuisine: Syrian, Vegetarian - Unique Dishes: Feta Salad, Baklava, Veggie Plate - Ambiance: Great environment, Street seating - Special Features: Friendly service, Fresh food, Lemonade - Positive Mentions: Tasty food, Generous portions, Enthusiastic owner, Excellent people-watching, Fresh flavors

Name: Vegan Truck
Reviews: No reviews
