Name: mesa de HOY - PlantBased Restaurant
Reviews: The food here was absolutely incredible. We shared the crudit√© and herb dip, which was lovely. My friend got the roasted vegetable consomm√© and I got the corn tortilla with avocado and salsa macha, and honestly it was one of the most wonderful things I've eaten recently. It made me so happy.  The waitress was very friendly and nice, and the wines were great. I want to come back to try the rest now. | A beautiful little restaurant with a flower shop in front and connected to the hotel. It feels a bit like Japan meets EO nature and Design, which we love. They did a great job and the seating is very comfortable.  The food is informed by Mexican food just a bit however hailing from California. It was quite different. Which was great. I very much enjoyed the complex and delicious flavors of my brunch savory dish, which was a corn tortilla with black beans, avocado and salad. It was so good.  I was ready to order a second one because it was a small dish size. ‚Ç¨17.  My companion got the sweet pancakes, which were just OK.  I had the turmeric golden milk, which was fine. It could‚Äôve been hotter, but I asked for extra hot water.  They ran out of towels at the bathroom for drying your hands and one of the gentlemen, not in the photo was on his phone so much it would‚Äôve been nice. Had there been a little bit more attention to service.  We would order the dish I had again for sure. And try to understand it subtle complex flavors. Absolutely fantastic. I hope they build their menu up a little bit more. So happy to have this place and it‚Äôs extra lovely with the flower setting in front.  The brunch menu is small and I had | The BEST vegan dinner we had in Paris! The tostada and celeriac starters were super fragrant especially with the fresh, edible flowers! We don't usually like polenta as normally it's stodgy and heavy but this was worth the chance, it was super tasty and ended up being our favourite main, the tofu cream is just insanely good. The almond, olive oil cake was out of this world, absolutely divine! My fiance was suprised by my Bruce Bogtrotter moment eating all of the cake! The kind of yummy where you have to close your eyes to experience the true taste! The ambience was peaceful, almost Bali esque vibes. We will definitely be returning when we next visit Paris. Thank you so much :) | Lovely space, lovely food. Nice without feeling pretentious.  ‚Ç¨30 for the three course lunch seemed pretty good value. | Really lovely plant based restaurant! Lunch menu was a little small but the pasta was delicious! A little on the pricey side, but the inside was very nice and staff were very welcoming!
Keywords: Plant-based restaurant, mesa de HOY, unique dishes, corn tortilla with avocado and salsa macha, roasted vegetable consomm√©, Mexican-Californian fusion, flower shop ambiance, connected to hotel, friendly service, lovely wines, cozy seating, complex flavors, sweet pancakes, turmeric golden milk, attentive service, fragrant starters, edible flowers, tofu cream, almond olive oil cake, peaceful ambience, Bali vibes, three-course lunch, pasta, pricey, welcoming staff.

Name: Ginsburger Vegetarian Superstar
Address: 13 Rue du Roi de Sicile, 75004 Paris, France
Reviews: The place opened at sharp 6pm though it looked very much closed when I came there 5mins before. The staff is super friendly. The burger tasted good and juicy. And the music was great as well. It's tiny, but definitely worth a visit. | One of the best vegetarian burgers we ever had! It was very tasty. The truffle fries are also a great choice. We really liked this place. | We had an amazing experience here! Me and my partner are vegan but I‚Äôm also gluten free. The owner (I assume) said didn‚Äôt have any gf buns for the burger but insisted he would go get some right then. This is above and beyond for service we have gotten in Paris! My burger and bun was amazing and my husband enjoyed his meal as well. Highly suggest eating here whether you are plant based or not. | I got the classy burger. The burger tastes so good with the sprouts and truffle mushrooms. But the fries were mid.  Classy burger is 13 euro and fries are 5. I think you can just get the burger for the taste and then eat something else somewhere else because it‚Äôs not going to fill you alone. Anyways, the place is nice it‚Äôs in the Marais and service is also good. | I'm from America and I am completely overjoyed with one finding this place as well as trying it out! The burger that i got was spicy, sweet and savory all my favorite things in one! The customer service was so kind, warm and welcoming if you come to Paris PLEASE TRY THIS place you won't be disappointed
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Ginsburger Vegetarian Superstar Keywords: - Vegetarian - Burger - Truffle fries - Vegan-friendly - Gluten-free options - Friendly staff - Cozy ambiance - Great music - Above and beyond service - Classy burger - Sprouts - Truffle mushrooms - Spicy-sweet-savory flavors - Marais district - American approval - Customer service

Name: Yoummah
Reviews: It's difficult to find interesting and good quality food while traveling and Paris has many dodgy touristy restaurants on every corner. Yoummah was a great find. It's a blend of Arabic North African cuisine- Tunisian, Algerian, Moroccan. The decor is very calming. The ladies serving and cooking are charming and polite. The food- we had the variety hummus plate. Unfortunately it was hard to distinguish between the various versions of hummus. Though I could feel that the food was good quality, it certainly packed in flavor. Then I came for their aubergine dishes and that day the aubergine did not get delivered. Well, if it's 1/3 of your menu then how come there were no contingency plans? Meaning every grocery store sells good quality aubergine in France/Paris. A run to the grocery store would have done the trick....so disappointing. I had the best food (similar type of food) in Essaouria, Morocco. The flavors there were unbelievably great. | Yoummah is a great place for middle-east food! I got the 35‚Ç¨ menu and was very satisfied with the amount of food but also the quality that came with it! You get a taste of their different appetizers + a choice of main dish + dessert! The portions are huge and I left the restaurant completely full :) the only small regret is the lack of nicer desserts, their current ones have nothing too special, but I will definitely come back! | A ver nice place with a lay down atmosphere in a calmer street. The decoration is lively and the staff is really friendly. All dishes were good and had interesting flavours. The story behind the restaurant is heartwarming and knowing that everything is done in house with fresh ingredients is a blast. | This place is hidden treasure! We ordered many dishes and literally all of them were extremely delicious!!!!!!!! The 2 ladies there were soooo nice, helpful and kind thanks a lot to them. I would highly recommend this place to anyone going to Paris | The dishes are incredibly delicious and well seasoned. It's a restaurant that I will keep going back to.
Keywords: - Restaurant: Yoummah - Cuisine: Arabic, North African, Tunisian, Algerian, Moroccan - Ambiance: Calming, Lively, Lay down atmosphere - Service: Charming, Polite, Friendly, Helpful - Special dishes: Hummus plate, Aubergine dishes - Features: In-house cooking, Fresh ingredients - Positive mentions: Great quality food, Well-seasoned dishes, Huge portions, Hidden treasure, Delicious flavors, Heartwarming story, Good service

Name: Maceo
Address: 15 Rue des Petits Champs, 75001 Paris, France
Reviews: No reviews
Keywords: Cuisine type: French, European Unique dishes: Foie gras, escargot, creme brulee Ambiance: Intimate, cozy, romantic Special features: Outdoor seating, wine list, attentive service Positive mentions: Delicious food, authentic French cuisine, top-notch dining experience

Name: Happiz Monge
Reviews: Some traditional and non-traditional flavors. The vegan merguez was so good! It was described as sausage and tasted like pepperoni. The vegan bacon was also yummy! Those from the states who eat the frozen Annie's vegan pizza bites will like the the vegan mozzarella, especially with the vegan merguez! The red wine and rose were also very good! | Delicious pizzas with great vegan cheese (cow cheese also available), fresh vegetables and various mock meats. Friendly staff. We hope to eat here again before leaving Paris! | Delicious food! Loved the vegan pizza and vegan dessert. | The Vegan scene in Paris is mediocre, but this restaurant is definitely not. The food here was great. The atmosphere was nice and the service was excellent.  We opted for a custom vegan pizza and my wife decided on the soup, which she loved. My son and I thought the pizza was fantastic.  Prices were affordable, hours are very Parisian and the food was delicious. Highly recommend.  5/5.  ___________________  Follow me for more reviews, tips and photos! | Friendly service, many vegan options and nice house wine. The build your own pizza was a success, particularly the dough which is thin but fluffy where it counts üëå Wait was around 25min at peak dinner time service (after 8pm) which is perfectly reasonable. ‚Ç¨36 for 1 large, 1 medium and 2 red wine. Bring cash for tips. Will be back, thank you! üôèüòò
Keywords: Happiz Monge, Paris, vegan, pizza, vegan cheese, vegan mozzarella, vegan bacon, vegan merguez, mock meats, fresh vegetables, red wine, house wine, friendly service, affordable prices, custom pizza, thin fluffy dough, vegan dessert, atmosphere, excellent service, traditional flavors, non-traditional flavors.

Name: Judy Market
Reviews: A wonderful experience at Judy. I have a gluten-free family member so finding this restaurant/cafe was very exciting. Service was great, and even though it was almost a full restaurant and we didn‚Äôt have a reservation front of house kindly accommodated us. Food was all excellent- polenta fries were my favourite as the was extra crispy and seasoned with a delicious mix of sweet paprika and other spices. Portions are very good-sized so you get your money‚Äôs worth. Also loved the complimentary ginger shot we got given before the meal. Hope to come back to try the gluten-free pastries! | Amazing food and lot of options. I will definitely go back to try more things!! The place is very cozy and the staff is friendly and welcoming. Fast service. | The atmosphere of the place is so good. The service is really efficient and kindly. The food could be better , maybe I had the wrong dish so I think I need to go again to try another one. 18 ‚Ç¨ for 3 pieces of chicken and lettuce is a bit too much.. | My salad was so good with the crispy tofu. Glad to know it was also gluten-free. Unfortunately, the surface was not great which impacts the atmosphere.   I spent almost 15 minutes, trying to get someone‚Äôs attention and finally gave up and went inside the caf√© where I was sitting.  8 minutes past 4 PM and they said too late I couldn‚Äôt get the little side of tofu addition.  Fine, but the fact that they never came and checked on me after they delivered the food, especially before the kitchen closed - It wasn‚Äôt very busy. We are towards the end of August.    I was speaking French  though  poorly.  I will give them one more try and update this review | Really cute little place. Both my friend and i really liked the coffee here, the blend was excellent. The service is kind of slow but the serveuse are nice.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Judy Market - Cuisine: Gluten-free options, pastries - Unique Dishes: Polenta fries, crispy tofu salad - Ambiance: Cozy, good atmosphere, cute little place - Special Features: Complimentary ginger shot, efficient service, friendly staff - Positive Mentions: Great food, good portion sizes, worth the money, excellent coffee blend

Name: Le Bichat
Reviews: Really nice chilled place with great healthy food. Roasted vegetables in the salad is a great idea. Really tasty. Good value. Nice staff and nice atmosphere too. | This is an unpretentious place that serves nutritious bowls with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Would recommend | Food is very high quality, staff friendly. We went back here a few days in a row for healthy lunches. Highly recommend this place | Came here for my lunchbreak so it was very very busy, but as a foreigner and not speaking any French they were still so nice and helpful to explain the concept for a bit. 9‚Ç¨ for a vegan bowl is amazing for the ammount of veggies you get. It‚Äôs super tasty and the has a lot of flavour. It was a warm humid day, so it was also very hot inside, but the food was so good you won‚Äôt really notice it. | Really nice place, spacious, friendly staff, great food and the coffee and g√¢teau au chocolat were amazing!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Le Bichat Cuisine: Healthy, Nutritious bowls, Vegan Unique Dishes: Roasted vegetable salad, G√¢teau au chocolat Ambiance: Chilled, Indoor and outdoor seating, Spacious Special Features: Good value, Friendly staff, Great coffee, Highly recommended, Language-friendly staff,

Name: brEAThe Montorgueil - VEGAN SUSHI BAR
Reviews: A small vegan sushi restaurant with a very relaxed atmosphere and amazing food.  It's not traditional, but it doesn't tries to be. It's fresh, innovative, creative and delicious. The many different tastes you get will stay in your memories forever.  After some very good Ramen we wanted more, so we went with different sushi. We got blown away by the complexity of the chefs creation, it was simple yet so overwhelming.  The service was on point and had an eye on everything, we immediately felt welcomed.  We will definitely come back for more! | As a non-vegan, I was skeptical about the taste and texture of the sushi at brEAThe Vegan Sushi, but I was pleasantly surprised. The menu changes frequently, so I can't recommend one specific dish, but if you visit when they have the vegan omelet, it's definitely worth a try‚Äîit tastes just like the real thing! The crispy seitan could use a bit more seasoning, but overall, the experience was delightful. The innovative flavors and fresh ingredients made for a memorable meal. Highly recommended for both vegans and non-vegans alike! | Great sushi üç£ and a big variety of it. The staff was friendly and quick. It‚Äôs a small but cosy place. They have a few tables to sit outside. I will definitely come back. | Beautiful experience, very lovely staff! The food was great! The cheesecake had to be my favourite by far! Tasted just like the real deal! Thoroughly enjoyed the sushi and the pepper sauce was lovely and creamy!  The Oyakadon was super flavourful and highly recommend! | One of the best Sushis I have even tried especially the fried one. Would def go back for more! Each sushi has a unique flavour
Keywords: Restaurant: brEAThe Montorgueil - VEGAN SUSHI BAR Cuisine Type: Vegan Sushi Ambiance: Relaxed, Cozy Special Features: Innovative, Creative, Fresh Ingredients Unique Dishes: Vegan Omelet, Crispy Seitan, Fried Sushi, Cheesecake, Oyakadon Positive Aspects: Variety of Sushi, Friendly Staff, Memorable Experience

Name: Mori caf√©
Reviews: One of the best, if not THE best lunch I've ever had. It's a full vegan Japanese restaurant. Food is really well cared for, both aesthetically and in terms of ingredients. Overall everything is really clean and it has a good ambiance.  I'm considering coming back to Paris just to eat here again. | This place is perfect for vegans and vegetarians. If you‚Äôre a meat-eater, the appeal can be slightly reduced. The service is very fast and friendly. The chefs are Japanese and the food is good, but not outstanding. I would say this is more like a vegan version of Japanese fast food; in particular, the Udon salad sauce and the pickled onions are a bit too salty for my taste. If you‚Äôre used to outstanding Japanese food from coastal towns of the U.S., you might be slightly disappointed. Still, I would say it‚Äôs good Japanese food by Paris standards, and excellent by vegan standards. Portion-size is a bit small for the price. American Express accepted. | This was the best dining experience we had in Paris...and we had some good ones. The flavours- delicious! The service- the finest The ambience - perfection! Most importantly our little boy ate more at this meal than any other. He devoured the tofu tapa and then the soy protein and rice bowl. He also sampled our soups and would have eaten those too if we hadn't objected. Highly recommend! | Best place in Paris! The tantanmen was incredible - so rich and creamy. In addition, the space was so unique, cozy, and beautiful. I sat on the tatami upper level and had a great time enjoying the space and food. You must come here! | We got Tantanmen ramen (17.5‚Ç¨), Teriyaki Don (16‚Ç¨) and Edamame (4‚Ç¨). Tantanmen has a tasty thick bouillon with beyond meat. They serve good vegan japanese food.  My second time, I tried the miso ramen, I think tantanmen is better in terms of bouillon taste. Miso ramen is lighter. We didn‚Äôt like the cafe gourmand except the matcha cookie, but the flan was good.

Name: Le Mezze du chef √ßig k√∂fte
Reviews: I don't speak French, and the manager was very patient and helpful and extremely friendly as he helped me with the menu. The food was tasty, reasonably-priced, and presented beautifully. | You should definitely try the cigkofte (which is a turkish vegan dish made with bulgur, tomate paste and spices)! It tastes so good and is a nice reasonably priced vegan meal. Plus the owner and the service is great, you feel at home.  For the desert, I suggest the cafe gourmand with pistachio or the cafe gourmand normal which contains a turkish coffee and small parts of desserts. | Amazing service and food. This is one of my favorite places to eat in Paris. The staff are incredibly friendly and the food is always perfect. | Everything that I tried from the lentils soup, to the b√∂rek and cig kofte tasted fresh, delicious and was authentically Turkish. The prices are very affordable and I would definitely return to this restaurant! | If you would like to try true and delicious Turkish food; this is the place!! Great service, the owner is very kind and atmosphere makes you want to come back. It is my 10th time here, and surely I will come back! | Got takeaway b√∂rek here because I was craving some (I‚Äôm half Turkish) and it was amazing! The owner was so lovely, he gave me some of their handmade √ßiƒü k√∂fte to try and I tell you it is the best I have had! I will definitely be getting some more of the k√∂fte another time. They have good meal deals too. Highly recommend ‚ô•Ô∏è | Love it, the food was fresh and delicious! We got the vegan mezze for 2, and it was very satisfied. | Overly hip. Overly designed presentation of food that is available in so many simple Turkish restaurants around town. No indication that the owner/chef knows anything about traditional country Turkish vegetarian and vegan fare. A real disappointment for me. The prices, however, were reasonable. Finally, an extremely uncomfortable sitting experience.

Name: Mopa Sentier
Reviews: Very good vegan food! Small menu that changes regularly. I had one of the best plant-based sausages ever, and coming from a German that's saying something! We got in without a reservation on a Wednesday evening, I guess booking a table is advised towards the weekend as the restaurant is quite small. Friendly staff. Great cocktails too! | Excellent food, creative, and flavorful.  Sit down restaurant with fast table service and has a toilet.  Not touristy!  There was no English menu and everyone else in the restaurant was speaking French.  The menu is short ‚Äî 6 savory and 3 sweet ‚Äî and rotates every season.  I loved it.  It was not the best place for my 7yo ‚Äî the food was too interesting! ‚Äî but my 10yo enjoyed the arancino.  Eating a giant fried ball appealed to him! | Lovely lovely lovely vegan food in a cute little cafe setting. The ambience is perfect and food is soooo delicious! I had the Japan bowl and the salad, vegan chicken and portobello were just perfection. Service was friendly and prompt. Enjoyed my lunch a lot. Keep up the good work and highly recommended! | Very creative yummy vegetarian restaurant ! We went back 2 times in a row:) strongly recommend it. | Awesome vegan place with really filling and tasty food! We tried the arancini, cold beast burger, and doner kebab. The portions were very filling and the flavors were incredible. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Mopa Sentier Cuisine Type: Vegan, Vegetarian Unique Dishes: Plant-based sausages, Arancino, Cold beast burger, Doner kebab, Japan bowl Ambiance: Cute, Cafe setting, Lovely, Small restaurant, Sit-down Special Features: Short menu with seasonal rotation, Creative, Flavorful, Friendly staff, Great cocktails, Fast table service Positives: Delicious food, Friendly service, Filling portions, Highly recommended, Not touristy, No English menu, Prompt service

Name: M√õRE POISSONNI√àRE - Restaurant et traiteur
Address: 53 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: This cafe is perfect for a light , airy lunch and breakfast. Indoor and outdoor seating. Guests take a modern cafeteria tray to fresh and homemade dishes. The design is light and modern, and the personalized of the employees match the atmosphere perfectly. Highly recommended to start your day. | Our food was very tasty, the staff was super friendly, I will definitely come back again! | I love this place, fresh good quality produce and creative food. The staff is lovely, so thats an other plus | Love the coffee, healthy and great tasting food, and not forgetting their awesome friendly service too! | Best coffee in Paris and friendly service
Keywords: Cuisine type: Cafe/Restaurant, Light & Fresh, Homemade Dishes Unique dishes: Creative Food, Fresh Produce Ambiance: Light, Modern, Cafeteria Tray Service Special features: Indoor and Outdoor Seating, Friendly Staff, Best Coffee in Paris

Name: Nirvana Dream
Reviews: Food was below average. Momos/Dumplings seemed to be have frozen then steamed. Chicken chilly was below average in taste and didn't taste fresh. The lamb starter was dry and didn't seem fresh. Only the fried rice seemed to be good. We paid Eur 90 for 2 adults and 2 kids which was more expensive than our meals in French restaurants in Paris. | A super friendly, family run restaurant, true to Nepalese cuisine. Great VEGAN options too - they were very catering for a vegan diet. Would defo come back! | On vacation and we were craving some Nepali food. Very glad we chose Nirvana. The food, atmosphere, and especially the service were exceptional. If you are looking for authentic Nepali food, would highly recommend this location! | Good nepali food and the owner was so warm and welcoming. The traditional chicken thali was superb and would recommend it to everyone planning a visit | Good food, super friendly owner from Nepal :)
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Nirvana Dream - Cuisine: Nepali - Unique Dishes: Momos/Dumplings, Chicken Chilly, Lamb starter, Fried rice, Vegan options, Traditional chicken thali - Ambiance: Family-friendly, Warm and welcoming - Special Features: Family-run, Authentic Nepali cuisine, Exceptional service - Positives: Good food, Vegan-friendly, Super friendly owner, Highly recommended

Name: Joy In Food
Reviews: Delicious, healthy home-cooked food - we got the plat du jour, the soup and some vegan cakes and loved all of them. It smells SO good when you walk in - the kitchen is right there and you can tell all of the food is prepared fresh. It can be hard to find good vegetarian / vegan options in Paris so we were thrilled to find this place. The owners are very sweet and even gave us a little present for our baby. I thought that the prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food. Cash only but there is an ATM around the corner. Would highly recommend! | We went today and were pretty happy. The food was excellent, super tasty, and the environment relaxed and cozzy. Can highly recommend. | What a jewel! Delicious food, well-sized portions, relaxed atmosphere, and great service. My partner and I are vegan and had plenty of options. Hope to come back! | üå±Wow - incredibly beautiful energy the owners have. I can't speak French, and they very little English - however they made me, a female solo traveller, feel most welcome and catered to. üå±They suggested the cold plate with gazpacho as it was a very hot day. It was a delicious mix of salad, grains and pasta with falafel. 10/10 recommend.  I've tried to re-create the cold plate at home, but it's not quite the same! They obviously have some secret ingredients. üå± I chose a gluten free cherry cake for dessert, which was a bit like a sweet English crumpet. üå±The restaurant itself is very quaint and lovely. üå±This experience really made my trip! Thank you so much. I will be back. | Very tasty and well priced vegan food served in a homely charming and welcoming place by lovely lady.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Joy In Food - Cuisine: Healthy, home-cooked, vegetarian, vegan - Unique Dishes: Plat du jour, soup, vegan cakes - Ambiance: Cozy, relaxed, quaint, charming - Special Features: Owner hospitality, reasonable prices, homemade feel - Location: Paris - Positive Points: Freshly prepared food, accommodating to dietary needs, welcoming atmosphere, personalized service, recommended for solo travelers, secret ingredients in dishes

Name: Le Cr√©mieux
Reviews: Very near Gare de Lyon this is a fantastic spot for hearty and healthy dishes. I always get the coconut curry with veggies and lentils on rice. Consistently delicious! And with a choice of a homemade beverage, for me it‚Äôs ginger lemonade.For 12‚Ç¨ it is close and convenient if you just arrived at Gare de Lyon or if you would like a nice meal before a train trip.The lunchtime rush line moves quickly. Staff are super friendly and kindly offered to place my unyielding baggage behind the counter. Try it‚Ä¶..you‚Äôll like it. | Found this place just been we were looking for some warm home cooked food. Service was great, the concept is new yet simple and the food is fresh. | This place was absolutely amazing! The owner was so lovely and kind, and the food was amazing! The vegan bao was excellent! Highly recommend! The leftovers later were equally amazing! | I wanted to have a quick bite before heading to the Gare de Lyon train station. It's just around the corner. I walked in by chance drawn in by the number of people waiting in line. I took the Bao Ban filled with goodness.  The food was quickly served and super tasty!!!The staff were super friendly and even offered to store away my suitcase so I did not need to worry to put it. | Beautiful spot, great vegan and gluten free options. Service was wonderful, TY! =)
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Le Cr√©mieux  Keywords: - Near Gare de Lyon - Hearty and healthy dishes - Coconut curry with veggies and lentils - Homemade ginger lemonade - Affordable (12‚Ç¨) - Fast service - Friendly staff - Vegan options - Fresh food - Vegan bao - Gluten-free options - Warm home-cooked food - Lovely owner - Quick bite - Bao Ban - Place for train trips - Beautiful spot - New yet simple concept - Store baggage

Name: Jo and Nana Cakes
Reviews: A really nice little place. I stumbled in and had the pancakes and a cold drink - delicious and a huge portion! The lady who runs the cafe was very warm and accommodating - I had a sleeping toddler in the pram so she made space for me to sit comfortably at the side. | Really outstanding brunch experience. It's ‚Ç¨31 per person when you choose any of the nicer cakes (worth it for the Paris Brest) - a lot of money, but worth it for high quality vegan food and drink with understated excellent service. The teas were a revelation, particularly the smoked one. | If you‚Äôre vegan and in Paris this is a MUST visit! I have never had such amazing vegan patisserie before. It was one of these ‚Äúcan you check it‚Äôs really vegan moments‚Äù üòç I took it to go and was in a rush and the lovely lady stopped what she was doing and packed this lovely selection for me. The ones with the strawberry on top are INCREDIBLE!!!!ü§§‚ô•Ô∏è Thank you so much!! üíï | Reposting this review, Visited in April 2023:  What an amazing find! Was drawn in by the cute name and found it was fully vegan was a great surprise! The lemon tarte was so fresh and cleansing. The tiered strawberry cake was light for a vegan sponge, and the compote gorgeous. üçì  If you're vegan in Paris, this is a definite for bucket list eateries~ | Jo and Nana are famous for their vegan patisserie and I have to say the place totally lives up to the hype.  Last week I bought a pistachio Cruffin there and it was delicious! The pistachio Creme was rich and not too sweet and the dough of the Cruffin nice and soft on the inside and crispy on the outside.  I work close to this place - I will need to make sure I won‚Äôt gain too much weight ü§£  The place itself looks very cute and the service at the counter was very friendly helping me to choose between all the delicious things they offer.  Definitely highly recommended, especially for vegans!
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Jo and Nana Cakes - Cuisine Type: Vegan patisserie - Special Dishes: Paris Brest, lemon tarte, tiered strawberry cake, pistachio Cruffin - Ambiance: Cute, friendly service - Positive Aspects: High quality vegan food, delicious and huge portions, accommodating staff, outstanding service, recommended for vegans, must-visit in Paris, famous for vegan patisserie, lives up to the hype

Name: Bobun Break
Reviews: We were super hungry on the way to the Museum of Evolution and were looking for a good takeaway and decided to give this place a try. Staff were friendly and upon opening our takeaway, while sitting on the benches in the park, we were genuinely surprised by the large portions. The food was delicious. One of the best Chicken Bun Ga Nuong we‚Äôve had. Portions for the price were 2x more than what we get in London and the ingredients were very fresh tasting and well balanced. | I ordered takeout from Bobun Break chicken meal  and beef meal and was thoroughly impressed. The food was exceptionally delicious, with authentic Vietnamese flavors, and the service was outstanding. Despite the rain, the staff prepared my order with care and even lent me an umbrella, showing their thoughtful customer service. Highly recommended! | Absolutely in love with the food here! Affordable decent Vietnamese taste. I had a vegan version and it was amazing, plus for the big portion. From my experience, if the vegan tastes good, then the original one cant be doubted. They‚Äôre so nice to carefully explain to me how the vegan meat looks alike to the real meat and the ingredients they use so i can rest assure i get the right order. Definitely gonna come back for more. Thank you for making my lunch enjoyable üòã | 5 stars all day long. This was a random stop looking for a good snack on our last night in Paris. The owners were super friendly and the food was amazing. If you are staying near by absolutely go here for take out and sit by the river. The balance of fish sauce, sugar, and spice are perfect on all their dishes! | This place is incredible!!! We are visiting from the US and are staying next to this place so we stopped in. This is the best Vietnamese food my husband and I have ever had! You need to try the spring rolls! They remind me of the rolls my friend's mom made when I was growing up. Until now I've never been able to find one like it. The staff is so kind and the owner clearly cares about the food he serves. We will definitely be back multiple times before we leave!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Bobun Break Cuisine: Vietnamese Unique Dishes: Chicken Bun Ga Nuong, spring rolls Ambiance: Park benches, sit by the river Special Features: Large portions, authentic flavors, thoughtful customer service, vegan options Positive Mentions: Delicious food, friendly staff, outstanding service, fresh ingredients, affordable, kind owner, returning customers

Name: Loving Hut Paris
Reviews: It's hard to rate objectively when you've experienced Loving Hut in Prague. Actually none of Loving Huts outside Prague I've visited (London, Amsterdam, here) was remotely comparable with Prague's Huts in every aspect: variety of dishes, taste, exotic combination of ingredients, price. Anyways, the mister that served us was very nice and polite, food was good, place was a bit uneasy. But definitely worth the try if you're testing vegan restaurants in the town. | Wonderful vegan spot in Paris. I had the spring rolls as an appetizer and the pho. The pho was amazing, lots of greens and there was soy protein (kind of like faux beef) that was sososo good and exceeded my expectations. Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to go back. | Lunch today here. As a matter of fact this is my first time in this place. Sushi starters were really good, now waiting for the main. English spoken here, good and fast service. We were told to sit on a table for two (we first tried to go to a table for four), I guess this place will get packed in any moment now.... | I've been to several Loving Hut locations around the world and this one lives up to the standard of reliably good food. I got the mushroom crepe and a veggie sushi special with mock meat that a unique and delightful spin on vegan sushi. | Love this place! Highly recommend the Cha Cha ocean and the vegetable, tofu and noodles üòçüòçüòç‚ú® very nice staff and the food is incredible.
Keywords: Loving Hut Paris, vegan, spring rolls, pho, soy protein, fast service, sushi, mushroom crepe, veggie sushi, unique dishes, Cha Cha ocean, vegetable tofu noodles, friendly staff, ambiance

Name: Jimmy's Street Food
Reviews: Jimmy‚Äôs Street Food is awesome! We tried their loaded tenders, mac no‚Äô cheese, and Caesar salad during our first visit here. The Caesar salad was not what I was expecting for a traditional Caesar, but we still enjoyed it. Service was great and the food was served very quickly! Portions are very generous (between two people, we couldn‚Äôt finish all the food). The highlight by far was the giant vegan chocolate chip cookie we ordered for takeaway (it took the two of us a few days to finish it)! | Amazing vegan junk food restaurant with reasonable prices + tasty and big portions! I tried the sub sandwich with seitan which was huge. Liked the sandwich but didn‚Äôt like the wings however the taste of their stick, cinnamon sticks? was too strong for me. Anyways I recommend the place, I think it‚Äôs a good vegan option :) near the Montmartre area. | If you like street food you should definitely pay Jimmy a visit when in Paris! If you are a vegan and it is Monday it should be compulsory; then they serve an "all you can eat" offer for 19 euro. That means you get the chance to try everything on the menu, although I recommend subsequent orders since it is likely you will fill up fast! Loved the home made tenders (seitan, try it with the Ceasar dressing) and the cheeseburger. Go for it! | Cheap junk vegan food. Great price and friendly staff. Cheez burger and caesar salad was good. The wings‚Ä¶ great idea and presentation - nice use of jackfruit - but smells strongly of cinnamon, which is not my thing. Also, their cookies are huge! | We had some vegan tenders, sub sandwich and sweet potato fries. The tenders were fine even though kinda 'starchy'; in terms of flavor they can certainly be improved though. The sub sandwich is good and vegan cheese is quite realistic, but the bread was a bit mushy. The fries were what I like best: cruchy and flavorful. The meal is pricy but as Paris is not yet that vegan-friendly, I find it acceptable. Service was friendly! Overall a quick fix if you are vegan/vegetarian but miss the idea of fast food! üòâ
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Jimmy's Street Food - Cuisine: Vegan junk food - Unique dishes: Loaded tenders, mac no' cheese, vegan chocolate chip cookie, sub sandwich with seitan, cheeseburger, sweet potato fries - Ambiance: Street food style - Special features: Generous portions, "all you can eat" offer on Mondays, reasonable prices, vegan-friendly - Positive attributes: Quick service, friendly staff, tasty food, big portions, unique vegan options, homemade tenders, variety, good vegan option in Montmartre area, good vegan cheese, flavorful sweet potato fries

Name: Le Macareux
Reviews: We visited one night not knowing that most of our party would not be able to eat the home-made bread (nut allergy), but Florence was incredibly friendly and accommodating. In particular the gourmand salad was a beautiful combination of flavors and textures. The restaurant is well down a road off a popular strip, but is certainly worth the trip down the street to visit. | A real discovery! Organic, local, homemade, and above all healthy cuisine (they have their own bread). | Came for a concert, tried the food, great home made bread!!! | Pas un coup de c≈ìur L'id√©e est bonne, mais pas tr√®s fan du go√ªt  J'ai pris un BBCan, c'est original, mais je trouve le m√©lange de farine un peu amer, malheureusement l'amertume n'est pas du tout contre-balanc√©e par la garniture √† l'int√©rieur, la viande est tr√®s peu assaisonn√©e, les oignons sont √† peine blanchis ce qui rajoute encore un peu d'amer au sandwich  Je pense que des oignons un peu caram√©lis√©s mettraient plus en valeur le sandwich, peut-√™tre un peu plus d'√©pices aussi. Ne serait-ce que des herbes de Provence ou du poivre.  L√©g√®rement d√©go√ªt√© par la bouteille d'eau qui n'est pas nettoy√©e √† l'int√©rieur et pour laquelle il y a un peu de d√©p√¥t sur les parois int√©rieures  Dans l'ensemble experience tout de m√™me sympathique, mais je me tiendrai √† celle ci | Trop long √† lire : accueil tr√®s sympathique, un sandwich copieux le tout dans un cadre cosy.  D√©couvert gr√¢ce au passeport du guide ultime ! Malheureusement l'offre √©tait expir√© mais on m'a propos√© un geste commercial tr√®s appr√©ciable.  Le BBWICH √©tait copieux, go√ªteux et g√©n√©reux √† souhait ! Ne vous fiez pas √† sa taille. On en sort repu mais de mani√®re saine.  Le service √©tait tr√®s agr√©able je reviendrai dans soucis !
Keywords: Cuisine Type: Organic, local, homemade, healthy, bread Unique Dishes: Gourmand salad, BBCan, BBWICH Ambiance: Cozy, friendly Special Features: Accommodating, geste commercial (commercial gesture) Positives: Tasty food, generous portions, accommodating service

Name: Dirty Vegan Burgers by Taster
Reviews: Great chefs! Thanks for helping me sort out my order. Turned up late and you really helped me to get what I wanted. I was trying very hard to order through the pick up window but you helped me out to order online! Many thanks!! And great vegan burgers by the way!! | Expensive, order process not very human friendly. And they don‚Äôt declare VAT? Tax fraud? | I still remember this burger that I ate 2 year ago and this is probably the best thing that I‚Äôve ever ate in my life | Absolute trash.  Ordered off Uber Eats, took an hour and a half.  Arrived FREEZING COLD with missing items that I had paid to upgrade.  Wasn‚Äôt edible.  Uber EATS Refunded me ‚Ç¨3 for the upgrade, but not for the rest of the side that was missing, nor for the cold disgusting food.  Insulting!  Avoid at all costs and avoid Uber Eats as well! | This is very waiting place for customer. All of them staff are too lazy. They prefer to gossip to work .üò°I don‚Äôt recommend any1 to go there.üò°üò°

Name: New Jawad Longchamp
Reviews: The best Indian /Pakistani food I've had in over 5 years. Best Indian/Pakistani food in Paris Delicious curries Delicious pakora Delicious lassi Perfect / generous portions - you will not leave feeling hungry The atmosphere is beautiful and the service is professional and friendly. Very affordable prices. | Super classy restaurant , in Paris for 6 days but didn‚Äôt find a fine dine like this . Good food and spice level was made to order ‚Äúspicy‚Äù. Great service and friendly staff took good care of us as we were missing good Punjabi Indian food. Deserts in the picture were amazing, didn‚Äôt get chance to take food pics as they were gone by the time I got to my camera. Overall, a great fine dine Indian food in the heart of Paris, 5/5 | We entered the establishment on a Saturday night. Very busy as it's situated in the centre of Paris. They found us a table very quickly.  Staff are very attentive and friendly. The place was bustling and you can see the locals dine here too.  Food was pricey, but this was expected with it being in the centre and so close to the Eiffel. Drinks arrived promptly with poppadoms and chutney. Not sure and wasn't really fond of the banana and mango chutney two flavour which should not be mixed.  Food came and was pretty nice. Lamb and chicken curry was nice. Portion sizes were extremely small. This was expected. We ordered everything spicy but it was a tad sweet for us. Especially the vindaloo.  However, had a great time and would recommend giving this a try again. Decor was beautiful and reminded me of the old themed restaurants. Very classy. Staff were friendly and I loved it. | Best Indian/Pakistani food in whole of Paris. But treatment to foreigners and Indians was bit different.  Everyone got their papad except me who paid for a whole lunch set. | The best Indian Food I‚Äôve had in entire Paris. Every single item in the menu is worth the try. The butter chicken is the highlight of the menu. Delicious vegetarian food as well. The owner and staff is very very very friendly. They go out of the way to make you feel comfortable. I will definitely visit them again when I‚Äôm in Paris.  I‚Äôve traveled entire France, but no Restruant can beat there food.  The best part of the restaurant is their hospitality. The way they make you feel with there amazing service and the food.  I will definitely will rate this more than 5 if given an option.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: New Jawad Longchamp  Keywords: - Cuisine: Indian, Pakistani - Unique Dishes: Curries, Pakora, Lassi, Butter Chicken - Ambiance: Beautiful, Classy, Themed decor - Special Features: Generous portions, Good spice level customization, Delicious desserts - Service: Professional, Friendly, Attentive - Pricing: Affordable, Pricey in central location - Location: Paris - Noteworthy: High hospitality, Highly recommended

Name: India StreEAT
Reviews: Went to one of the best Indian restaurants outside of ‚Äúlittle India‚Äù in the 10√®me, called India StreEAT. The owner Thomas called it StreEAT because he was a child from the streets back in Bengal. A truly heartwarming story from the poor streets of India to becoming a restaurateur. A must go to in the 5eme.  The food was delicious. Lots of rich flavors. I particularly liked the Saag lamb and the saag paneer. Interesting, their achar (pickled accompaniment) was more of a sauce,  which we really enjoyed.‚Ä®‚Ä®Thomas is very warm, amicable and welcoming. It‚Äôs not always about the food, but the people who make the restaurant, n‚Äôest-ce pas? ‚Ä®‚Ä®Would we go back, ABSOLUTELY. | I have been to Indian restaurants all over the world and never experienced anything quite like this. There is a very personal touch to the service and a very delicate taste to the food. It‚Äôs affordable and delicious and English is not a problem here. Hopefully one day they bring this restaurant to Florida. | Phenomenal food. We got a couple appetizers and some mains. Side sauces were homemade and fresh. Super cute ambiance as well. Definitely would come back. | Flavorless and very far from real Indian cuisine. Portions where also not very generous.  Palak paneer: not much flavor, no garlic, ... Dal makhani: tasteless. 0 spices (garam masala), a flavor of heinz tomato sauce, super liquidy, These are the 2 top classics and not that difficult to make, so we were very disappointed. Won't recommend the restaurant unfortunately. Naan was good. Paratha was deep fried...  But very nice staff and cosy atmosphere. | Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Really good value for money too. Definitely worth a visit!
Keywords: India StreEAT, Indian cuisine, Saag lamb, saag paneer, achar sauce, heartwarming story, personal service, English-friendly, affordable, fresh homemade sauces, cozy atmosphere, great value, attentive staff.

Name: BAO & ME
Address: 89 Rue du Faubourg Poissonni√®re, 75009 Paris, France
Reviews: Great food. Great service. Friendly staff. They brought us English menus and were super friendly. The food was very unique and so tasty! | Friendly staff and excellent English speakers! The food is amazing, high quality ingredients and home made chips to compliment an amazing looking and tasting burger. I would recommend anyone to visit here! They also offer to put a hashbrown on your burger, do it. It tastes amazing. Not many tables so come early or reserve a table. Very well done BAO & ME! | We arrived without a reservation, but still got a seat straight away. The seating area downstairs is a little dark and cramped, but the food arrived very quickly and was tasty! | The restaurant is highly regarded on Tripadvisor so we decided to give it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised by its charming, laid back personality. The staff was accommodating with English menues and took our orders promptly. We then found a table (self-seating) with the food following us shortly after. The meals were fresh and most importantly delicious! I have never had a ramen burger this good! The unique flavour combination is distinctly memorable.  We are glad we decided to visit this restaurant and would highly recommend it! The price is also very reasonable for the area. | To begin with: - very small space, but they have outside as well - reserved always or go very very early - they have seasonal bao burger for the love of the Bao God. üòç - the girl was super nice to me and the guy at the cashier either - the burger don't have fries included. You choose your side dish for you alone or to share with your friends - bubble tea with tapioca pearls are sooooo good. I took a pi√±a colada with mango pearls. I order two burger: seasonal Halloween and the black charcoal with goat cheese and zucchini. The best burger on the men√π.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: BAO & ME Cuisine Type: Asian fusion Unique Dishes: Ramen burger, seasonal bao burger, black charcoal burger with goat cheese and zucchini Ambiance: Charming, laid back, small space (inside and outside seating available) Special Features: Friendly staff, excellent English speakers, home made chips, hashbrown option for burgers, self-seating, seasonal menu items Positive Aspects: Great food, great service, quick food delivery, accommodating staff, delicious meals, reasonable prices, highly recommended, bubble tea with tapioca pearls
