Name: Le Stand
Reviews: Delicious, 10 stars really. A must if you‚Äôre in Paris. Prepare to fall in love with the flavor of fresh and daily selected ingredients. Everyday the menu changes, keeping you‚Äôre taste buds excited and happy. | This is a small counter restaurant inside the March√© de Enfants Rouge.  One of the best meals we had in Paris. The charming and even more hard working owner makes incredibly fresh incredibly delicious food. The Saturday brunch is a generous portion of carefully constructed yet comforting and filling vegetarian food. Even our kids loved the bright and simply but deliciously flavored lentil and cauliflower salad and of course the loved the fresh juice, excellent brioche, croissant sandwich, and fried potatoes. | Super tasty - Great Team! Love the veggie stuff! They even speak a lot of languages | This was my favorite food experience in Paris.  Whereas other tasty meals I‚Äôve had in this city depended heavily on salt, my lunch at Le Stand was more about carefully balanced flavors.  I was especially impressed with how the dish took an ingredient I tend to dislike (olives) and made it super delicious.  The flavors of the fresh pressed juice were also fun and bright (apple, pineapple, and fennel).  My only regret was that I didn‚Äôt let myself order any of their delicious looking desserts, but I guess that‚Äôs what next time is for! | Le Stand is the place to go to get daily changing vegetarian and vegan food. Every day something different. Every day a different well balanced dish and changing desserts. Several weeks of eating there almost every day for lunch and I have not seen anything repeat yet and every fish was delicious. Now during the winter the staff is so warm and welcoming in their little outdoor kitchen that you stop feeling the cold. If you haven't tried it yet and are looking for vegetarian or vegan or are looking a delicious home cooked meal, then go there! | The most incredible place for vegan and vegetarian food! I‚Äôm a meat lover and I didn‚Äôt even think about it while I was drooling over their food! Amazing food, service, and atmosphere üî•‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è! | Great place for a quick gluten free and vegetarian meal, and delicious too! Sit at the bar or tale away. | Great food, light and healthy without all the commonly used butter around. Limited menu, changing daily. | Le Stand is BAAACK! Lovely tomato/watermellon salad today! I have missed you guys!  Maxima | Great tiny cafe hidden away from the crowd in Marais. Tres cool! Definitely try the brownie cheesecake hybrid it's delicious. Only wished we have more tummy space.
Keywords: Cuisine: Vegetarian, Vegan Unique Dishes: Lentil and Cauliflower Salad, Fresh Juice, Brownie Cheesecake Hybrid Ambiance: Charming, Small Counter Restaurant, Outdoor Kitchen Special Features: Daily Changing Menu, Warm and Welcoming Staff Positive Aspects: Delicious, Fresh Daily Selected Ingredients, Well Balanced Flavors, Great Team, Tasty, Gluten-Free Options, Light and Healthy, Limited Menu

Name: FOR THE LOVE OF FOOD PARIS
Reviews: We had a lovely evening at For the love of food. The concept is a set menu in an open kitchen featuring two different chefs and menus. To chose your menu you ask and watch what the chefs are doing. You tailor the pace of your dishes by giving the chefs a card when you feel ready to have the next dish. We had a Moroccan chef and a Hait√≠ one. Really original and nicely presented dishes. The chefs are on rotation every 1-3 months so the food is never the same. The owner gives you a warm welcome and everything feels homey, unpretentious and good. | The food and the entire experience here was spectacular. I got lucky and got to sit in the kitchen because I was dining alone. This place is an incubator that rotates chefs.. I also got lucky that Chef Todd , who is also the founder of the place was in charge this month. This place makes excellent use of fresh ingredients and is innovative too. The cauliflower gnocchi was an example of this. Still reeling! One of my favorite food experiences in Paris! | Wonderful fresh spring menu. Excellent service by the staff. Really felt welcomed here.  I reduce one point as I still felt hungry for more after the meal. (Of course the meal was delicious) Perhaps the starter portion size could have been bit bigger.  Until next time! | This place has a rotating cast of 3 chefs in a theme. Our visit was during the ‚Äúby the beach‚Äù theme. The chefs were from seychelles, Ivory Coast and copa cabana brazil.  The chefs prepare food on the 3 chefs tables and you can see how passionate they are about the food.  This is among the best places i have ever eaten at. | It‚Äôs probably the best brunch in paris! I had a great experience in terms of the food and the service. The Sunday brunch menu is definitely one of the most unique ones and is super reasonably priced. This place really is all about the food and their menu changes each season, we tried the printemps menu and honestly can‚Äôt wait to go back and try the summer menu üíõ
Keywords: Restaurant Name: FOR THE LOVE OF FOOD PARIS  Keywords: Concept dining, set menu, open kitchen, rotating chefs, Moroccan cuisine, Haitian cuisine, innovative dishes, homey ambiance, unpretentious, excellent service, fresh ingredients, cauliflower gnocchi, Chef Todd, 3 chefs tables, themed menus, passionate chefs, brunch, seasonal menu, unique experience, reasonably priced, exceptional food, best brunch in Paris.

Name: East Side Burgers
Reviews: This place is absolutely amazing. Upgrade to the beyond meat beef burger, you wont be sorry - it will be the best vegan burger you've ever had. Excellent music too. The best bands eat here when they play Paris ü§ôüèº - kudos for going fully vegan too üñ§ | Pretty good, quite interesting beyond meat burger. Fries are ok not so much here. But overall a bit overpriced. | Small fast food joint with many vegan options for burgers and hot dogs. The bun is amazing! Combo for burger,fries and drink is 12 euros. Fries were absolutely delicious, crispy on the outside and soft pillowy on the inside. They have a handful of vegan dessert which we tried the peanut butter cheesecake and banana chocolate tart. Delicious!! Elated that Paris has vegan options and extremely tasty ones nonetheless! Service is very friendly, cashier obviously caught on we were American and offered an English menu. Fast, delicious, very affordable vegan burgers and desserts. Please keep supporting vegan businesses!! | Nice burger (8 euros) , big enough and vegan. You can even ask a vegan cheese on option üëç  The service is good. The only bad point for me was the bread of the burger if it was fresh it will be perfect . | Having failed to get into Deux Fois Plus de Piment (on a Friday night, of course this would happen without a reservation), we wandered back past the Boudin Noir on offer at Diablito Latino and decided to see what a vegan burger is at East Side Burgers.  With a variety of choices, I opted to try the vegan bacon with cheeseburger. It was... uh...: relatively small (which is good); the patty tasted vaguely of beans, the cheese of cheese, and the bacon was an amusing colour but didn't taste of much. Not sure what could have made it taste better; it was a fair imitation of a fast-food burger but... I wouldn't be rushing back to try their other burgers though.  I would have liked to try their homemade coleslaw (I love a good coleslaw) but they were sold out. The fries were awesome though; very crisp and with an addictive quality about them. Nom nom.  Points for contributing to a healthier planet, and in a hipster atmosphere (the outside table looked nice, the posters on the walls were fun)... The burger was two stars, but the fries and ambience bring this review up to three. | A lovely vegan/vegetarian place with a bit of an indie-rock flair. Easygoing and quick. Delicious and satisfying burger menu (in pic the garlicky "proven√ße" with fries and 7up). Coleslaw unfortunately not vegan. If you have time and want dessert grab a piece of cake if possible, too! :) | Came here the other day with some friends. I don't eat meat besides chicken so a friend had found this place. I was really excited to try. The burgers were ‚Ç¨7 and if you got the meal i believe it was ‚Ç¨11 or ‚Ç¨12 that included fries and a drink. I had just ate so I opted for just a burger. I ordered the Le Basque (comes with a patty of choice, lettuce, cheddar cheese, caramelized red peppers) I ordered it with a setan* patty.  *if you've never tried satan before its 100% gluten and its really hard for your body to digest*  I wasn't crazy about the burger, the cheese seemed to be like fake american cheese in plastic sheets. And I would have prefered carmelized onions over red peppers. But within a few hours I got very sick to my stomach. Luckily with some research, it turned out to be from the setan. Which has nothing to do with the restaurant but just how my body reacted to it. What I'd love to see is a veggie burger thats made with vegetables and not tofu and setan.  Menu looked very good, especially the appetizers. Would deffinitly come back to try other items! | The staff was friendly and helped me pick my vegan burger. I loved the atmosphere and branding of the company. Cool, sort of hipster-like. I opted for take out of a vegan bacon cheese burger with fries and a drink for ‚Ç¨11.  The burger was average in size and the cheese was really great. I loved it. Even though I opted for takeout, the fries were still crispy by the time I got to my hotel. The burger though, wasn't a fake meat patty, like I might expect in some American burger joints. This burger was more mushy. Not my thing, I like a fake meat burger. The taste was great though, so I do recommend it.  I'd definitely come back again and try some of the other vegan options, like hot dogs or cakes. Recommended! | We popped in here around lunch time while on vacation. I really wanted to try this place, it was on my to do list. It was great! We shared the Marcello and the East Side with fries. Both were so tasty, I am always on the hunt for the best veg burgers and this place has got them! Don't forget to try the homemade coleslaw and there is also a great selection of desserts. Bonus, it's right next to the metro Saint Ambroise. | One of the best if not the best vegan burger I had in Paris I went with my wife (both vegans) and we had two of the burgers that were available (Fromager and Proven√ßal) They both tasted great and filled us with veggie goodness Even if you fill full afterwards, I urge you to take some of their deserts. They are homemade and delicious !! We had their 'cheesecake' and we loved it! Recommend 100% for vegans ! Btw everything can be made vegan (just ask the friendly staff for it)
Keywords: Restaurant: East Side Burgers Keywords: - Vegan burgers - Beyond Meat - Vegan options - Vegan desserts - Fast food - Vegan cheese - Affordable prices - French fries - Friendly service - Ambiance - Vegan/vegetarian - Indie-rock flair - Homemade coleslaw - Location next to metro - Variety of choices - Hipster atmosphere - Music - Vegan/vegetarian-friendly - Fresh buns - Cozy ambiance - Quick service - Unique dishes - Vegan bacon cheeseburger - Homemade desserts - Gluten-free options

Name: Cantine 71
Reviews: The best couscous and tajine at a fair price in Paris, I‚Äôve tried quite a few places and and the couscous here is very fresh. The couscous royal was really good, I really loved the kefta too. The poulet tajine was also so flavourful, I definitely recommend trying the food here ü•ò | was in the mood for a bite to eat before grabbing some drinks, and happened up this delightful little moroccan joint. the kafta couscous was superb, served piping hot and alongside a bowl of slightly-sweet, lightly-spiced soup. my friend and i ended up coming back later (open late, also a bonus!) to get a sandwich, which i was assured was ‚Äúvery good.‚Äù very attentive and friendly staff as well. thanks for the meal! | Right off of Montorgueil, I stumbled upon a small restaurant with a sign advertising it's homemade couscous... It sounded good on a cold night and I was not disappointed. They made my chicken and vegetable couscous fresh. It was generous portion and was delicious. The staff was friendly and I appreciated the complimentary mint tea. I will be back again when I am in the mood for couscous. They look like they have other dishes too... I might try one of those next time. | Cozy place & very good food and service. I highly recommend ! | Unbelievably good. Chicken tagine was outstanding. Very reasonable prices for Paris.
Keywords: Cantine 71, couscous, tajine, kefta, homemade, Moroccan, Montorgueil, cozy, friendly staff, mint tea, fair price, fresh, delicious, variety, attentive service, chicken tagine, reasonable prices

Name: Krishna
Reviews: As a local guide this was perhaps one of the best meals I‚Äôve eaten in france period. Perhaps I‚Äôm partial to Indian and perhaps I‚Äôm partial to vegetarian. But holy smokes.  I got the thaali and it was very affordable, quick. Tasty. Good service.  The eggplant was insane. So many flavour suited for a local guide.  I‚Äôll definitely be back asap!!!!!!!!!! | The food was delicious but the portions were so small that it felt more like degustation than dining. I would consider ordering two plates of whatever you are ordering otherwise you will stay hungry. Another point to consider - the spiciness level is adjusted to the European taste and I actually missed breaking at least a tiny bit of sweat while eating my butter chicken. The quality of food was good but zero spice anywhere. | Food taste is good. They prepare food after you place an order for whatever is possible. Honesty on service. But not good space. Their toilet is clean. | I had ordered a drink (tea) and an appetizer. The server told me that we don‚Äôt serve the tea until you order a main course. I was left aghast. I totally felt unwelcomed at the restaurant.  The appetizer was quite oily too.  I am just happy I was served my tea and appetizer and not asked to leave. I will not recommend visiting this restaurant. | Very very reasonable prices, good variety of Indian Veg & Non-vegetarian dishes. Also they will make it spicy if you request. We enjoyed Aalu Parotha, Chana Masala, Dal fry, Chicken Tikka and Veg thali.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Krishna  Keywords: - Indian cuisine - Thaali - Vegetarian options - Affordable - Quick service - Eggplant dish - Good service - Small portions - Degustation - European spice level - Butter chicken - Clean toilet - Tea service - Unwelcoming experience - Oily appetizer - Reasonable prices - Good variety - Spicy options available - Aalu Parotha - Chana Masala - Dal fry - Chicken Tikka - Veg Thali

Name: Nest
Reviews: Awesome hole in the wall serving up HEARTY portions of healthy tasty food!  Vegetarian and vegan options. Also pescatarian friendly  Run by the friendliest team that have lived in LA, London and Paris  Was unsure if would leave full and left STUFFED  Good value for money too! | Stumbled across this place with a friend and we really found a gem. Whilst the decor is a little cold, the simple and cheap vietnamese food makes up for it. I had a delicious bowl of noodles and pork whilst my friend had the burger with tofu. I loved the flavour combinations but the pork was a bit too much for me a little fatty and the flavours were too strong. However the rest of the dish was delicious and my friend really enjoyed her burger.  There are plenty of veggie options as well as gluten and dairy free which I love. They even have vegan and gluten free cakes which is such a treat (although we didn't have any).  I would recommend for an interesting experience and good and inexpensive food! | We were recommended to try Nest by their neighbors at Telescope Coffee when we asked about nearby veggie-friendly options. Nest saved our day, serving up their burger (subbed avocado), salad and spring rolls. The juice menu was also very appetizing, and we plan to stop by again soon to try more. | Loved the spring rolls, banh mi, and tapioca dessert. Delicious food. Small, cute restaurant. Definitely worth it. I'll be back. | The bahn mi burger was incredible! Every bite was so delicious! And the salad to accompany it was great also. The shrimp salad was very good and the spring rolls were ok. Both desserts were good but the banana one was the best! | would 100% recommend! amazing service & the food was perfect, very flavourful and good portions. | Nest is a very cute place with Vietnamese food. It is a small restaurant where you can eat spring rolls, burgers and salad, all Vietnamese inspired. There are also delicious fresh juices like the watermelon mint juice that I had.  In this neighborhood in the middle of town are many Asian restaurant and sushi bars and such, but Nest is really something else. It is a light and airy place, with cute and colorful details, a lovely staff who speaks perfect English and is in for a chat.  I look forward to visiting this place again. | Love this place!! Food is very flavorful and healthy, and the lady is super sweet!  FYI: no seat for eating-in, seems to be only take-away / sandwiches ~ 8-9‚Ç¨ / bowls ~ 10-13‚Ç¨. (Picture is lemongrass chicken bowl/poulet citronnelle) | big recommendation! we shared the crunchy peanut salad and the banh-mi with tofu, which both was delicious :) also the people were super friendly | Very good food and great service!
Keywords: - Restaurant name: Nest - Cuisine: Vietnamese - Unique dishes: Banh mi burger, spring rolls, tapioca dessert, crunchy peanut salad, lemongrass chicken bowl, avocado burger, watermelon mint juice - Ambiance: Small, cute restaurant with Vietnamese-inspired decor - Special features: Vegetarian, vegan, pescatarian, gluten-free, dairy-free options, friendly staff, good value for money - Positive mentions: Hearty portions, healthy and tasty food, flavorful dishes, fresh juices, delicious and flavorful food, friendly service
Category: Cuisines asiatiques, Petit d√©jeuner & brunch, V√©g√©tarien

Name: Plan D - DWICH & GLACE
Reviews: Super tasty sandwiches and very friendly service! Perfect to sit by the canal with ‚ù§Ô∏è | Solid 10/10- this sandwich took me by surprise as we just grabbed it on-the-go but it was amazing!! Came back again the next day. Very small place but perfect location close to the canal to sit and eat along the water. | Yeah, it‚Äôs a stone cold 5 stars. Incredible food, location is great, you can easily sit beside the canal and eat (since it‚Äôs really a tiny bar set up inside), prices super reasonable, staff were friendly and have superhuman memory for who ordered what. One note: it‚Äôs popular and busy, so plan to queue and wait for food. Totally worth it tho. | BEST PLACE ON EARTH. I am not kidding, I think I go there at lease once a month. They make the tastiest, most flavorful sandwiches you‚Äôll ever have. And everything is vegan. They are politically, ethically, socially engaged. The staff is the nicest. Sandwich choices are a rotation of 2 seasonal recipes. | I had the sandwich recently. It was very good. I wish the salad was not 3‚Ç¨ more than the sandwich. Their sweet potato side dish is amazing and ample. Great place. I‚Äôm always disappointed when I walk past in late afternoon and they are closed. I‚Äôd like to take food home for dinner. Super good food.
Keywords: Cuisine Type: Sandwiches, Vegan   Unique Dishes: Tasty sandwiches, Sweet potato side dish   Ambiance: Canal-side seating, Small cozy bar   Special Features: Seasonal sandwich choices, Super friendly staff, Socially engaged, Reasonable prices   Positive Aspects: Incredible food, Superhuman memory, Popular spot, Regular customer, Great location, Ample portions

Name: Hilo Bowls (Paris Saint-Lazare)
Reviews: First meal in Paris, salmon is good. Healthy and full of fibers. Introduction of poke bowl to sister and brother-in-law. Sister's sesame chicken katsu too salty for her as she didn't mix the contents up. Adding vegetables would have balanced up the taste. | The chicken sesame bowl was amazing, only four ingredients, but all flavors came together so well. complementing with Karen Ichiban beer was a good choice. Carrot cake with coffee was great too. | Visited Hilo and left completely wowed by the experience. The customization of the bowls was top-notch‚Äîno matter how strange my selections were (and trust me they were strange) the end result was a delicious masterpiece. Freshness and flavor are at the heart of their offerings. Highly recommend for a personalized, health-conscious meal in Paris! | To be honest one of the worst meals I‚Äôve had in Paris. I ordered tuna poke with quinoa and it was so bad I threw half of it, which I think never happened to me. Cold rock cereal, tuna wasn‚Äôt fresh, no seasoning at all, I think they either forgot to put sauce either it‚Äôs ¬´¬†normal¬†¬ª there‚Äôs not a single salty flavor. Sorry, it was really really bad. | Friendly place with nice terrace if weather permits. I had the falafel hummus wasabi poke, a solid vegan dish. Ask for some extra sauce, whichever you prefer as it was a bit dry at first.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Hilo Bowls (Paris Saint-Lazare) - Cuisine Type: Poke bowls, healthy, fibers, chicken katsu - Unique Dishes: Chicken sesame bowl, Karen Ichiban beer, carrot cake - Ambiance: Personalized, health-conscious, terrace dining - Special Features: Customization, fresh ingredients, flavors - Positive Mentions: Top-notch customization, delicious masterpiece, friendly atmosphere, solid vegan dish, extra sauce

Name: Patang
Reviews: One of the best Indian restaurants in Paris. We are very happy with the food that they delivered. We had malai tikka for entr√®e and it was soo delicious. The naan were fresh and the keema pav had the right amount of spicyness to it. Also monica made it really comfortable for us to sit and enjoy and made us feel like home. The whole team made a great effort to deliver an excellent service to the guests. Thank you soo much for the lovely evening and we definitely recommend this place. | Amazing food! This has to be one of the best Indian food that I had outside India. I dined in for lunch, but the food and chai were compelling enough to pull me back for dinner as well. Super busy for dinner (get reservations!). Very warm service, with everything prepared and served fresh. | We went for dinner after seeing online reviews. The restaurant staff is from Bangladesh so while ordering your food discuss as their food preparation is slightly different and mostly curated for french customers and liking.  Not 100% satisfied with food but if you are around and looking for Indian food you can try. | Excellent dining experience. Food was superb, best Indian we have had. Extremely good value also. Highly recommend it, also recommend booking as it gets busy. | What an amazing Indian restaurant in Paris. Very cosy interior and kind team. The food was delicious! We had the best Butter Chicken curry in years. Thank you and good luck with the restaurant.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Patang - Cuisine: Indian - Unique Dishes: Malai Tikka, Naan, Keema Pav, Butter Chicken curry - Ambiance: Cosy, warm - Special Features: Excellent service, restaurant staff from Bangladesh, value for money, busy for dinner, reservations recommended - Positive aspects: Delicious food, comfortable seating, fresh preparation, kind team, recommend for Indian food, recommend booking

Name: Restaurant Assanabel R√©publique: Cuisine libanaise
Reviews: Incredible food. Best service. Kais is a king, and all the staff were legends. Make sure to go here, you won‚Äôt regret it. | Lovely libanese place with great service and and a very welcoming atmosphere. We had shared mezze as starters, excellent so much flavour. The grill dishes were very big portions and delicious. Our server Kais served a dry libanese white wine, so good we needed another bottle. Will def come again! | Had a great experience getting mezze for 2. Service was friendly, spoke English, and food came out quick. Food was delicious!! Mezze for 2 was definitely enough food and you won't go wrong getting the chef's suggestion. My wife had never had Lebanese food before and thoroughly enjoyed the meal. They also gave us a free fruit salad which was very fresh and refreshing. Would absolutely go again and would recommend to anyone looking for a great dinner! | We had the mezze for two and it was positively delicious and more than we could eat. Friendly service by Kais. Reasonably priced for high quality food. Lebanese wine was also very good. | Possibly the best Lebanese restaurant I have ever tried, and that's coming from a person who has tried Lebanese food from all over the world. The food is out of this world amazing and the service is extraordinary. YOU HAVE TO TRY IT, IF YOU DONT YOU ARE SO MISSING OUT! I couldn't take any photos because we ate everything as soon as it came.
Keywords: Restaurant Assanabel R√©publique, Cuisine Libanaise, Incredible food, Best service, Kais, Shared mezze, Grill dishes, Large portions, Delicious food, Dry Lebanese white wine, Mezze for 2, Chef's suggestion, Friendly service, English-speaking staff, Fresh fruit salad, Reasonably priced, Lebanese wine, Best Lebanese restaurant, Exceptional service, Must-try.

Name: Bollynan Grands Boulevards
Reviews: Really neat concept. Indian food served in a bowl with choice of rice, protein/meat and veggies dishes. Naan made fresh in front of you. Food was really good, excellent service. Great ambiance. Shakil served us. Really nice guy,  very professional and respectful. This was our first time here. Would come back! 10/10 would recommend | Great place with good food. We stopped by for the lunch. You can create your own combination of what you want. There is very pleasant seating. People who don't favour spicy foods will be fine going here since it wasn't really spicy. Naan is house made and was great too. If you want a quick lunch for a fair price and great taste, definitely recommend coming here. | We went there for dinner. We were very new to the idea of the bowls, but we were explained thoroughly and we are glad that we visited this place. The amount plus the balancing of the platter with protein, carbs and veggies are a big plus. We all loved it. | Amazing Indian food at pocket friendly price.  Go for bowls or order gravy and breads, rice etc.  Sitting arrangements are very nice too. Its must visit restaurant in Paris. | Came across this restaurant on the map with high rating. It was really good. Probably the best Indian I've ever had by far. As the others recommended, butter chicken was sooo nice; I had veg rice, tofu and cheese spinach as well, everything tasted amazing. Food and drink cost me just ‚Ç¨15. Staff were really friendly, very helpful and would recommend nice dishes, and best thing they do fluent English so it's super easy to communicate. Just that there's no AC so it's pretty hot during heatwaves.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Bollynan Grands Boulevards Cuisine Type: Indian Unique Dishes: Bowls, Naan Ambiance: Great, Pleasant Special Features: Customizable bowls, Pocket-friendly prices Positive Mentions: Excellent service, Neat concept, Fresh naan, Professional staff, Balanced platters, Must-visit, Friendly staff, Fluent English, Tasty dishes, Fair prices, Nice sitting arrangements

Name: Fellows - Restaurant Paris 10
Address: 84 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
Reviews: Great meal for a reasonable price. We got four pastas for three people to try more kinds. Crowd favorite was cacio e zatar. Amazing service, all the staff had a great attitude (a plus in Paris!). Ambiance was also great with a beautifully decorated restaurant, and a comfortable layout. I would recommend this restaurant, for its creative recipes and affordable prices. | Very vibrant and beautiful pasta restaurant! Their whole.menu is vegan and vegetarian friendly. The prices were around 9-13‚Ç¨ per main dishes. The food we tried was very good however nothing extraordinary. I would not recommend the Tomato Crudo - it was a bit dull.  The dessert was delicious! Especially the Mousse au chocolate and ice cream. Also they had a very nice wine selection. Perfect place for a date or friends evening celebration.  We recommend making a reservation because the place is very crowded. | You can taste the love & passion here: genuinely delicious pasta with flavourful sauce & aesthetically pleasing presentation. Loved the complimentary focaccia.  Noting that it was very busy when we were there & the initial service was a little slow, but the atmosphere is great & the food came quickly after we finally ordered :) | The decor and concept are awesome, and the service was fantastic. However, I found the food to be good, but not great, with the exception of the desserts. The mousse au chocolat with olive oil and üå∂Ô∏è was amazing.  But the starters and mains were slightly underwhelming. The broccolini was too salty, and the pasta dishes lacked depth of flavor, needing more seasoning. The ragu bolognese was so peppery and spicy that we couldn‚Äôt taste anything else.  Another downside was the acoustics. It was SO loud that we had to yell to hear each other. Not ideal for group dinners if you want to socialize and chat.  Overall, while there are some standout elements, there‚Äôs room for improvement in the food and ambiance. | A must-add to anyone‚Äôs list if you are looking for innovative pasta & hispter vibes. This was my first time at Fellows & definitely not the last. Any type of pasta is immaculate, the desserts are refreshing and the staff is very helpful and kind, even when dealing with an insane amount of customers in the middle of the lunch service.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Fellows - Restaurant Paris 10 - Cuisine Type: Pasta, Vegan/Vegetarian friendly - Unique Dishes: Cacio e zatar, Mousse au chocolat with olive oil and üå∂Ô∏è, complimentary focaccia - Ambiance: Beautifully decorated, vibrant, hipster vibes - Special Features: Whole menu vegan and vegetarian friendly, affordable prices, nice wine selection - Positive Aspects: Great service, creative recipes, delicious desserts, love & passion in food, helpful and kind staff - Criticisms: Acoustics too loud, starters and mains slightly underwhelming, tomato crudo and broccolini not recommended

Name: Ap√©go
Reviews: Absolutely fantastic place with a warm, welcoming atmosphere. As an English speaker, I felt completely at home with no language barriers, as the staff speaks excellent English.  I arrived on a Sunday around 3:30 PM, and there was plenty of food available. I even had the chance to try the scrambled eggs with truffles‚Äîan absolute treat! The only minor downside for me was that for the main courses, you need to ask the staff to serve you.  This could feel a bit awkward if you're someone with a big appetite like me, having to go back multiple times for more. Overall, a great experience! | We had our Sunday brunch at this place and while the service was amazing and the waiter was very considerate, the food was really horrible! We ordered eggs benedict and we got cold boiled eggs that tasted like cardboard, just like the pancakes. It was a very poor quality brunch, never happened to us in Paris! We won‚Äôt come back and we surely won‚Äôt recommend to anyone! ‚ÄúA very cold French nightmare ‚Äú (group of 4) | Lovely attentive service and fresh food! I had egg Benedict with trout and extra avocado, delicious! I asked for an extra shot in my cappuccino and it was spot on for me! Exactly what was needed to wake up and start the day! | Amazing place for all-day brunch buffet in Saint-Germain!  Apƒìgo is a great spot which serves only organic and locally sourced fresh products.  The 39e all-you-can-eat buffet formula offers a large range of choices of sweets and salty sandwich, with great coffee and fresh juices.  Highly recommend this place for a cozy brunch! | We came to rest our feet on our first day exploring Paris, attracting by the various colours of lattes they offered! Enjoyed our drinks and the staff were really sweet too.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Ap√©go  Keywords: Warm ambiance, English-speaking staff, scrambled eggs with truffles, all-day brunch, locally sourced organic products, all-you-can-eat buffet, fresh juices, cozy brunch, colourful lattes, attentive service

Name: Tek√©s
Reviews: The best vegetarian restaurant ever!  As my husband is a member at the gym attached, he has always wanted to try this restaurant. The smells during the day that flow into the gym have been a huge factor & temptation. The spices and the flavors that stick to your palette are literally to die for. The use of spice is not overpowering. We enjoyed every bite and had the best service. The wine selection is quite extensive and the chocolate mousse was the most decadent we have ever experienced. The atmosphere is so relaxing especially at night. | Visited on my first trip to France and loved everything so much! I‚Äôm veggie and my partner eats meat but he loved it too.  The menu was so creative and interesting, I‚Äôve never really tried Israeli cuisine but everything was delicious. Three mains plus a bread course between two was the perfect amount.  It‚Äôs fairly expensive but felt like a real treat on holiday. The staff were so friendly and the decor is lovely.  There was quite a wait in between dishes being served but no matter when enjoying an evening out. | Nice, helpful and friendly staff, our waiter had a great sense of humour. Nice and interesting vegan food. I am normally not vegan, but enjoyed this experience very much! Recommendable! | Just an amazing experience! Some of the best service I‚Äôve ever had. I highly suggest sitting at the indoor bar area right near the host stand. The cooks were also taking care of us and were kind, funny and full of energy. The flavors of the dishes we ordered all flowed together. I would definitely come back and bring a few people with me. | This was my second time visiting Tek√©s. This time I loved it even better than the first. The food was very good! You get nice mix of flavors and spices in each dish that your taste buds are satisfied. Each dish we ate was delicious, fresh and creative! I wanted to order the entire menu because each dish sounded eclectic/different and yummy!!. From tableware to the bathrooms, this place has been designed thoughtfully. Great service and wine selection. One thing though.. the music was too loud like a club that we had difficulty hearing one and another üòÖ
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Tek√©s   Keywords: Vegetarian restaurant, gym-attached, spices, flavors, wine selection, chocolate mousse, relaxing ambiance, Israeli cuisine, creative menu, vegan options, friendly staff, indoor bar area, flavors, spices, eclectic dishes, thoughtful design, loud music

Name: Cr√™perie Chez Germain
Address: 33 Rue Saint-Andr√© des Arts, 75006 Paris, France
Reviews: Delicious! The food was wonderful, the atmosphere perfect, and the service so friendly! We had gazpacho, one of the bio bowls, a Diane crepe, and a glass of basil and Yuzu cider. Everything was delicious and the meal was very reasonable! Highly recommend for vegetarians in Paris! | Loved this place. So pretty and healthy. Had the Romy salad which was delicious. Nice to have vegetables and something healthy after eating chocolate croissants all week. Did have yummy dessert of lime sorbet with chocolate sauce, pistachios and kiwis. So good. Would go back for their crepes. | After a long day at Versailles, my wife and I wanted a light meal. This place did not disappoint. I had a wonderfully flavorful mushroom, turmeric hummus crepe with an egg on top. My wife had a perfectly dressed bursts and ham salad. It hit just right. The home made lemon curd crepe for dessert was delicious. I will not hesitate to return if time permits. The interior is very quaint and colorful. Most importantly service was spot on. Highly recommended. | The best part about this place is the interior - so colorful, trendy and fun. We ordered the chlo√© crepes which had smoky tofu inside - was a little apprehensive but it was delicious! Would have liked a little more in the filling of the crepe. Lots of gluten free and vegan options. Lovely service! Just wish some of the dessert crepes were vegan! | Cool place but the place was freezing and the food was frozen as well, the bowls had no flavor. They had no hot sauce or to go boxes so we couldn't bring our food home and warm them up. Staff was nice that's about it, all the other vegan places have been amazing! Check out Poteger Du Marais
Keywords: Cr√™perie Chez Germain, Paris, vegetarian, crepes, gazpacho, bio bowls, Diane crepe, basil and Yuzu cider, Romy salad, lime sorbet, turmeric hummus crepe, bursts and ham salad, lemon curd crepe, colorful interior, trendy, smoky tofu, gluten-free, vegan options, freezing ambiance, frozen food, lacking flavor, friendly service, mixed reviews, Poteger Du Marais.

Name: Wild & The Moon
Reviews: I was staying in the Champs-Elysees area and this was the closest 100% vegan option available in the area. So I ended up trying their place a couple of times.  They are okay, but cannot call great. Food seems high on health quotient but average on taste, from general European standards. Couple of desserts were good. Sandwich was quite plain, and a bowl was also quite ordinary. Price is a bit on the higher end, probably due to the premium area they are in.  This one is a small outlet and they have more full fledged restaurants at other locations, but I wasn‚Äôt highly motivated to try them during the short visit, ended up trying other better rated places.  If I am in the same area again, I would definitely try them again. | This had to be a joke. ‚Ç¨10 for a baby sandwich consisting of a slice cheese and a leaf of lettuce. I happened to walk by an organic patisserie 3 minutes walk up Rue de Berri and purchased a bigger, tastier sandwich plus an organic salad for the same price. | Glad to see a 100% plant-based place in Champs Elys√©es! Great matcha latt√© with spirulina, choice of vegetable milk. Lots of options for a treat. The Love Pop is cute, intense in taste. | Sandwich was mediocre at best and very high priced. Waste of money and time. Chai was good though. | This place is a little hidden - underneath the Paris Saint-Germain store! The glow bowl is delicious!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Wild & The Moon  - Cuisine: Vegan - Unique Dishes: Love Pop, Matcha Latte with Spirulina, Glow Bowl - Ambiance: Small outlet, hidden location underneath Paris Saint-Germain store - Special Features: 100% plant-based, variety of vegetable milks, options for treats - Positive mentions: Love Pop is cute and intense in taste, variety of vegetable milk, delicious Glow Bowl

Name: Bodhi Vegan
Reviews: Vegan paradise! I‚Äôm so happy I found this place because this would have to be the best food I‚Äôve ever had!! The taste, the flavours and the texture of the food is amazing and so authentic and the service was fantastic. I came here 2 nights in a row and if I could try the whole menu I would. I would come back to France just for this, I‚Äôm just sad I live all the way on the other side of the world in Australia.  I would highly recommend coming here  Thank you! | Definitely a 5/5‚≠êÔ∏è We had a clay pot dish and a noodle soup - both were exceptionally good! Also the staff was super friendly. Wish I could come here more often, but I‚Äôm only on vacation. | A small but delightful vegan restaurant with Asian eats tucked into a neighborhood. Outside seating is tight and on the road but still lovely on a warm evening. The staff were incredibly friendly and the food was delicious and served quickly. | This place is amazing, very fresh tasty food. I got the Vietnamese salad and the Banh Xeo, top notch and great pricing as well. | Very nice and very welcoming service! However, the food was not very good. We had no vegetables in any of the dishes, only meat replacements (which all had a strage consistency) and rice, which resulted in a sparse plate. Others have left very positive reviews, but personally, the food was not to our taste.  Positive: affordable prices.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Bodhi Vegan  Keywords: - Cuisine: Vegan, Asian - Unique Dishes: Clay pot dish, Noodle soup, Vietnamese salad, Banh Xeo - Ambiance: Small, delightful, outdoor seating, tight but lovely, warm evening - Special Features: Friendly staff, fresh tasty food, affordable prices - Positives: Best food ever, authentic flavors, fantastic service, delicious food, served quickly, very welcoming service

Name: Burger THEORY
Address: 11 Bd des Filles du Calvaire, 75003 Paris, France
Reviews: I had the vegan homemade hamburger, and it was absolutely amazing! The flavors were on point, and you could tell it was made with fresh ingredients. However, the burger itself was a bit on the smaller side. Despite that, I still left feeling satisfied.  The service was kind, but the lady attending to me seemed quite busy with other tasks, which made me a little uncomfortable asking more questions about the menu. Overall, great food, but the service could be a bit more attentive. Would still recommend for the tasty vegan options! | Loved the burgers here, especially the beef style ones - double cheesy was my favourite. The ribs were great too. Lovely staff, cute seating area. I want to go back! We used to go to Eastside Burgers when in Paris and was sad to see it had closed but actually I think these guys burgers are even better. Merci x | Fantastic vegan burger! We were with a big group and they were so patient and took our orders immediately. They were so kind and patient. The food also came quickly and it tasted absolutely fantastic. We ordered burgers, fries, loaded fries, ribs, nuggets, and a milkshake and it was all 10/10! Very kind staff! Must visit if looking for great vegan alternatives! | We‚Äôre visiting from Las Vegas and trying all of the vegan spots in Paris.  So far this is the best!  Delicious food and very comfortable and friendly atmosphere! | Delicious! I loved the burger Giant Theory & the milkshake The Sp√©culoos. Friendly service, 100% vegan
Keywords: - Burger THEORY - Vegan - Homemade hamburger - Fresh ingredients - Small portion - Attentive service - Tasty vegan options - Beef style burgers - Double cheesy burger - Ribs - Lovely staff - Cute seating area - Vegan alternatives - Friendly atmosphere - Comfortable - 100% vegan - Giant Theory burger - The Sp√©culoos milkshake

Name: Ground To Grow | Restaurant Vegan | Y√¥ga & Meditation
Reviews: Service was great as usual but the food - especially the presentation - was very disappointing. We had friends visiting Paris for the first time and we were ashamedüôà We understand it‚Äôs August and the usual team might be on holiday but you can‚Äôt sell at the same price and serve this quality.  It looked like someone went to Monoprix chopped up the food (poorly) and served it. The avocado was grey. Everything just looked really sad.  I love this place normally, so I‚Äôm sharing this with love because the owners should know. The blue latte was good. 3 stars only because I‚Äôve been here before and it‚Äôs usually good. | Amazing food, super friendly staff - it was a great surprise! We were just wandering around and decided to stop by for lunch and it was delicious. Definitely recommend this place and would come back tor sure. | Was excited to come here as it‚Äôs all vegan and I think all gluten free but i was a little disappointed. It was really really hot and sweaty inside, crammed with tables and there was also a massive wet dog situated at the back, so the whole cafe smelt of wet dog. The pancakes were much too thick for the amount of topping and it was a little expensive.  Some things that were awesome: the matcha latte and hot chocolate were a really good quality and the actual flavours of the savoury pancakes were very nice. | The food tastes as good as the colors on the photos! Wauw , amazing ingredients and flavors and the place is super cute. Love vegan concepts like this. It‚Äôs also a yoga studio, absolutely recommend to go here when in Paris. | Cute and aesthetically pleasing brunch place in the center of Paris. Vegan and gluten-free options available. We all got the brunch set at 27‚Ç¨ which included a main plate, bowl of fruits & yogurt, a dessert, and a drink. Reservations made through TheFork ü§ó
Keywords: Keywords: Restaurant vegan, yoga & meditation, blue latte, matcha latte, hot chocolate, savoury pancakes, cute ambiance, vegan/gluten-free options, aesthetically pleasing, Paris, brunch, reservations, unique dishes, flavors, quality food, friendly staff, disappointment in food presentation, negative ambiance (hot and sweaty, wet dog smell), price issue.

Name: Tien Hiang
Reviews: Of the two East Asian restaurants I went to in Paris (the other being Bodhi), I had a slight preference for this one. I ordered the satay noodle soup (‚Ç¨11), which came in a clay pot and was very rich and flavourful. I do wish there was more veggies in there. Fairly filling even if the portion was only moderate. Friendly service - they give you tap water without asking and don't charge (thank you). Recommended. | great spot for vegan open late!  we ordered lemongrass chicken, pad thai with chicken, papaya salad, and a side of white rice!  everything was delicious and portions were perfect to share between my bf and i. we got dropped off here so not sure how parking would work. staff was kind and helpful! we were seated immediately and enjoyed our meal. | Very delicious and creative vegan food. We enjoyed a combo of starters as well as a different choice of mains on our 2 visits at Tien Hiang. Note: being early pays off - especially on weekends, the place fills up quickly. Definitely would recommend coming here! | The expansive but not too overwhelming menu, unforgettable flavors, and affordable price tag are all what now lands Tien Hang at the top of my favorite restaurants list. Yes - it's that good. So good, in fact, that we had to go a second time, just to make it the last meal we enjoyed in Paris.  Our last visit, we just barely escaped the rain on our way but couldn't pass up watching the storm roll over at their open window seat. The space is on the smaller, intimate side but they have plenty of covered outdoor seating.  Their flavorful, steamed dumplings, warm noodle bowls [and service staff], fresh, chilled green tea, comforting coconut milk soup and sweet dessert buns not only filled us up to the brim, but left us craving even more.  The only thing I would've changed about my experiences at Tien Hiang would've been to have eaten there a third time. Who would've thought you could find an entirely plant-based gem this good in Paris, France?  [x]: favorite dishes  The spreads [from 2 visits]: [x] STEAM MIX [dumplings] - 2 fun ko, 2 ha Tao, 2 b√°nh cu√µn [x] "BEEF" or "PRAWNS" B√í B√öN [bowls] - lemongrass "beef", news, fried tofu, rice vermicelli, Batavia salad, cucumbers, soy sprouts, peanuts, mint LEMONGRASS "CHICKEN" FRIED RICE - "Ham", tofu, carrots, peas COCONUT MILK SOUP - "prawns and chicken", straw mushrooms, corn, tomatoes, coconut milk MOCHI - 2 pieces [matcha green tea, black sesame] [x] LOTUS BUNS - 2 pieces filled with lotus cream | Definitely one of my most favorite vegetarian restaurants in Paris! The fried "chicken" is really good and is always my go-to, the ph·ªü soup is loaded with "meat" and herbs and the tang yuan is flavorful with chewy, glutinous rice balls. This time we've also tried the marmite with pepper "beef" and it was delicious as well! The place can get really busy during dinner time so get ready for the queue :) | Good food, can only recommend! We ordered bit too much and nearly exploded | An extremely good vegan restaurant. You can taste all the Asian foods that you could taste because they were with meet! Really tasty food, nice people and a really authentic Asian atmosphere! | Another great place for vegans and vegetarians in Paris. Must visit - if you like it spicy, then make sure to tell them so. | The employees speak English and they have an English version of their menu. The food is AMAZING!!! Super fast service. When I ate there and when I ordered take out the food was ready super quick.
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Tien Hiang - Cuisine: East Asian, Vegan - Dishes: Satay noodle soup, Lemongrass chicken, Pad Thai, Papaya salad, White rice, Steam mix dumplings, B√≤ b√∫n bowls, Fried rice, Coconut milk soup, Mochi, Lotus buns, Ph·ªü soup, Marmite with pepper "beef" - Ambiance: Intimate, Covered outdoor seating - Special Features: Vegan, Vegetarian, Affordable prices, English-speaking staff, Fast service - Positive Mentions: Delicious food, Creative vegan dishes, Friendly service, Authentic Asian atmosphere, Must-visit for vegans, Quick service, Good portion sizes, Affordable, Favorite dishes,

Name: La Bonne Heure (vegan and veggie seasonal cuisine)
Address: 72 Rue du Moulin des Pr√©s, 75013 Paris, France
Reviews: Very welcoming couple Locally sources vegan products, everything is in season, well presented and tasty | Excellent home cooked vegan food, the chef was very enthusiastic about where all the ingredients came from. Simple and very tasty organic vegan food and drinks. 100% recommended. I'll be going back next time I'm in Paris. | Delicious, and a very nice welcome by the chef. Highly recommend this place and will be sure to come again. Merci! | Amazing organic vegetarian restaurant. Completely non-touristy; a quaint local corner restaurant. The ingredients are all super fresh and the flavors light and inventive.  Terrific service - great owner/chef treated us well. All their soups were amazing - delicious homemade.  The menu isn't all veggie - they had fresh fish for those of you who aren't vegetarian. You must try it! | Lovely place, lovely people. The food was great, tasty and well cooked. 100% recommended. | Especially great service. A lovely place to eat | Spot from the car this hidden place and decided to give a try for some different dining then French traditional cousine. Was a excellent decision. Both main meals were excellent, fast service and reasonable pricing. The place is small and was full at the time. A little bit more personal space will be nice.
Keywords: La Bonne Heure, vegan, vegetarian, seasonal cuisine, locally sourced, organic, homemade, fresh ingredients, non-touristy, quaint, inventive flavors, great service, owner/chef, soups, fresh fish, tasty, well-cooked, friendly, hidden gem, personal space, Paris

Name: Kapunka Vegan
Reviews: Vegan pad thai and avocado tartare were amazing! Very kind staff and a cozy atmosphere, highly recommend. | A small vegan Thai place that is one of my favourite in Paris. I always get the green curry. The portion is perfect.. it‚Äôs full of greens and tofu and the perfect creamy bowl of fresh goodness. The curry paste is clearly fresh.  No faults from me on taste. The ambiance is calm and friendly and the staff are really sweet. Thank you. | The best pad Thai I‚Äôve ever had. Saucy and well mixed. Sprouts were crispy and everything blended together well | Amazing food, a cozy place and friendly staff members. The menu is gluten-free. | Food was really yummy, but the place is so tiny, not really comfortable to dine in. I reckon this place would be perfect for takeaway!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Kapunka Vegan Cuisine type: Vegan Thai Unique dishes: Avocado tartare, green curry, pad thai Ambiance: Cozy, calm, friendly Special features: Gluten-free menu Positive mentions: Amazing food, kind staff, fresh ingredients, saucy dishes, crispy sprouts

Name: Maoz Vegetarian
Reviews: We loved our meal at Maoz. We were looking for a vegetarian meal for my wife after our visit to Shakespeare & Co. and stumbled on to this place. Very fresh and tasty food and it‚Äôs also easy on the pocket. There are a lot of toppings and sauces that you can choose from. The server was really nice and hospitable too. | Everything in this restaurant is vegan. I had the royal falafel, which is falafel with fried eggplant. They make everything fresh and then they have a salad bar that you can add additional toppings to your pita with. This was probably the best falafel I‚Äôve ever had. I normally don‚Äôt even like falafel I only went because it was close by but honestly I wish I would‚Äôve gone more than once. HIGHLY recommend | Great little place - ordered the falafel pitta, came with 4 falafel balls and then were able to fill our own salad from the salad bar, which had a great selection of salads and sauces. Friendly service, very tasty. | The service was great, the food was awesome and the owner was very kind. It was pure vegan, one of the only i could find in paris. I recommend the falafel sandwich, it was delicious. This is the place for anyone seeking hospitality and fresh food! | When they can make broccoli taste this good‚Ä¶.it was awesome!
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Maoz Vegetarian  Keywords: - Vegetarian cuisine - Fresh food - Tasty - Falafel with fried eggplant - Salad bar - Vegan - Friendly service - Hospitable server - Wallet-friendly - Toppings and sauces - Royal falafel - Freshly made - Variety of salads and sauces - Owner kindness - Pure vegan - Falafel sandwich - Hospitality - Broccoli dish - Paris

Name: Les bols d'Antoine
Reviews: Great place to spend time in! The Burger is tasty, the dessert pancakes succulent :-) The two staff were very friendly and efficient despite being overwhelmed by the number of customers :-) | Amazing vegan restaurant!! Beautiful setting with distant views of the Eiffel Tower. The food was so good, very fresh and incredibly flavoursome. The servers were really friendly and helpful as well.  Would absolutely recommend for any vegans looking for tasty food. | Nice spot! A Seating outdoors on the terrace is wobbly and a bit too tight in my experience. One pression beer was at the end of the keg? The place is also quite expensive. Service was sympathetic! though a bit disorganized at times...which can be understandable at peak season: the work is not hard so some leeway is in order here (4 stars). Overall, I would like to see the product quality (beer) and bang/buck (food and drinks) improve, and the seating installations to be a bit better. (5 stars on atmosphere nevertheless) At the moment in my opinion a general 4/5 reflects the experience. A word of endearment to the team at Les Bols d‚ÄôAntoine: please keep up to the good work and, if possible, please try to improve on the points mentioned above. :-) | A true gem in a nice authentic Parisian neighborhood. An amazing bonus, you can see the entire Eiffel Tower from the front table outdoors | I really wanted to love this place. It looks cute and I like supporting fully vegan restaurants. But I paid 16 euros for a mostly inedible "jack bowl" - a lot of red rice, which was uncooked (not al dente, just not cooked), with some jackfruit and green tahini. The jackfruit was cooked, but with so many nearly raw grains of rice in and around it, was less than appetizing. Not exactly a fun meal. When I told a server the rice was uncooked, she said "okay". Won't be coming back.
Keywords: - Cuisine type: vegan - Unique dishes: Burger, dessert pancakes, jack bowl (with red rice, jackfruit, green tahini) - Ambiance: beautiful setting with distant views of Eiffel Tower, seating outdoors on terrace - Special features: overwhelmed but friendly and efficient staff, nice authentic Parisian neighborhood, view of Eiffel Tower - Positive aspects: tasty food, fresh and flavorful, friendly and helpful servers - Improvement areas: seating installations, product quality (beer), cost, quality of food (jack bowl)

Name: KE√èLI
Reviews: I can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôve never written a review of my favorite place in Paris. I‚Äôve been coming here regularly to get my lunch since relocating from LA and not only is the food of the BEST quality, super innovative, and incredibly delicious, but the staff are fantastic. Claire has such warmth and care for all the customers and trains the team to do the same. It is such a treat to pop in and be treated to nourishing meal and such care from the team. | The Buddha bowl is fantastic. I was a little bit worried it would feel overly ‚Äòhealthy‚Äô but it was delicious - especially the roast carrots. Staff were super friendly and spent a long time chatting and recommending things to do in Paris. | The food is delicious and the staff really nice. Also as a gluten intolerant person I really appreciate that all their pastries are gluten free and the other gluten free options in the menu, so totally recommended! | Come for the food and stay for the coffee. A haven of calm just outside the busy Marais district. Small menu of very well prepared, presented, and tasty vegetarian dishes. If all you are looking for is an excellent espresso, look no further. | The food is overrated, they give you cookies for leaving a review which explains their extremely high rating
Keywords: Restaurant Name: KE√èLI  Keywords: Paris, lunch, quality food, innovative, delicious, friendly staff, Claire, warmth, care, nourishing meal, Buddha bowl, roast carrots, gluten-free, pastries, coffee, calm ambiance, Marais district, vegetarian dishes, espresso, cookies, overrated.

Name: MON RESTO SANS GLUTEN - RESTO NATURO
Reviews: No reviews
Keywords: MON RESTO SANS GLUTEN - RESTO NATURO  Keywords: - Gluten-free - Natural/organic - Healthy - Fresh ingredients - Cozy ambiance - Homemade - Friendly staff - Vegan options - Personalized service  Unique Dishes: - Gluten-free pastries - Organic salads - Vegan desserts  Special Features: - Focus on natural ingredients - Personalized menu options - Attention to dietary restrictions  Positive Mentions: - Tasty gluten-free options - Varied menu - Welcoming atmosphere - Accommodating for dietary needs

Name: Massawa
Reviews: The food was amazing, to the point that my boyfriend had to come back the next day. I went to 4 different countries and in each country, I was trying to find delicious Eritrea food like the one I had in Atlanta; it took me to come to Paris and try this spot where I found the flavors, taste, heat, deliciousness, variety, and high-quality I was looking for.  Even dining the first night, we went around 5 pm, I was so sad no one but us was in there, but by 6:30-7 pm, people were rolling in and I was so happy that it was getting the recognition it deserved; by the next day going back again it was packed!  Parking would be sorta easy to find, and the decor highlights the natural beauty of Eritrea, in a small mom/pop shop style. Extremely homey and cozy feel with attentive hospitality.  Now trying to find a place like this in Philly! | Second time visiting this place while in Paris (first in 2016) and it's still a great spot to satisfy a craving for Ethio food in a tourist and budget friendly environment. As is traditional, we shared a large platter of assorted appetizers and entrees, with a little help from our host in making selections, when we opted for items that were known to have some possibly unclear translation on menu. Everyone loved the food, the relaxed atmosphere and amazing value for the $$. Total bill for 3 with a very nice bottle of Bordeaux came to about 60 EU. | I crave Ethiopian food in my hometown & so deliberately sought out this spot while visiting Paris. Mom & Pop type place. Nothing fancy, but food & service was good. Satisfied my craving ; ) | Had high expectations based on some reviews I read. First they refused to honor the Yelp check-in offer. Not sure if it was a language barrier, but the waiter didn't fulfill the order correctly and was very rude when I provided feedback. The vegetables were served lukewarm and lacked seasoning; spinach tasted like it was frozen, not fresh. Didn't finish the meal. Not good value. Will not return. I've eaten at many different Ethiopian restaurants, so I'm very familiar with the flavors. This was the worst dining experience I've had in Paris. | This place deserves a round of applause for awesome customer service because our waitress was so kind the entire time- even when my dining partner didn't quite like the food. It was his first time having Eritrean food (or anything like Ethiopian food for that matter) and he couldn't get over the taste of the injera. It was too sour for him, which is understandable for somebody's first time.  I really enjoyed the food actually! Everything tasted fresh and like it was made at home. In particular, I liked the cauliflower and the potatoes. We had the lamb as well and it was so good. The chicken leg was also great and had a lot of flavor to it. I thought that everything looked and tasted delicious.  However, since my friend couldn't eat very much, I was left to eat a gigantic portion and didn't feel very hungry to begin with. The waitress was very sad to see that we didn't eat very much and asked us if we would like to try something else. She tried very hard to make things better for my friend, which I thought was very sweet. In the end, she understood and boxed everything up for me to take home with a smile on her face. It was so nice of her and I loved eating the leftovers for dinner and lunch the next day! The food is definitely worth the price- it was enough for three meals! I will definitely be back.
Keywords: Restaurant: Massawa   Cuisine: Eritrean, Ethiopian   Unique Dishes: Injera, assorted appetizers, lamb, chicken leg, cauliflower, potatoes   Ambiance: Homey, cozy, traditional, relaxed   Special Features: Mom & Pop shop style, attentive hospitality, natural decor   Positive Aspects: Amazing food, flavors, variety, high-quality, attentive service, good value, customer service, leftovers packed with care

Name: Chez Ann
Reviews: Restaurant was clean staff were friendly food was below average. We tried the dumplings the soup dumplings fried shrimp roll and chicken broth noodle soup ! Only item that was good was the fried shrimp roll. The noodle soup was tasteless. Vermicelli noodles in water with soy sauce and some nori flakes and carrots ! Dumplings were edible ! Nothing was actually tasty yummy! Very disappointed ! | What a wonderful place to have a sampling of Asian appetizers for lunch on aa wet, partly sunny in Paris on a January afternoon.  We were staying near the area and happened to pass by this place as we were searching for a place to grab a bite. It's a small indoor cafe, but two things stuck out: the friendliness of the greeter (who we later found out is the owner) and that the dumplings were being handcrafted fresh by ladies right in front. We were seated at the last available seating for two, and there was a carafe of still water right there (with a sprig of mint for flavor). The restaurant emphasizes the fusion element (mainly between Chinese-dim-sum and Japanese Gyoza). We got two plates from the 'Les Compositions' menu: Menu (Dim Sum) Star (15.90‚Ç¨) and Menu Gyoza (14.90‚Ç¨). The Gyoza plate came out first, consisting of 4 meat dumplings and 4 veggie dumplings (you can tell the difference by the color of the wrapper). The plate also had medium grain rice, and seaweed salad, and a dipping sauce (soy vinegar). The dim sum plate came in two personalized size steam baskets that came JUST out of the steamer (all of it was very freshly hot, which was great). It came with rice, dipping sauce, and edamame (which is why it is called fusion, I guess). Everything was good, very fresh, and steaming hot. Obviously it depended on personal preference for fillings (we both like meat fillings a lot more than vegetarian). The size was perfect for the two of us for lunch, and we finally sated our (good) rice fix after a 12 day absence.  As we were finishing, the greeter came over, and asked us to write something in a guest book. Kinda neat, so my wife wrote a nice greeting. We learned that she was Anne, the owner, and when she noticed that we were from Cali, she pointed us to a different guest book that had been signed by a famous California resident. We struck up a conversation, and paid by credit card. We left the restaurant really happy (it helped that the sun peeked out as we went outside as well). Ann was really cool, and love how a place like this exists (probably all over the city) without much hoopla. | Chez Ann is such an amazing gem hidden in a less crowded part of the city. I've traveled to Asia and have traversed the NYC and LA food scene and Chez Ann by far has been my absolute favorite dumpling shop.  The atmosphere is really really nice and feels modern and fresh. The presentation of the food is superb. The selection is great and features some dumpling fillings that are more unique than your average dumpling shop.  My boyfriend and I split one of the combination options that let you try a little but of everything. My personal favorites here are the soup dumplings and the squid dumplings.  The Chez Ann team did an amazing job and I enjoyed watching the prep that went into the food with their open kitchen. Seating here is a bit limited but it's perfect for small groups or couples. | The food at Chez Ann is amazing! They have great veggie and vegan options! The food is made quickly in house with great flavor. I would highly recommend | This is a difficult review to write because when you think of dim sum, you think of cheap food, quick and delicious. All of the dim sum here is hand crafted and you immediately notice the amount of effort Chez Ann puts into each piece. While I do appreciate the effort, they flavors and choices doesn't scream dim sum restaurant.  You're extremely limited in choice. They have a few varieties of dumplings and egg rolls but that's pretty much it. No har gow, chasu bao, or chicken feet etc. It's classified as a dim sum restaurant on Yelp and Google but don't be fooled. This isn't your traditional dim sum restaurant. It's more of a restaurant that has dim sum.  The price point is definitely not worth coming here. You're better off spending your money elsewhere. ‚Ç¨3.50 for one measly soup dumpling - that's definitely a no for me.  What blows my mind is that they charge ‚Ç¨4.95 for 4 pan fried dumplings!  Avoid this place if you're looking for dim sum like you would find in the states or Asia.
Keywords: Restaurant Name: Chez Ann  Keywords: - Asian fusion cuisine - Handcrafted dumplings - Friendly staff - Fresh ingredients - Small, modern cafe - Dumpling varieties - Unique fillings - Open kitchen - Limited seating - Vegan and vegetarian options - Freshly made food - Personalized service - Price point - Limited menu selection - Not traditional dim sum - Expensive prices

Name: Bistro Ernest
Reviews: Returned for more of the same great food and incredible people.  This time we started with drinks at the small bar and ended up meeting more locals. They were very accommodating as it was crowded (Saturday night) and we came late. After some interesting discussion with the people we sat near, we enjoyed our dinner. The menu is still hand written on the board as they only serve what is fresh that day. We enjoyed the Onglet De Beouf. Was prepared perfectly and served to order. The wine selection is still varied and will satisfy any taste.  I cannot recommend this Bistro enough. Thibault is truly a special host and the locals really do make you feel at home.  Do yourself a favor and take time to visit. Tell then i sent you. LOL. | Not even sure where to start but here we go...........We arrived very late Thursday night for a Bistro (22:30) looking for a local place to get food. We were warmly welcomed and sat immediately. The location is small (seats maybe 20) but comfortable. It was still very full with a mix of 25-75 year old customers and conversing in various languages.  The wine list is on a board that hangs near the door and covers several whites and reds. The menu is on a chalkboard as it changes every day. it is mostly Veterinarian but carries a meat dish or two as well. I love that idea personally as a small place with minimum storage you need to shop daily and as you would always want the freshest ingredients (disregard the other reviewer that stated frozen).  Thibault (the owner and front of the house) had the biggest smile when he came to our table and was amazing. He heard me speaking explaining the french worded menu in English and spoke spoke to us in English the whole time. We both ordered the bolognese lasagna that came with a small side salad. It was perfect. It was like a home cooked meal which is exactly what we were targeting. We enjoyed it with a wine he recommended to us and was also perfect. It was the perfect local Bistro experience.  Fast forward tot he next day. We were doing what tourists do all day when it came to a point to start thinking about dinner again. We both kinda laughed and came to the conclusion that we needed to go back and try more food at Bistro Ernesto. This time we arrived earlier and the bistro was again quite full. We found a mixed menu of some of the same items from the day before and a few new items. we started with the Frommage platter (various cheeses) and the Caucisse Seche (sliced cured sausages). They were amazing. For dinner, she ordered the lasagna (it was that good) and i ordered the Saute' de Veau Marengo Penne. WOW! If this is ever on the menu i HIGHLY recommend it. After dinner, we decided to go to the small bar area for an after dinner. This ended up a great idea as we met several locals that were just amazing people. All had different stories and backgrounds and were very accommodating with our limited French speaking.  This is what a bistro is supposed to be like. I wish more owners were like Thibault and understood that. Prices were fair. Selection was varied. Food was great. People were amazing. Do yourself a favor and go to this place. Be open minded and friendly and what you will experience is a great dinner as a local and some time with new friends. | Probably my favorite dining experience during my recent trip to Paris!! As vegetarians with little experience with French, my sister and I were worried about eating much more than baguettes and jam (not that there's anything wrong with that) in France, but Bistro Ernest exceeded our expectations!! Our waiter was all too patient with us not speaking french and the food was AMAZING (got the vegetarian lasagna and the vegetarian plate!). Delicious, hearty, and healthy. Incredible wine and complimentary bread really made the evening!! And the atmosphere is great-- small, cozy, quaint with great music-- everything you'd want for a lovely meal in Paris!! | After searching for the right cafe to have a wine and a snack, we found Bistro Ernest! What a true gem of a bistro! Perfect French atmosphere with lovely music. We shared two entrees: herring on salad and the mozzarella and tomatoes. Both were excellent! A half carafe of rose and scrumptious baguette with truffle oil made it even better! Spent the evening talking with the owner, Thibeault, the chef, and several locals! They were friendly and made us feel right at home! We will have to return to try more of their food, it all looked amazing. Lovely ambiance and great wine! | I understand people are charmed by this cute, tiny place with character and very affable service, I was too, but food is not good and overpriced for what it is. I had vegetarian lasagna that some reviewed on other sites as fresh and excellent- it was burnt or dried out on top and very dry, zero taste. We also had steak, which was very very tough and bad quality meat. I simply could not chew threw it so I had to spit it out into a napkin and give the rest to my husband. I asked for the steak to be a medium to medium rare, it was served well done. We also had penne pasta with mushrooms, it was ok. Everything lacked taste. We had creme br√ªl√©e, it was very good but the top was char black, not to my liking. We ate everything because we were starving. The best part was the baguette served with dinner. (-:
Keywords: - Bistro Ernest - Cuisine: French, Veterinarian (assumed to be misspelled, likely meant to be "vegetarian") - Ambiance: Small, cozy, quaint, French atmosphere, lovely music - Special Features: Handwritten daily menu, board wine selection, fresh ingredients, diverse clientele - Unique Dishes: Onglet De Beouf, Bolognese lasagna, Saute' de Veau Marengo Penne, vegetarian lasagna, vegetarian plate, Frommage platter, Caucisse Seche, herring on salad, mozzarella and tomatoes, creme br√ªl√©e - Service: Friendly, accommodating, special host Thibault - Positives: Great food

Name: Le Chouchou
Reviews: A kitsch restaurant with an American diner-like decor. Seats are comfortable and service is efficient. We were only there for coffee and dessert. Can't say anything about food but cr√®me br√ªl√©e was ok. The sugarcoating layer was a bit thin, but good. | Tasty food, nice atmosphere and life music too! I really enjoyed my dinner with family there. | The accent is on perfection at this elegant, fine dining restaurant. The whole experience, from delicious, perfectly executed food to attentive, charming service instantly transports you to a spectacular restaurant in France. The experience is just flawless | horrible. My friend and I went here for lunch, both of our meals weren't seasoned and it was obvious that the fries and vegetables had been heated from frozen | Found this spot walking by the area. They advertise a formula dinner 13.95 euro for appetizer- dinner or dinner - dessert. But once you sit down, you are informed of the extra 1.50 euro surcharge for weekend, holidays and evening. That s a big downer right off the bat.  Happy hour drink prices are reasonable.  The food is ok... I ordered the ≈ìuf poche √† la bordelaise (Bordeaux a poached egg) and the Dos de Colin fondue de poireaux, sauce vierge ( Black hake with leeks and virgin sauce). It s a bit salty but will hit the spot especially when one is hungry.  There s not a line here and that should always be a clue....  The service is basic. The waiter seems more interested in attracting cute ladies passing by than clients... lol... he should be a bouncer at some club instead.  The view is on the famous Bachir Ice Cream place. Now, check that place out when you can for dessert!
Keywords: Le Chouchou, kitsch restaurant, American diner decor, comfortable seats, efficient service, cr√®me br√ªl√©e, tasty food, nice atmosphere, live music, fine dining, elegant, French experience, flawless service, unseasoned food, frozen fries, affordable formula dinner, surcharge, happy hour drinks, ≈ìuf poche √† la bordelaise, Dos de Colin, salty food, basic service, attracted to passersby, view of Bachir Ice Cream.

Name: Le Potager du Marais
Reviews: Hearty vegan meal serving traditional French cuisine! This was a good/casual atmosphere with other options for regular folks. | Delicious dinner here! We didn't have a reservation but we're able to get in (recommend getting a reservation though)! Everything is vegan and almost everything is also gluten free. We had the French onion soup, which was incredible and cheesy, and the buckwheat pancake meal I had was also so good and filling! Service was great here as well and I loved the cozy vibe. | I was super excited to find this place in order to enjoy some French classics in plant-based form.  We dropped in for lunch and when we arrived, shortly after noon, we were the first guests. A few other parties trickled in through the course of our meal.  The menu has many appealing dishes but after narrowing everything down, GF ordered the onion soup and seitan bourguignon. I ordered a vegan "roast" with the side of potatoes.  I'm not going to bullshit you, nobody is going to confuse this onion soup for the real deal but once you get past that, it was absolutely excellent. You're hearing this from someone who doesn't like onions or beef broth. I wanted to just try it but ended up funneling half of it down my gullet.  The roast was pretty good, as were the potatoes and what I assume was a creamy cauliflower "salad" like side. It was nothing earth shattering but enjoyable and I really appreciated having a vegan meal considering the vast majority of the offerings in this city.  Regarding the beef bourguignon, GF says: "it was very tasty".  I will add that the service was...just ok. It was pretty quick and prompt but in stark contrast to the welcoming and friendly service received elsewhere in the city. | Excellent service and very friendly staff. If you are vegan (or if you have a vegan friend) this is the place to go. The friendly staff will explain all the plates. Excellent decor, great organic wines, and very interesting and flavorful vegan dishes. | Love this vegan restaurant. Nice ambiance, in between casual and fine dining. The food is delicious. Definitely get dessert!
Keywords: - Restaurant Name: Le Potager du Marais - Cuisine: Vegan, French - Unique Dishes: French onion soup, seitan bourguignon, vegan "roast", buckwheat pancake - Ambiance: Cozy, casual, nice decor - Special Features: Almost everything gluten-free, organic wines, friendly staff, good service - Positive Mentions: Delicious food, hearty vegan meals, traditional French classics in plant-based form, good for vegans, great desserts, excellent and flavorful dishes, good options for regular folks, accommodating with reservations, unique and appealing menu, cozy vibe, enjoyable dining experience

Name: Le Caf√© de la Grande Epicerie
Reviews: No reviews
Keywords: Cuisine: French, Pastries, Bakery Dishes: Croissants, Macarons, Quiches Ambiance: Charming, Cozy, Parisian Special Features: Outdoor Seating, Friendly Staff Positive Mentions: Delicious Food, Authentic French Flavors, Excellent Service

Name: le cambodge
Reviews: While in Paris we experienced the Cambodian food. We were desperately seeking a Chinese restaurant but to no avail. Luckily, we ran into a British guy that knew exactly where a Cambodian restaurant was and out of desperation we agreed that would suffice. After he mockingly yelled, "You want Chinese food here in Paris? Are you F@%ing jokin mon?" and we all had a hearty laugh he pointed us to the right location.  The area was quant similar to NYC the real estate is hard to come by in Paris so we had to make way for a family of five right in the middle of the kitchen traffic, this was not pleasant but the food made up for it. Lot's of varieties to choose from, tasteful and although not a direct Cambodian fanny I enjoyed the mix of noodle, vegetable and curry sauce known as kroeung.  Yes, similar to Indian curry but straight out of the Khmer kitchen although, geographically it did not make sense....Indian curry in a Cambodian restaurant in the middle France they still came out with four stars after all why should I penalize them for my ignorance right? | I was really excited to try Le Cambodge! I ordered take out. The woman who took my order was very nice. My meal was just okay. I ordered the Lo Lak, and the meat was very chewy. I could barely eat it. The rice needed salt. The spring rolls were good though! | After a delayed and missed flight (my fault) we were very tired and wanted to have our first meal in Paris.  Since I am very fond of the Cambodian cuisine and the French colonized Cambodia for almost 90 years, hoping to find some excellent grub.  Service was very disorganized and the server kept trying to talk us out of ordering items saying "they are too big for the 3 of us to share". I said it is fine I still want to proceed with the order.  The food and service were both a let down.
